original: gang gi dbang du byas te ngan pa zhes bya smad ce na /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas te ngan pa zhes bya smad ce na /
translated: What is it that is called bad and contemptible?

original: smras pa khyod ni zhes bya ba rga ba ste /
analyzed: smras pa khyod ni zhes bya ba rga ba ste /
translated: It is said: “You are old age.”

original: rga ba khyod la smad par bya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rga ba khyod la smad par bya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that old age is what is to be despised.

original: gang la smad par bya ba de la bod pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la smad par bya ba de la bod pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: The method of despising it is taught.

original: rga ba ni lus mi sdug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rga ba ni lus mi sdug par byed pa ste /
translated: Old age makes the body ugly.

original: gang gi phyir smad pas smad pa'i tshul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir smad pas smad pa'i tshul du byas pa'o //
translated: Since it is despised, it is what is to be despised.

original: blun pa zhes bya ba ni blun pa las skyes pa yin pas blun pa ste /
analyzed: blun pa zhes bya ba ni blun pa las skyes pa yin pas blun pa ste /
translated: “Foolish” means that which is born from foolishness, and so is foolish.

original: rga ba las bye brag mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rga ba las bye brag mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that old age is what does not distinguish.

original: mi rigs pa byed pa'i phyir yang blun pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rigs pa byed pa'i phyir yang blun pa yin te /
translated: It is also foolish because it does what is not right.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blun pa 'dis ni 'di ltar thams cad la khyod mi rigs pa byed pa yin te /
analyzed: blun pa 'dis ni 'di ltar thams cad la khyod mi rigs pa byed pa yin te /
translated: Because this foolishness does this to everything:

original: lus sdug pa dang bral bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus sdug pa dang bral bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: it makes the body lose its beauty.

original: de ltar thams cad du mi rigs pa byed par ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du mi rigs pa byed par ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known that it does what is not right in every way?

original: smras pa / yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs 'di yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs 'di yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is destroyed by you, O Death!

original: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku yid du 'ong ba gang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du bsags pas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad bcus rnam par mdzes pa de lta bu'i yid du 'ong ba'i 'jig rten na de las ches yid du 'ong ba ni cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku yid du 'ong ba gang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du bsags pas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad bcus rnam par mdzes pa de lta bu'i yid du 'ong ba'i 'jig rten na de las ches yid du 'ong ba ni cung zad kyang med de /
translated: This beautiful form of the Lord Buddha, which is produced by the great accumulations of merit and knowledge gathered over three incalculable aeons, is beautified by the thirty-two marks of a great person and the eighty minor characteristics. There is nothing in the world even slightly more beautiful than that.

original: de khyod kyis mngon par bcom par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de khyod kyis mngon par bcom par byas pa'o //
translated: You have utterly destroyed it.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'o //
translated: This is like that.

original: yid mngon par dga' bar byed pa yin pas yid du 'ong ba ste sems dga' ba'o //
analyzed: yid mngon par dga' bar byed pa yin pas yid du 'ong ba ste sems dga' ba'o //
translated: It is beautiful because it delights the mind, that is, it delights the mind.

original: gzugs ni lus so //
analyzed: gzugs ni lus so //
translated: Form is the body.

original: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni rga bas te /
analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni rga bas te /
translated: You, O Death, destroy it.

original: gang 'di ltar mngon par bcom pa ste zil gyis mnan pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di ltar mngon par bcom pa ste zil gyis mnan pa'o //
translated: You utterly destroy it, that is, you overcome it.

original: de ltar thub pa mchog sems can thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa'i sku la yang rga ba'i chos yod na //
analyzed: de ltar thub pa mchog sems can thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa'i sku la yang rga ba'i chos yod na //
translated: Thus, if the body of the Supreme Sage, which is superior to all sentient beings, is subject to aging,

original: gzhan dag gi lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
translated: what need is there to mention others?

original: lus la @81b lhag par chags pa spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: lus la @81b lhag par chags pa spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to abandon excessive attachment to the body.

original: 'dir rga ba 'ba' zhig gis gtses par ma zad de 'chi ba la sogs pas kyang gtses pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig lo ni brgyar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir rga ba 'ba' zhig gis gtses par ma zad de 'chi ba la sogs pas kyang gtses pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig lo ni brgyar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Here, it is not only aging that afflicts, but also death and so on. To demonstrate this, it says Whoever lives for a hundred years... and so on.

original: mnyan yod na tshong dpon chen po shin tu tshe ring ba zhig nad dang rga bas mngon par gtses te shi ba las bsod snyoms la song bdag gis shes te de lta bu'i gtam bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag las gsan te /
analyzed: mnyan yod na tshong dpon chen po shin tu tshe ring ba zhig nad dang rga bas mngon par gtses te shi ba las bsod snyoms la song bdag gis shes te de lta bu'i gtam bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag las gsan te /
translated: In Śrāvastī, a certain great merchant, who was very long-lived, was afflicted by illness and aging. He died. I learned this while going for alms. The Blessed One heard such a conversation from those monks.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One spoke this:

original: gang gi tshe 'chi bar 'gyur ba ni dus dang dus ma yin par yang 'chi ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi bar 'gyur ba ni dus dang dus ma yin par yang 'chi ste /
translated: When one dies, one dies at the right time and at the wrong time.

original: ji ltar nad dang rga bas phal cher 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dir ston to zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar nad dang rga bas phal cher 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dir ston to zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the summary is that one dies mostly from disease and old age.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni gang la la ste thams cad kyang mthar 'chi ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni gang la la ste thams cad kyang mthar 'chi ba yin no //
translated: Whoever means whoever, and all die in the end.

original: yang gi sgras ni dus ma yin par yang 'chi bar ston to //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni dus ma yin par yang 'chi bar ston to //
translated: The word also indicates death at the wrong time.

original: lo brgya zhes bya ba ni lo brgya ste /
analyzed: lo brgya zhes bya ba ni lo brgya ste /
translated: One hundred years means one hundred years.

original: dus tshigs brgya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus tshigs brgya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is one hundred seasons.

original: gang zhig dus 'di ji srid du 'tsho bar gyur ba de yang 'chi bdag nyid kyis khrid pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig dus 'di ji srid du 'tsho bar gyur ba de yang 'chi bdag nyid kyis khrid pa yin te /
translated: Whoever lives for this long is also led by the Lord of Death.

original: nges par 'chi ba yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: nges par 'chi ba yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'o //
translated: The word also means that one definitely dies.

original: nges pa med de gang zhig lo brgya 'tsho ba yang ste /
analyzed: nges pa med de gang zhig lo brgya 'tsho ba yang ste /
translated: There is no certainty. Whoever lives for one hundred years

original: lo stong dang 'brel ba med pa 'di ni dus de tsam du yang sems can de 'chi ba las phyogs par nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lo stong dang 'brel ba med pa 'di ni dus de tsam du yang sems can de 'chi ba las phyogs par nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that even for that long, it is certain that the sentient being will die.

original: ji ltar 'chi ba dag gis khrid ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'chi ba dag gis khrid ce na /
translated: How is it that death leads them?

original: smras pa / 'di dag ces bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'am rjes su 'brang ba ste srog chags so //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di dag ces bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'am rjes su 'brang ba ste srog chags so //
translated: The text says: “these” refers to those who follow or accompany, that is, living beings.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: smras pa / rga ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / rga ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The text says: “aging.”

original: rga bas 'joms shing gnod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rga bas 'joms shing gnod par byed pa ste /
translated: Aging destroys and harms them.

original: gang lo brgya tshang bar lon pa de ni rga bas bcom pa ste gzugs rnyed par byas shing che'i gnas med pa ste smin pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: gang lo brgya tshang bar lon pa de ni rga bas bcom pa ste gzugs rnyed par byas shing che'i gnas med pa ste smin pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: One who lives a full hundred years is destroyed by aging, for aging makes the body unattractive and devoid of strength, like a ripe fruit.

original: gang ma tshang bar nad kyis bcom pa ni 'di nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang ma tshang bar nad kyis bcom pa ni 'di nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to show that one who dies before a full life span is destroyed by sickness,

original: yang na na ba'am zhes smos te /
analyzed: yang na na ba'am zhes smos te /
translated: the text says: “or by sickness.”

original: la la 'dod chags bdo bas kyang 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la 'dod chags bdo bas kyang 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some are destroyed by the intensity of passion.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su brtag pa ste /
translated: “Or” indicates that there are two alternatives.

original: rga ba ma byung bar yang gang la la dag nad kyis bcom ste shi ba yin no zhes thos te /
analyzed: rga ba ma byung bar yang gang la la dag nad kyis bcom ste shi ba yin no zhes thos te /
translated: We have heard that some people die before old age,🔽overcome by illness, just like the noble Pūrṇa and others,

original: dper na 'phags pa pi lin nga'i bu la sogs pa lta bu ste shing tog ma smin pa dbyig pas bsnun pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa pi lin nga'i bu la sogs pa lta bu ste shing tog ma smin pa dbyig pas bsnun pa lta bu'o //
translated: like unripe fruit struck by hail.🔽When neither of these two is present, death destroys them,

original: de gnyi ga med cing mi rtag pa ni sngon gyi las kyi @82a * //🔽dbang gis 'chi bas 'joms par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga med cing mi rtag pa ni sngon gyi las kyi @82a * // dbang gis 'chi bas 'joms par 'gyur te /
translated: since they are impermanent, by the power of previous karma.

original: gang tshe thung ba'i las 'dzin par 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang tshe thung ba'i las 'dzin par 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that karma which holds the life force, it says:

original: 'chi bas 'joms zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'chi bas 'joms zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “destroyed by death.”

original: yang na 'chi bdag nyid kyis 'di dag 'joms par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang na 'chi bdag nyid kyis 'di dag 'joms par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te /
translated: Or, the meaning is that they are destroyed by the Lord of Death himself,

original: mngal la sogs pa na yang 'chi ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngal la sogs pa na yang 'chi ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because death exists even in the womb and so on.

original: nad dang rga ba ni bcud kyis len la sogs pas de bcos su yod kyi /
analyzed: nad dang rga ba ni bcud kyis len la sogs pas de bcos su yod kyi /
translated: Disease and old age can be treated by tonics and so on,

original: 'chi ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: but not death, as has been taught.

original: srog dang nad med pa dang lang tsho'i dregs pas dregs pa rnams la de'i dregs pa spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: srog dang nad med pa dang lang tsho'i dregs pas dregs pa rnams la de'i dregs pa spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to remove the pride of those who are proud with the pride of life, health, and youth.

original: 'dus byas rnams ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la ma brten par skad cig mas 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la ma brten par skad cig mas 'jig pa yin te /
translated: Compounded things are destroyed by momentariness without relying on a cause of destruction.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that they are destroyed by their very nature, it is said:

original: rtag tu 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag tu 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Always moving, etc.”

original: aa yo rgya ya zhes bya ba'i grong khyer chu bo gang g'a dang nye ba na /
analyzed: aa yo rgya ya zhes bya ba'i grong khyer chu bo gang g'a dang nye ba na /
translated: In the city of Ayodhyā, near the river Ganges,

original: nya pa shin tu rgas shing 'khogs pa zhig gnas te nya gson dag bye thang gi steng du chu rab tu khol ba dag yod pa'i nang du brtse ba med pas bcug ste /
analyzed: nya pa shin tu rgas shing 'khogs pa zhig gnas te nya gson dag bye thang gi steng du chu rab tu khol ba dag yod pa'i nang du brtse ba med pas bcug ste /
translated: there lived a very old and decrepit fisherman. He mercilessly threw live fish onto the hot sand.

original: de ltar 'gul ba la lta zhing dga' ba dang dgod pa gzigs te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gul ba la lta zhing dga' ba dang dgod pa gzigs te /
translated: He watched them wriggle and laughed with delight.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: With him in mind, these verses were spoken.

original: sems can 'di dag ni rgyun mi 'chad cing ldog pa med pas 'chi ba'i drung du skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni rgyun mi 'chad cing ldog pa med pas 'chi ba'i drung du skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The summary of the meaning of this verse is: “These sentient beings are going to the presence of death in an uninterrupted and irreversible stream of instants.”

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs thams cad du 'chi bdag gi drung du 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs thams cad du 'chi bdag gi drung du 'gro ba yin te /
translated: “Always” means that one is going to the presence of the Lord of Death at all times.

original: byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dang / bar ma dang / rgan pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'thob pa yin pas rtag tu 'gro ba nyid yin zhing gnas skabs gang du yang mi sdod pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dang / bar ma dang / rgan pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'thob pa yin pas rtag tu 'gro ba nyid yin zhing gnas skabs gang du yang mi sdod pa'o //
translated: Because one obtains the states of childhood, youth, adulthood, middle age, and old age, one is always going and does not remain in any state.

original: ci re zhig na ldog par yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci re zhig na ldog par yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: “But at some point, won’t one stop?”

original: smras pa / ldog pa med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / ldog pa med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “There is no stopping.”

original: 'dis ni nges par gzung ba'i 'bras bu bstan te //
analyzed: 'dis ni nges par gzung ba'i 'bras bu bstan te //
translated: This shows the result of the ascertainment.

original: gnas skabs phyi mar song bas gnas skabs snga mar mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs phyi mar song bas gnas skabs snga mar mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because one has gone to a later state, one does not remain in an earlier state.

original: gal te mtshan mo dang nyin mor ldog par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan mo dang nyin mor ldog par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: “But won’t one stop at night and during the day?”

original: smras pa / nyin dang mtshan du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / nyin dang mtshan du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: “day and night” is stated.

original: nyin zhes bya ba ni nyin par te /
analyzed: nyin zhes bya ba ni nyin par te /
translated: “Day” means daytime.

original: mtshan mo yang yin no //
analyzed: mtshan mo yang yin no //
translated: “Night” means nighttime.

original: zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / lo la sogs pa 'di ni rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir de tsam du bshad do //
analyzed: zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / lo la sogs pa 'di ni rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir de tsam du bshad do //
translated: This is explained as just that because it is a synonym for half a month, a month, a year, and so on.

original: @82b rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma re re la gzugs dang nad med pa dang stobs la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @82b rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma re re la gzugs dang nad med pa dang stobs la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Complete destruction” means the complete exhaustion of the distinction of form, health, strength, and so on in each moment. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: 'di dag gis ni na tshod kyi gnas skabs nyin par dang mtshan mo re re la skad cig mas mi rtag pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni na tshod kyi gnas skabs nyin par dang mtshan mo re re la skad cig mas mi rtag pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: By these, the impermanence of the stages of youth in each day and night is taught by the moment.

original: lhag mas ni sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: lhag mas ni sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The remainder is stated in order to teach the suffering of suffering.

original: chu tshan zhes bya ba smos pa ni las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: chu tshan zhes bya ba smos pa ni las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba ste /
translated: He says: “hot water” is a collection of the elements.

original: chu yang yin la tsha ba yang yin pas chu tshan te /
analyzed: chu yang yin la tsha ba yang yin pas chu tshan te /
translated: It is water and it is hot, thus it is hot water.

original: chu de'i nang du bskol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chu de'i nang du bskol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “boiled in that hot water.

original: yang na gang la chu tsha ba yod pa'i thang ste /🔽rab tu bskol ba'i chu'i nang du'o //
analyzed: yang na gang la chu tsha ba yod pa'i thang ste / rab tu bskol ba'i chu'i nang du'o //
translated: ” Or else, a plain where there is hot water.🔽“In the midst of boiling water” means:

original: nya dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nya lta bu'o //
analyzed: nya dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nya lta bu'o //
translated: “like a fish.

original: gdungs pa zhes bya ba ni bskol ba'o //
analyzed: gdungs pa zhes bya ba ni bskol ba'o //
translated: ” “Tormented” means: boiled.

original: ji ltar nya chu tshan gyi nang du bcug ste bskol ba de bzhin du sems can 'di dag kyang rab tu sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nya chu tshan gyi nang du bcug ste bskol ba de bzhin du sems can 'di dag kyang rab tu sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: Just as a fish is placed in hot water and boiled, so too are these sentient beings greatly suffering.

original: sems can 'di dag ji ltar sdug bsngal ba yin zhe na //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ji ltar sdug bsngal ba yin zhe na //
translated: How are these sentient beings suffering?

original: smras pa / skye dang 'chi ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / skye dang 'chi ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: “due to birth and death.

original: sdug bsngal ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa mi 'dod pas so //
translated: ” Suffering is due to the undesirability of formations, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid smras pa //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid smras pa //
translated: The nature of suffering is stated:

original: skye dang 'chi ba'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye dang 'chi ba'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “due to birth and death.

original: 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” Because of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor bas ni skye ba dang 'jig pa mtshon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khor bas ni skye ba dang 'jig pa mtshon pa'i phyir te /
translated: For cyclic existence is characterized by birth and death.

original: gnyis pa 'khrul 'khor dang 'dra bas 'gro ba rnams gzir ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa 'khrul 'khor dang 'dra bas 'gro ba rnams gzir ba yin te /
translated: (2) The second is like a machine, because it oppresses beings.

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs dang ldan pa dang 'byor ba dang lang tsho la sogs pa yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du bstan pas 'khor ba la lhag par chags pa spangs ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs dang ldan pa dang 'byor ba dang lang tsho la sogs pa yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du bstan pas 'khor ba la lhag par chags pa spangs ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs
translated: Because it is endowed with the three kinds of suffering, it is shown to be a transformation of desirable things such as family, wealth, and youth. In order to abandon excessive attachment to cyclic existence, these verses were spoken.

original: so // dus thams cad dang spyod lam thams cad du srog 'gag pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: so // dus thams cad dang spyod lam thams cad du srog 'gag pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Because life is always interrupted in all circumstances, it is said:

original: tshe 'di nyin dang mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros so //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyin dang mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros so //
translated: This life, day and night, etc.

original: ri gangs can gyi gnas na drang srong lnga brgya rga ba dang 'chi ba med par bya ba'i phyir dka' thub spyod cing 'dug go //
analyzed: ri gangs can gyi gnas na drang srong lnga brgya rga ba dang 'chi ba med par bya ba'i phyir dka' thub spyod cing 'dug go //
translated: In the abode of the snowy mountains, five hundred sages were practicing austerities in order to become free from old age and death.

original: de 'dul ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das der gshegs te /
analyzed: de 'dul ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das der gshegs te /
translated: In order to tame them, the Blessed One went there.

original: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas ni ngan song du 'gro'o zhes bstan cing skyo ba bskyed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas ni ngan song du 'gro'o zhes bstan cing skyo ba bskyed de /
translated: By the discursive thoughts of desire, etc., one goes to the miserable destinies.

original: ri ba kha ba can gyi phyogs ri'i steng nas 'og tu gang g'a'i chu rgyun 'bab pa la gzigs shing srog la mi 'chi bar bag phab ste 'dug pa de'i dbang du mdzad de 'di @83a * //
analyzed: ri ba kha ba can gyi phyogs ri'i steng nas 'og tu gang g'a'i chu rgyun 'bab pa la gzigs shing srog la mi 'chi bar bag phab ste 'dug pa de'i dbang du mdzad de 'di @83a * //
translated: He was sitting on the top of a mountain in the snowy Himalayas, looking at the Ganges flowing below, and he was relaxed, not concerned about his life.🔽This was the occasion for this verse.

original: gsungs so // rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par tshe zad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don du bstan to //
analyzed: gsungs so // rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par tshe zad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don du bstan to //
translated: The phrase life is always being consumed teaches the condensed meaning.

original: tshe ni srog go //
analyzed: tshe ni srog go //
translated: Life is the same as life force.

original: nyin dang mtshan mo ni nyi ma dang mun pa'o //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo ni nyi ma dang mun pa'o //
translated: Day and night are the same as sun and moon.

original: 'dis ni dus thams cad du tshe zad par bstan to //🔽'gro ba dang ni zhes bya ba ni gal te 'gro na yang grib ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dus thams cad du tshe zad par bstan to // 'gro ba dang ni zhes bya ba ni gal te 'gro na yang grib ma bzhin no //
translated: This teaches that life is always being consumed.🔽The phrase whether moving or sitting means that even if one moves, it is like a shadow.

original: 'dug pa na zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa bzhin te //
analyzed: 'dug pa na zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa bzhin te //
translated: The phrase whether sitting means that even if one sits, it is like the in-breath and out-breath.

original: 'dug pa na yang lus kyi gnas skabs thams cad du ste /
analyzed: 'dug pa na yang lus kyi gnas skabs thams cad du ste /
translated: Sitting is a condition of the body.

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs lus kyi spyod lam thams cad yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs lus kyi spyod lam thams cad yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: All the bodily postures, whether moving or unmoving, are completely taken up.

original: 'dir dpe bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dir dpe bstan pa /
translated: Here, an example is taught:

original: chu klung chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chu klung chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Like the current of a great river, etc.

original: rgyun ni chu'i rgyun no //
analyzed: rgyun ni chu'i rgyun no //
translated: The current is the flow of the water.

original: chu klung chen po ni chu bo gang g'a la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu klung chen po ni chu bo gang g'a la sogs pa'o //
translated: A great river is the Ganges, etc.

original: bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: Like is the example.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thug pa med par 'gro bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thug pa med par 'gro bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: It goes is taught to be an endless going.

original: tshe ni chu klung chen po'i chu bzhin no //
analyzed: tshe ni chu klung chen po'i chu bzhin no //
translated: Life is like the water of a great river.

original: phyir mi ldog par zhes bya ba ni tshe 'das par yang ldog ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par zhes bya ba ni tshe 'das par yang ldog ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not returning is because there is no return even after life has passed.

original: chu klung chen po dang 'dra bar ni sems can no //
analyzed: chu klung chen po dang 'dra bar ni sems can no //
translated: Like a great river, sentient beings.

original: rgyun lta bu ni tshe'o //
analyzed: rgyun lta bu ni tshe'o //
translated: Like a current, life.

original: ji ltar gnas skabs thams cad du chu bo chen po'i rgyun 'gro zhing ldog pa med pa de bzhin du tshe yang de lta bu'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas skabs thams cad du chu bo chen po'i rgyun 'gro zhing ldog pa med pa de bzhin du tshe yang de lta bu'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Just as the current of a great river goes and does not return in all circumstances, so is life taught to be.

original: tshe rtag pa yin no zhes rtog pa spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe rtag pa yin no zhes rtog pa spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was stated in order to abandon the conception that life is permanent.

original: chos kyi sku ni rtag pa nyid de mchog tu 'gyur pa med pa dang 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni rtag pa nyid de mchog tu 'gyur pa med pa dang 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Dharma Body is permanent, because it is supreme and unchanging, and because it is the fruit of desire.

original: gzugs kyi lus ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi lus ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not the form body, it is said:

original: gson mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gson mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The end of life, etc.

original: mnyan yod na au ta ra zhes bya ba'i gnas brtan na tshod lo brgyad cu cam lon pa las rab tu byung ba rga ba dang nad kyis shin tu gtses shing nyam thag ste /
analyzed: mnyan yod na au ta ra zhes bya ba'i gnas brtan na tshod lo brgyad cu cam lon pa las rab tu byung ba rga ba dang nad kyis shin tu gtses shing nyam thag ste /
translated: In Śrāvastī, there was an elder named Utta, who had gone forth at the age of eighty. He was very much afflicted by old age and disease, and was in distress.

original: stan las ldang ba dang rtsol ba la sogs pa mi nus pa zhig yod de khyad par du de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: stan las ldang ba dang rtsol ba la sogs pa mi nus pa zhig yod de khyad par du de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: He was unable to rise from his seat, or to exert himself, and so forth. This was stated with particular reference to him.🔽The purpose of this is to abandon pride in youth.

original: lang tshos dregs pa spang phyir dang // rga ba dang nad kyis 'jig cing 'chi ba dang / mi gtsang ba nyid du bstan pa ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: lang tshos dregs pa spang phyir dang // rga ba dang nad kyis 'jig cing 'chi ba dang / mi gtsang ba nyid du bstan pa ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The destruction of old age and disease, and the teaching of impurity, are the condensed meaning here.

original: yongs su rga ba dang zhes bya ba ni rga bas yongs su nyams shing bcom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su rga ba dang zhes bya ba ni rga bas yongs su nyams shing bcom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “It is completely aged” means that it is completely worn out and destroyed by aging.

original: lus 'di zhes bya ba ni zin pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: lus 'di zhes bya ba ni zin pa'i phung po'o //
translated: “This body” refers to the appropriated aggregates.

original: nad kyi tshang zhes bya ba ni nad kyi gnas so //
analyzed: nad kyi tshang zhes bya ba ni nad kyi gnas so //
translated: “A nest of disease” means a place of disease.

original: myur du 'jig cing zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid du bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid du @83b 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: myur du 'jig cing zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid du bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid du @83b 'dis bstan to //
translated: “It quickly perishes” means that it is perishable by nature. This shows that it is perishable by nature.

original: mchog tu 'jig pa'i ngang tshul gyi gzhi yin te rkyen tshogs pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i bdag nyid de ji ltar las spyod pas yan lag dang nying lag rnams la mtshon la sogs pas lus bcad pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu 'jig pa'i ngang tshul gyi gzhi yin te rkyen tshogs pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i bdag nyid de ji ltar las spyod pas yan lag dang nying lag rnams la mtshon la sogs pas lus bcad pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the highest perishability, because it is perishable by the mere coming together of conditions. It is perishable by nature, just as the limbs and minor parts of the body are cut off by weapons, etc., in accordance with one’s actions.

original: 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bral ba ste /
translated: “It perishes” means that it is destroyed.

original: gzugs kyi lus dang ming gi tshogs bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi lus dang ming gi tshogs bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: The body of form and the collection of names are destroyed.

original: 'dis ni 'chi ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'chi ba nyid ston to //
translated: This shows that it is subject to death.

original: 'dis dus ji srid gnas pa'i dus de srid kyi bar du gtsang ba dang dri zhim pa'i rdzas 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis dus ji srid gnas pa'i dus de srid kyi bar du gtsang ba dang dri zhim pa'i rdzas 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: For as long as it endures, does it have the nature of a collection of pure, fragrant substances?

original: de yang med par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de yang med par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it does not, he says:

original: rnag gi tshogs kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnag gi tshogs kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: A collection of pus,

original: dri nga ba'i rdzas bsags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sgra ba dag tshogs ni lus so zhes brjod pas rnag gi tshogs ma yin pa'i zhes gzhan du brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dri nga ba'i rdzas bsags pa zhes bya ba'i don to // sgra ba dag tshogs ni lus so zhes brjod pas rnag gi tshogs ma yin pa'i zhes gzhan du brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: meaning a collection of foul-smelling substances.🔽Since the body is called a collection of bones, it would be called something else, namely, a collection of pus.

original: dri nga ba'i rdzas 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni lus ma yin pa yang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dri nga ba'i rdzas 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni lus ma yin pa yang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is a collection of foul-smelling substances, it would not be the body. This is the meaning of the statement, “It would be destroyed.”

original: ci'i phyir 'di ni nges par 'jig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ni nges par 'jig pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it certain that it would be destroyed?

original: mtha' 'chi ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mtha' 'chi ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Because death is its end.”

original: gang gi phyir srog thams cad ni mthar 'chi ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog thams cad ni mthar 'chi ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all life ends in death.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa smras pa /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa smras pa /
translated: He states the reasoning of reality:

original: ji ltar me ni tsha ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar me ni tsha ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Just as it is said, “Fire has the nature of heat,” etc.

original: gang gi phyir srog yod cing lus gnas pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni srog 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog yod cing lus gnas pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni srog 'jig pa yin te /
translated: Because life exists and the body is present, this is the destruction of life.

original: des na gnas nyams na gnas pa nyams pa'i phyir nges par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gnas nyams na gnas pa nyams pa'i phyir nges par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the body is destroyed, life is destroyed.

original: lang tsho la sogs pas dregs pa dag la de spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: lang tsho la sogs pas dregs pa dag la de spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to abandon the conceit of youth, etc.

original: 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa la 'di ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa la 'di ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: It was taught that “it will be destroyed.” How will it be destroyed?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / kye ma lus 'di mi thogs par //
analyzed: smras pa / kye ma lus 'di mi thogs par //
translated: Alas, this body will not last long.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This was said, etc.

original: mnyan yod na bcom ldan 'das dur khrod du gshegs shing rgyu ba na phyogs 'ga' zhig na shi ba'i ro myags pa dag gzigs te /
analyzed: mnyan yod na bcom ldan 'das dur khrod du gshegs shing rgyu ba na phyogs 'ga' zhig na shi ba'i ro myags pa dag gzigs te /
translated: The Blessed One, while going to the charnel ground, saw in a certain place the bloated corpses of those who had died.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa rigs mtho ba las rab tu byung ba dag zhag bdun gyi 'og tu nges par 'chi ba las brtsams te 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa rigs mtho ba las rab tu byung ba dag zhag bdun gyi 'og tu nges par 'chi ba las brtsams te 'di gsungs so //
translated: Beginning with the definite death of those who have gone forth from high castes such as kings, etc., after seven days, this was taught.

original: lus 'di mi rtag pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus 'di mi rtag pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the summary meaning.

original: mi thogs pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring por mi thogs pa ste zhag bdun tsam gnas pa yin pa'i phyir @84a * //
analyzed: mi thogs pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring por mi thogs pa ste zhag bdun tsam gnas pa yin pa'i phyir @84a * //
translated: Without delay means not after a long time, because it remains for only seven days.

original: srog ni myur du 'chi ba'i chos nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: srog ni myur du 'chi ba'i chos nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: Life is taught to have the nature of quick death.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba ni srog chags dang / de'i lus la snying brtse ba dang rjes su brtse ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba ni srog chags dang / de'i lus la snying brtse ba dang rjes su brtse ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word alas indicates compassion and sympathy for the living being and its body.

original: lus 'di zhes bya ba ni zin pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: lus 'di zhes bya ba ni zin pa'i phung po'o //
translated: This body refers to the appropriated aggregates.

original: sa'i steng du zhes bya ba ni dur khrod la sogs pa'i sa phyogs so //
analyzed: sa'i steng du zhes bya ba ni dur khrod la sogs pa'i sa phyogs so //
translated: On the ground refers to the earth in a charnel ground, etc.

original: 'gyel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lhags pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lhags pa ste /
translated: Will be cast means will be thrown.

original: sa'i steng du lhung zhing gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: sa'i steng du lhung zhing gnas pa'i don to //
translated: It means will fall on the ground and remain there.

original: stong zhing zhes bya ba ni gnas pa gsum dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: stong zhing zhes bya ba ni gnas pa gsum dang bral ba ste /
translated: Empty means devoid of the three abodes.

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means selfless.

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa'i bdag de yang mi gnas sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa'i bdag de yang mi gnas sam zhe na /
translated: But is not the self of consciousness also impermanent?

original: smras pa / rnam shes dang bral nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam shes dang bral nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: “When it is separated from consciousness.”

original: bral ba ni so sor bral ba ste /
analyzed: bral ba ni so sor bral ba ste /
translated: “Separated” means individually separated.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di las bral zhing sems dang bral ba'i don te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di las bral zhing sems dang bral ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that it is separated from consciousness and separated from mind.

original: ji skad du /🔽tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //
analyzed: ji skad du / tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //
translated: As it is said:🔽When this body is abandoned

original: gang tshe lus 'di spangs pa na //
analyzed: gang tshe lus 'di spangs pa na //
translated: By life, heat, and consciousness,

original: dper na sems med shing bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na sems med shing bzhin du //
translated: Like a senseless log

original: sa yi steng du nyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sa yi steng du nyal bar 'gyur //
translated: It will lie on the ground.

original: zhes so // bdag med cing rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'chi ba yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // bdag med cing rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'chi ba yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that because it is without self and is separated from consciousness, it dies.

original: 'dir dpe bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dir dpe bstan pa /
translated: Here the example is taught:

original: dur khrod por ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dur khrod por ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: “Like a discarded corpse in a charnel ground.”

original: dur khrod bor ba'i mgal dum bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dur khrod bor ba'i mgal dum bzhin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a charred log in a charnel ground.🔽Here “charnel ground” means a place where corpses are discarded.

original: dgos pa med pa'i shing yin te //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i shing yin te //
translated: “Charred log” means a piece of wood that is useless.

original: skyes bu shing gi bsags pa byed par 'dod pas nags tshal du zhugs te /
analyzed: skyes bu shing gi bsags pa byed par 'dod pas nags tshal du zhugs te /
translated: A person who wants to collect wood enters a forest.

original: shing drang po bcad cing blangs nas lhag ma khong stong dang rul pa dgos pa med cing /
analyzed: shing drang po bcad cing blangs nas lhag ma khong stong dang rul pa dgos pa med cing /
translated: A straight tree is cut down and taken away, and the remaining stump, hollow and rotten, is of no use.

original: snying po med pa'i shing ni yongs su 'dor ba yin no //🔽dper na nags tshal dag na dgos pa med pa'i shing dag bor na spyod pa med cing gnas pa de bzhin du lus 'di yang rang bzhin gyis bdag gis stong la rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na g-yo ba med cing dur khrod
analyzed: snying po med pa'i shing ni yongs su 'dor ba yin no // dper na nags tshal dag na dgos pa med pa'i shing dag bor na spyod pa med cing gnas pa de bzhin du lus 'di yang rang bzhin gyis bdag gis stong la rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na g-yo ba med cing dur khrod
translated: The tree that is without heartwood is completely discarded.

original: kyi phyogs na 'gyel bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: kyi phyogs na 'gyel bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Just as in a forest, trees that are of no use are cut down and discarded, and those that remain are used, in the same way, this body is naturally empty of self, and when it is separated from consciousness and the time of death arrives, it is motionless and falls to the ground in the charnel ground.

original: gzhan dag ni mgal me'i dum bu yin no zhes 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mgal me'i dum bu yin no zhes 'dod de /
translated: Others assert that it is like a piece of charred wood.

original: sdug pa'i lag mthil gyis gzung dri zhim phreng ba phye ma'i dris mchod cing //
analyzed: sdug pa'i lag mthil gyis gzung dri zhim phreng ba phye ma'i dris mchod cing //
translated: It is worshipped with fragrant garlands and powders on the palm of the hand of the beloved,

original: bde ba'i lus 'di dur khrod gnas su mgal dum ltar ni yongs por nas //
analyzed: bde ba'i lus 'di dur khrod gnas su mgal dum ltar ni yongs por nas //
translated: but this body of pleasure is discarded like a charred log in the charnel ground.

original: gdug pa'i gcan gzan brkam pa'i mthus ni mig dag sha lpags snag gu dag /'jig par byed de ngan pa'i rang bzhin mi brtan 'jig rten sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: gdug pa'i gcan gzan brkam pa'i mthus ni mig dag sha lpags snag gu dag /'jig par byed de ngan pa'i rang bzhin mi brtan 'jig rten sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: The eyes of the carnivorous beasts are like the flesh and skin of the eyes, and the nature of the wicked is unstable, like the illusions of the world.

original: zhe'o // gzhan dag ni sog @84b mar 'dod de /
analyzed: zhe'o // gzhan dag ni sog @84b mar 'dod de /
translated: Others desire the marrow.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar btab kyang rung ste sa bon ni //
analyzed: ji ltar btab kyang rung ste sa bon ni //
translated: No matter how it is planted,

original: bsod nams can gyis lo tog mang po thob //
analyzed: bsod nams can gyis lo tog mang po thob //
translated: the one with merit obtains a great harvest.

original: bsod nams med na ser bas bcom 'gyur te //
analyzed: bsod nams med na ser bas bcom 'gyur te //
translated: If there is no merit, it is destroyed by hail,

original: mgal dum tsam yang 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mgal dum tsam yang 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: and not even a stump remains.

original: zhes so // lus 'di ni tha mar dur khrod pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // lus 'di ni tha mar dur khrod pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This body is ultimately a cemetery.

original: de la lhag par zhen pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de la lhag par zhen pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is said in order to abandon excessive attachment to it.

original: des na yang lus 'di ni nges par dur khrod kyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: des na yang lus 'di ni nges par dur khrod kyi gnas yin te /
translated: Therefore, this body is definitely the abode of the cemetery.

original: 'dis ni 'tsho bar gyur na yang mkhas pa rnams kyis dgos pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'tsho bar gyur na yang mkhas pa rnams kyis dgos pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: This is said in order to show that even when alive, the wise have no need for it.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: rgyun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Always and so on.

original: rma'i sgo nas rab tu 'dzag cing gsher ba dang nye du dang sman pa rnams kyis spangs shing bzhi mdor por ba mdze can zhig gzigs te /
analyzed: rma'i sgo nas rab tu 'dzag cing gsher ba dang nye du dang sman pa rnams kyis spangs shing bzhi mdor por ba mdze can zhig gzigs te /
translated: He saw a leper, whose body was oozing from many wounds, who was abandoned by his relatives and doctors, and who was crying in the crossroads.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag 'di ni nyes pa mang pos ma rung ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni nyes pa mang pos ma rung ba ste /
translated: “Monks, this man is unfit because of his many faults.

original: lus ni byas pa chud gzon pa dang dri nga ba yin no zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: lus ni byas pa chud gzon pa dang dri nga ba yin no zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The body is a waste, and has a bad smell.”

original: dge slong zhig gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong zhig gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: A monk said to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa de ltar lus 'di ni shin tu ma rung ba lags te /
analyzed: btsun pa de ltar lus 'di ni shin tu ma rung ba lags te /
translated: “Reverend, this body is very unfit.

original: shin tu smad cing phyag dar gyi phung po lta bu lags so //
analyzed: shin tu smad cing phyag dar gyi phung po lta bu lags so //
translated: It is very contemptible, like a mass of rubbish.”

original: dge slong dag de de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de de bzhin no //
translated: “Monks, that is the way it is.🔽That is the way it is.”

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so ;
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so ;
translated: He spoke two verses:

original: / gang gi phyir sems can 'di dag brtag par bya na 'di ltar lus 'di la phal cher 'dod pas chags shing gang mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir sems can 'di dag brtag par bya na 'di ltar lus 'di la phal cher 'dod pas chags shing gang mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because these sentient beings are to be examined, this body is mostly seen to be the object of attachment to pleasure, and it is impure, suffering, and impermanent.

original: de la rgyu gang gis 'dir gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa'i phyin ci log gi gnyen po 'dir bstan to zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la rgyu gang gis 'dir gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa'i phyin ci log gi gnyen po 'dir bstan to zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The purpose of this teaching is to remedy the errors of purity, pleasure, and permanence. This is the condensed meaning.

original: yang na bstod pa dang / smad pa la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na bstod pa dang / smad pa la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa'i don to //
translated: Or, it clarifies the meaning of praise, blame, etc.

original: gang smras pa /
analyzed: gang smras pa /
translated: What was said:🔽What is the point of rejecting it?

original: dor ba cir mi rung zhes bya ba ni smad cing bshud pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dor ba cir mi rung zhes bya ba ni smad cing bshud pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a word of blame and reproach.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni zin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni zin pa'o //
translated: This refers to what is grasped.

original: smad par bya ba nyid smras pa /
analyzed: smad par bya ba nyid smras pa /
translated: Having stated what is to be blamed,

original: lus zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: body is mentioned.

original: dri nga ba'i rdzas bsags par gyur ba'i lus te /
analyzed: dri nga ba'i rdzas bsags par gyur ba'i lus te /
translated: The body is a collection of foul-smelling substances.

original: 'dis bya ba cir yang mi rung zhing 'di ci zhig tu dgos zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis bya ba cir yang mi rung zhing 'di ci zhig tu dgos zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: What is the point of this? means What is the use of this?

original: 'di'i khyad par gyi tshul gyis smad pa'i rgyu smras pa /
analyzed: 'di'i khyad par gyi tshul gyis smad pa'i rgyu smras pa /
translated: The cause of contempt is stated in a special way here:

original: mi gtsang 'dzag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi gtsang 'dzag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “It is a source of impure secretions.”

original: 'byung zhing 'dzag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung zhing 'dzag pa yin te /
translated: It is a source of secretions,

original: rma'i sgo dgu nas rgyun mi 'chad par mi gtsang ba rnam pa mang po @85a * //
analyzed: rma'i sgo dgu nas rgyun mi 'chad par mi gtsang ba rnam pa mang po @85a * //
translated: because many kinds of impurities are constantly flowing from the nine orifices.

original: 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'di la mi gtsang zhing dri nga ba yod pa ni mi gtsang ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di la mi gtsang zhing dri nga ba yod pa ni mi gtsang ba ste /
translated: This is the meaning.🔽It is impure because it is foul-smelling.

original: des mi 'dod pa'i dri nga ba dang rab tu nyams pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: des mi 'dod pa'i dri nga ba dang rab tu nyams pa'i dri'o //
translated: It is foul-smelling because it is undesirable, and it is foul-smelling because it is putrid.

original: tshig rkang gnyis pa 'dis ni kha dog dang dri rnam par 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: tshig rkang gnyis pa 'dis ni kha dog dang dri rnam par 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: The second line shows the change in color and smell.

original: de las gzhan pa dang ldan zhing skye ba yin par smras pa ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang ldan zhing skye ba yin par smras pa ;
translated: It is born with something else,

original: rgyun du nad kyis mngon gdung zhing //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyun du nad kyis mngon gdung zhing // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Constantly tormented by disease.”

original: rtag tu nyam thag par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag tu nyam thag par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is always a source of anxiety.

original: bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / cham pa dang rims tshad par 'khru ba la sogs pa'i nad kyis mngon par gdungs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / cham pa dang rims tshad par 'khru ba la sogs pa'i nad kyis mngon par gdungs pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also afflicted by the diseases of hunger, thirst, cold, fever, and dysentery.

original: rga ba dang 'chi bas 'tsher 'grib pa'i zhes bya ba ni rga ba dang 'chi ba gnyis kyis skrag pa'i phyir 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi bas 'tsher 'grib pa'i zhes bya ba ni rga ba dang 'chi ba gnyis kyis skrag pa'i phyir 'jig pa yin te /
translated: It is afflicted by the two, old age and death, because it is frightened by the two, old age and death.

original: rga ba dang 'chi ba gnyis la rtag tu dogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi ba gnyis la rtag tu dogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is always apprehensive of the two, old age and death.

original: de'i phyir rga ba ste nus pa thams cad med par byed pa dang / ris mthun pa chad pa'i 'chi bas rtag tu gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rga ba ste nus pa thams cad med par byed pa dang / ris mthun pa chad pa'i 'chi bas rtag tu gnod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is always afflicted by old age, which destroys all abilities, and by death, which severs the continuity of the aggregates.

original: lus 'di ni 'byor ba dang mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: lus 'di ni 'byor ba dang mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: This body is not a source of happiness.

original: phyin ci log spang pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: phyin ci log spang pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: In order to abandon the misconception that the body is a source of happiness, this verse was uttered.

original: ci lus 'di ni gcig tu dgos pa med pas ci yang mi bya ba nyid kyis dor bar bya'o zhes rtog pa la de spang ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ci lus 'di ni gcig tu dgos pa med pas ci yang mi bya ba nyid kyis dor bar bya'o zhes rtog pa la de spang ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: If one thinks that this body should be abandoned because it is useless, since it does not perform any function, in order to abandon that idea, it is said:

original: myur du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: myur du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The meaning of the verse is summarized in the words quickly and so on.

original: skyon du ma dang ldan zhing g-yo ba'i gzhi yin du zin kyang thar pa thob pa la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang 'dir sngags par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: skyon du ma dang ldan zhing g-yo ba'i gzhi yin du zin kyang thar pa thob pa la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang 'dir sngags par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Even though it is full of many faults and is the basis of agitation, it is helpful for attaining liberation, and it is to be used as a mantra in this [practice].

original: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni zin pas so //
analyzed: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni zin pas so //
translated: By this means by the body.

original: yang na 'dod pa na spyod pas so //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa na spyod pas so //
translated: Or else, by the body in the desire realm.

original: rnag dang ldan zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'i rdzas 'dus par gyur pa'i lus kyis so //
analyzed: rnag dang ldan zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'i rdzas 'dus par gyur pa'i lus kyis so //
translated: Full of pus means by a body that is a collection of impure substances.

original: myur du 'jig cing zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i ngang tshul yod pa ste /
analyzed: myur du 'jig cing zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i ngang tshul yod pa ste /
translated: Quickly perishes means it has the nature of perishing.

original: 'dis ni mi rtag pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi rtag pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This teaches impermanence.

original: na ba zhes bya ba ni nad kyis nyam thag pa ste /
analyzed: na ba zhes bya ba ni nad kyis nyam thag pa ste /
translated: Sick means afflicted by illness.

original: des zil gyis non pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des zil gyis non pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it is overwhelmed by that.

original: 'dis ni sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: This teaches suffering.

original: 'dir mi gtsang bas ni lus kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi skyon bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir mi gtsang bas ni lus kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi skyon bstan to //
translated: Here, the impurity of the body's intrinsic nature is taught by the faults.

original: mi rtag pa dang ; sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon bstan to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang ; sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon bstan to //
translated: By impermanence and by suffering, the faults of the general characteristics are taught.

original: don du gnyer bar gyis zhes bya ba rjes su shes par gyis shig pa ste bsam pa dang kun du shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don du gnyer bar gyis zhes bya ba rjes su shes par gyis shig pa ste bsam pa dang kun du shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should strive for it means one should understand it, one should know it, one should fully understand it.

original: de ltar stobs kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar stobs kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, what is that which one should strive for by force?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa // zhi mchog @85b ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa // zhi mchog @85b ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The supreme peace.

original: mi gtsang ba'i lus la sogs pa 'di de na med pa nyid de gtan du mya ngan las 'das pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gtsor sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i lus la sogs pa 'di de na med pa nyid de gtan du mya ngan las 'das pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gtsor sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The body of impurities, etc. are not there, i.e., in the supreme peace. The supreme peace is the element of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates, i.e., the nirvana which is the ultimate cessation of suffering.

original: grub dang bde ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid du grub pas 'jog pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: grub dang bde ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid du grub pas 'jog pa med pa'o ;
translated: Established and blissful means established as permanent, i.e., not subject to cessation.

original: / bla na med pa ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / bla na med pa ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unsurpassed means free from suffering.

original: yang na grub pa dang bde ba ni grub pa dang bde ba'o //
analyzed: yang na grub pa dang bde ba ni grub pa dang bde ba'o //
translated: Or else, “accomplishment” is accomplishment and bliss is bliss.

original: mya ngan 'das pa de na 'bral ba med pas grub pa ni gtan du bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa de na 'bral ba med pas grub pa ni gtan du bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no separation in nirvana, accomplishment is eternal bliss.

original: dge ba yin pa'i phyir bde ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba yin pa'i phyir bde ba ste /
translated: It is bliss because it is virtue.

original: sdug bsngal mtha' dag dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mtha' dag dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is virtue because it is free from all suffering.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad ni bla na yod pa yin la /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad ni bla na yod pa yin la /
translated: It is unsurpassed because all things have something above them,

original: thar pa ni bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: thar pa ni bla na med pa ste /
translated: but liberation is unsurpassed,

original: rtag tu dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always virtuous.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: rtag pa dge ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dge ba med pa ste /
translated: It is permanent, virtuous, and non-existent.

original: nam mkha' blo ni 'gog byed pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' blo ni 'gog byed pa //
translated: The mind that stops space

original: dad pa la sogs mi rtag dge //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs mi rtag dge //
translated: is impermanent and virtuous.🔽Liberation is unsurpassed

original: gnyis las thar pa bla med yin //
analyzed: gnyis las thar pa bla med yin //
translated: because it is free from the two.

original: zhes so // nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad yang dag par gcad pas ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad yang dag par gcad pas ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: By completely severing all afflictions and secondary afflictions, there is nirvana with remainder,

original: mchog tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu zhi ba'o //
translated: which is supreme peace.

original: 'dus byas thams cad gtan du spangs pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'o zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad gtan du spangs pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'o zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that the realm of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates, which is the permanent abandonment of all conditioned things, is the highest achievement and happiness.

original: gzhan dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gsum du bshad pa dang zhi ba dang / grub pa dang / bde ba bla na med pa gsum go rims bzhin du sbyar ro zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gsum du bshad pa dang zhi ba dang / grub pa dang / bde ba bla na med pa gsum go rims bzhin du sbyar ro zhes so //
translated: Others say that the three, the enlightenment of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha and nonabiding nirvana, are respectively the three, peace, achievement, and the highest happiness.

original: lus la mngon par dga' ba rnams dang mya ngan las 'das pas skrag pa rnams la skyon dang yon tan bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: lus la mngon par dga' ba rnams dang mya ngan las 'das pas skrag pa rnams la skyon dang yon tan bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to show the faults and virtues to those who delight in the body and those who are afraid of nirvana.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i rnam par grol ba de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'di dag bsten pa la 'bad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i rnam par grol ba de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'di dag bsten pa la 'bad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Since one should strive to rely on these in order to attain such liberation,

original: gzhan dag la ni yid brtan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni yid brtan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: in order to show that one should not rely on others, it says:

original: dgun ka dang ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dgun ka dang ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The cold season, etc.

original: mnyan yod na ma na si zhes bya ba'i tshong dpon gyi bu zhig yod de nor rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan zhing de yang 'dod pa la zhen pa zhig ste /🔽de dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa la rab tu longs spyod par 'dod pas yo byad dang bcas pas dgun @86a * //
analyzed: mnyan yod na ma na si zhes bya ba'i tshong dpon gyi bu zhig yod de nor rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan zhing de yang 'dod pa la zhen pa zhig ste / de dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa la rab tu longs spyod par 'dod pas yo byad dang bcas pas dgun @86a * //
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a merchant's son named Māṇḍavya, who was endowed with abundant wealth of various kinds. He was attached to sensual pleasures,🔽and because he desired to enjoy sensual pleasures according to the season, he had three very delightful houses built for the enjoyment of winter,

original: dang dpyid dang dbyar gyi dus su nye bar longs spyod pa'i khang pa shin tu nyams dga' ba gsum byas so //
analyzed: dang dpyid dang dbyar gyi dus su nye bar longs spyod pa'i khang pa shin tu nyams dga' ba gsum byas so //
translated: summer, and the rainy season.

original: des der yang yid la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma spyad pa nyid du shi ba'i dus byas te /
analyzed: des der yang yid la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma spyad pa nyid du shi ba'i dus byas te /
translated: There, without enjoying the desired fruits, he died.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was spoken with reference to him.

original: 'di thos pas srog chags stong phrag drug cu bden pa mngon par rtogs par gyur to //
analyzed: 'di thos pas srog chags stong phrag drug cu bden pa mngon par rtogs par gyur to //
translated: By hearing this, sixty thousand living beings attained the realization of the truths.

original: gzhan dag ni tshong dpon chen po nor mang po pa zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa shin tu mang ba zhig yod pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tshong dpon chen po nor mang po pa zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa shin tu mang ba zhig yod pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa'o zhes so //
translated: The others are for the sake of a great merchant called Bahuratna, who has a great deal of conceptual thought.

original: mi rigs par sems par byed pa ni dgun ka dang dpyid ka dang dbyar ka 'di dag bya'o zhes sems par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs par sems par byed pa ni dgun ka dang dpyid ka dang dbyar ka 'di dag bya'o zhes sems par byed pa'o //
translated: He thinks inappropriately, “I will do this in winter, this in spring, and this in summer.”

original: mi rigs par sems par byed pa po byis pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: mi rigs par sems par byed pa po byis pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: The one who thinks inappropriately is called a fool.

original: mi rigs par byed pa'i rgyu ni bar chad mthong bar ma gyur to zhes bya ba ste 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi rigs par byed pa'i rgyu ni bar chad mthong bar ma gyur to zhes bya ba ste 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The cause of inappropriate action is not seeing obstacles. This is the condensed meaning.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni khyim dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni khyim dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'o //
translated: “These” refers to houses, gardens, and so on.

original: dbyar ka zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi dus so //

original: 'jig rten ni rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la spyod do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la spyod do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The world is said to be the result of one's own karma.

original: 'phags pa'i lam nyid ni 'chi ba las yongs su skyob pa yin pas de la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam nyid ni 'chi ba las yongs su skyob pa yin pas de la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: The noble path itself is the protector from death, so it is taught in order to introduce one to that.

original: las gang zhig mthar ma phyin par de las gzhan dag rtsom pa ni 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: las gang zhig mthar ma phyin par de las gzhan dag rtsom pa ni 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: It is taught that one who begins another action before the previous one is completed is not free from the fear of death, etc.

original: 'di ni bya ba byas zin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba byas zin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, This is the completed action, and so on.

original: rgyal po'i khab na bha ba yab dha ka zhes bya bas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob kyang gong ma'i lam bsgom pa la bag med par gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab na bha ba yab dha ka zhes bya bas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob kyang gong ma'i lam bsgom pa la bag med par gyur te /
translated: In Rājagṛha, there was a stream-enterer named Bhava Yavadatta who became careless in cultivating the higher path.

original: 'di ltar yang bdag gis ni ngan song gi sgo ni bkag pas da ni lha dang mi'i 'dod pa la rol cing rjes su myong bar byas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bdag gis ni ngan song gi sgo ni bkag pas da ni lha dang mi'i 'dod pa la rol cing rjes su myong bar byas te /
translated: Thus, I have closed the door to the lower realms. Now I will enjoy and experience the desires of gods and humans.

original: @88a * // khyad par du 'phags pa'i bden pas mya ngan las 'das par bya'o zhes bsam pa las ji tsam na dus las 'das te /
analyzed: @88a * // khyad par du 'phags pa'i bden pas mya ngan las 'das par bya'o zhes bsam pa las ji tsam na dus las 'das te /
translated: But then the time passed.

original: khyim thab spyugs pa zhig gi chung ma'i rum du zhugs te /
analyzed: khyim thab spyugs pa zhig gi chung ma'i rum du zhugs te /
translated: He entered the womb of the wife of a man who had been banished.🔽After he was born, a servant girl left him naked and with the placenta in the middle of a crossroads at night.

original: btsas nas de bran mo zhig gis mtshan mo lam gyi bzhi mdor tsher ma dang bcas par sgren mor bor ba las shin tu sdug bsngal bas 'gre ldog cing 'o dod 'bod pa 'od ma'i tshal na gnas pa'i dge bsnyen dag gis thos te /
analyzed: btsas nas de bran mo zhig gis mtshan mo lam gyi bzhi mdor tsher ma dang bcas par sgren mor bor ba las shin tu sdug bsngal bas 'gre ldog cing 'o dod 'bod pa 'od ma'i tshal na gnas pa'i dge bsnyen dag gis thos te /
translated: The lay vow holder who lived in Bamboo Grove heard the baby crying in great suffering.

original: de blangs nas yid dang rjes su mthun pa thob par gyur te /
analyzed: de blangs nas yid dang rjes su mthun pa thob par gyur te /
translated: He took him and gave him to a couple who did not have a child.

original: tshul bzhin du rol pa dang / srid pa'i nyes dmigs mthong ba rnam pa mang po byas te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rol pa dang / srid pa'i nyes dmigs mthong ba rnam pa mang po byas te /
translated: They raised him properly, and he saw the many faults of cyclic existence.

original: de rnams kyis phan btags pa byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis phan btags pa byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: They helped him, and he attained nirvana.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i gtam dge bsnyen dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i gtam dge bsnyen dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan te /
translated: The Blessed One heard the story of this from the lay vow holders.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
translated: He spoke these two verses.

original: de la re zhig dang po smras pa //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po smras pa //
translated: Therein, first of all, he said:

original: 'di ni bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what should be done, etc.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba dag la zhen pa dag gis ni 'chi ba la sogs pas mngon par bcom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba dag la zhen pa dag gis ni 'chi ba la sogs pas mngon par bcom par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are attached to worldly activities are overcome by death, etc.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba la mngon du brtson pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba la mngon du brtson pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: They are not intent on the activities that transcend the world. This is the condensed meaning.

original: 'di ni byas zhes bya ba ni 'di mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byas zhes bya ba ni 'di mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: This is what has been done is the conclusion.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rgyu dang bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rgyu dang bya ba'o //
translated: What should be done is the cause of activity and the activity itself.

original: bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Activity is of three kinds:

original: gang byas pa dang / gang bya bar brtsams pa dang / gang ma brtsams pa brtsam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang byas pa dang / gang bya bar brtsams pa dang / gang ma brtsams pa brtsam par bya ba'o //
translated: that which has been done, that which is being done, and that which is to be done.

original: de la dang po ma gtogs pa'i brtsam par bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: de la dang po ma gtogs pa'i brtsam par bya ba smras pa /
translated: Of these, he mentions that which is to be done, excluding the first.

original: don 'di bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don 'di bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “This is the meaning of what should be done.”

original: da ni bya ba 'di nyid kyi dus la bab pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni bya ba 'di nyid kyi dus la bab pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: Now, this is the activity whose time has come.

original: de dag byas nas zhes bya ba ni brtsams pa de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag byas nas zhes bya ba ni brtsams pa de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Having done those means having completed those undertakings.

original: bdag ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag ni bdag nyid do //
translated: One means oneself.

original: 'di bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di'i 'og tu bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di'i 'og tu bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should do this means that which should be accomplished after this.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa bstan to //
translated: Thus indicates the previously explained form of conceptualization.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: Indeed is a particle.

original: 'dir mngon par bcom pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mngon par bcom pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand it to be a direct defeat here.

original: su zhig mngon par bcom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: su zhig mngon par bcom pa yin zhe na /
translated: Who is directly defeated?

original: smras pa / mi zhes bya ba smos te sems can no //
analyzed: smras pa / mi zhes bya ba smos te sems can no //
translated: It is said: One called a human being, a sentient being.

original: yongs su shom pa na zhes bya ba ni yongs su rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su shom pa na zhes bya ba ni yongs su rtsom pa ste /
translated: When one is engaged, means when one is undertaking.

original: rtog pa ngan pa dpag tu med pas sems rnam par g-yen spyo ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ngan pa dpag tu med pas sems rnam par g-yen spyo ba'o //
translated: The mind is disturbed by immeasurable bad thoughts.

original: mngon du bcom zhes bya ba ni zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'jig pa dang zhig par byed pa zhes bya @88b pa'i don to //
analyzed: mngon du bcom zhes bya ba ni zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'jig pa dang zhig par byed pa zhes bya @88b pa'i don to //
translated: Directly defeated means overcome, destroyed, and destroyed again.

original: de gang yin zhe na smras pa //
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na smras pa //
translated: What is that? It is said:

original: 'chi ba dang rga bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang rga bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Death and old age” are mentioned.

original: 'chi dang bcas pa'i rga ba ste /
analyzed: 'chi dang bcas pa'i rga ba ste /
translated: Old age is accompanied by death.

original: 'chi ba dang rga ba gnyis kyis 'chi bar skyel bar byed pa yin pas bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas te rdo rje'i bye ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang rga ba gnyis kyis 'chi bar skyel bar byed pa yin pas bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas te rdo rje'i bye ma bzhin no //
translated: Since both death and old age lead to death, the middle term is elided, as in “sand in the eyes.”

original: nad dang lhan cig rjes su 'brang ba yin pa'i phyir nad dang bcas so ;
analyzed: nad dang lhan cig rjes su 'brang ba yin pa'i phyir nad dang bcas so ;
translated: It is “with disease” because it is followed by disease.

original: / mthar ma phyin pa yongs su rtog pa'i bya ba la ni 'jig rten pa dag rga bas yongs su nyams par byas shing nad kyis gzir te /
analyzed: / mthar ma phyin pa yongs su rtog pa'i bya ba la ni 'jig rten pa dag rga bas yongs su nyams par byas shing nad kyis gzir te /
translated: In the activity of conceptualization, which has not reached its end, worldly people are ruined by old age, afflicted by disease,

original: 'chi bdag gi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: and come under the power of the Lord of Death.

original: des na bya ba gzhan thams cad yongs su btang bas 'chi ba la sogs pa bzlog pa'i bya ba la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: des na bya ba gzhan thams cad yongs su btang bas 'chi ba la sogs pa bzlog pa'i bya ba la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, having given up all other activities, one should strive in the activity of averting death and so on.

original: zhes thub pa mchog gis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: zhes thub pa mchog gis yongs su bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the Supreme Sage.

original: 'jig rten pa'i las ni mtha' med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i las ni mtha' med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Worldly activity is endless.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa //
