analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa //
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyal po dug can la sogs pas //
analyzed: rgyal po dug can la sogs pas //
translated: “The king, the poison, and so on.

original: bya ba dag ni ma byas te /
analyzed: bya ba dag ni ma byas te /
translated: But the tasks are not done.🔽Then, just that is to be done,

original: de nas de nyid bya ba dang // de yang bcas shing 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas de nyid bya ba dang // de yang bcas shing 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: and that is enjoined and ceases.🔽In just this way,

original: de bzhin bya ba 'di dag la //
analyzed: de bzhin bya ba 'di dag la //
translated: in these tasks

original: de nyid mthar ni ma phyin par //
analyzed: de nyid mthar ni ma phyin par //
translated: just that is not completed,

original: de nas 'jig rten de 'dra'i dgra //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten de 'dra'i dgra //
translated: and then, such an enemy of the world,

original: 'chi ba dag ni 'ong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'chi ba dag ni 'ong bar 'gyur //
translated: death, will come.

original: zhes pa'o // bya ba ma yin pa'i bya ba mang po dag la yun ring du byed cing mi 'chi ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa mang po dag la skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // bya ba ma yin pa'i bya ba mang po dag la yun ring du byed cing mi 'chi ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa mang po dag la skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in order to generate weariness with the many thoughts of not dying while engaging for a long time in the many activities that are not to be done.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'jig rten pa'i bya bas rnam par g-yengs pa'i skye bo rga ba dang 'chi ba dang nad dang bcas pas mngon du bcom pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'jig rten pa'i bya bas rnam par g-yengs pa'i skye bo rga ba dang 'chi ba dang nad dang bcas pas mngon du bcom pa yin te /
translated: Because in this way, the people who are distracted by worldly activities are overcome by aging, death, and sickness.

original: de bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to accomplish the supramundane activities, it is said, “Thus, having seen that the world is like this…” and so on.

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor bas yongs su skyo ba med pa'i yid dang / ting nge 'dzin thob nas ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis chog mi shes pa des mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor bas yongs su skyo ba med pa'i yid dang / ting nge 'dzin thob nas ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis chog mi shes pa des mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
translated: The summary meaning of this chapter is as follows: The cause of the application of concentration, the mind that is not wearied by the application of concentration, the completion of the paths of seeing and cultivation by one who, having attained concentration, is not satisfied with concentration alone,

original: lam bsgom pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu de'i phan yon 'dir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lam bsgom pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu de'i phan yon 'dir bstan pa yin no //
translated: the result of cultivating the path, and the benefits of that result are taught here.

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan to//
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan to//
translated: Therefore, thus indicates the cause of the application of concentration.

original: de ltar rtag tu ting 'dzin la dga' mnyam par zhog //
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu ting 'dzin la dga' mnyam par zhog //
translated: Thus, always delight in concentration and rest in equipoise.

original: brtson pa skyed la skye ba dang rga ba'i mtha' ma ltos //
analyzed: brtson pa skyed la skye ba dang rga ba'i mtha' ma ltos //
translated: Generate effort and see the end of birth and aging.

original: bdud rnams sde dang bcas pa mngon par zil gnon la //
analyzed: bdud rnams sde dang bcas pa mngon par zil gnon la //
translated: Overcome the māras and their armies.

original: dge slong dag gis skye shi'i pha rol 'gro bar gyis //
analyzed: dge slong dag gis skye shi'i pha rol 'gro bar gyis //
translated: Monks, go beyond birth and death.

original: zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni go rims bzhin du lhag ma rnams bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni go rims bzhin du lhag ma rnams bstan to //
translated: These lines indicate the remaining perfections in their proper order.

original: da ni @89a * //
analyzed: da ni @89a * //
translated: Now,

original: tshig so so'i don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig so so'i don bshad par bya ste /
translated: the meaning of the individual words should be explained.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rgyu ston te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rgyu ston te /
translated: Thus is the teaching of the cause that was previously explained.🔽As it is said:

original: 'di ltar / de ltar mi ni yongs su shom pa na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ltar mi ni yongs su shom pa na //
translated: Thus a person is fully occupied,

original: rga dang nad bcas 'chi bas mngon du bcom //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rga dang nad bcas 'chi bas mngon du bcom // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: overwhelmed by old age, disease, and death.

original: rgyu de ltar ro //
analyzed: rgyu de ltar ro //
translated: This is the cause.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan te //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan te //
translated: This teaches the cause of application.

original: 'chi ba la sogs pas skyo ba skyed de de ltar shes shing skyo ba skye ba las ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'chi ba la sogs pas skyo ba skyed de de ltar shes shing skyo ba skye ba las ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba yod pa nyid de /
translated: One who is saddened by death and so on, who knows thus and generates sadness, has the existence of application to meditative concentration.

original: 'dis ni gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba bstan nas /
translated: This teaches respectful application.

original: rtag tu byed pa'i sbyor ba smras pa rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu byed pa'i sbyor ba smras pa rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: The application of constant practice is stated: Always means at all times.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dga' zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dga' zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba ste /
translated: Delighting in meditative concentration means delighting in meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is delighting in meditative absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba thob pas ni de'i sbyor ba la yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba thob pas ni de'i sbyor ba la yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who has attained delight in meditative concentration is not tormented by the effort to attain it.

original: mnyam par zhog ces bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa ste bsam gtan mngon du byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mnyam par zhog ces bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa ste bsam gtan mngon du byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase be absorbed in meditation means to be one-pointed in mind, which is to say, to actualize meditative concentration.

original: brtson pa skyed la zhes bya ba ni brtun pas 'bad pa'i brtson 'grus gang la yod pa de ni brtson pa skyed pa ste brtson 'grus brtsam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson pa skyed la zhes bya ba ni brtun pas 'bad pa'i brtson 'grus gang la yod pa de ni brtson pa skyed pa ste brtson 'grus brtsam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase generate effort means to be endowed with the effort that is made with perseverance. The phrase make an effort means to be endowed with the effort that is made with perseverance.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa la ni khyad par thob par bya ba la chog mi shes pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa la ni khyad par thob par bya ba la chog mi shes pa nyid du ston te /
translated: The phrase one who is endowed with effort is taught to show that one should not be satisfied with the attainment of a particular distinction.

original: ji skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:🔽You should never be wearied

original: khyad par spel la nges par ni //
analyzed: khyad par spel la nges par ni //
translated: of increasing your distinction.

original: khyod ni nam yang ngal ma gyur ;
analyzed: khyod ni nam yang ngal ma gyur ;
translated: You should not be discouraged

original: / brtson 'grus drag pos dka' ba las //🔽skyo ba yod pa ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / brtson 'grus drag pos dka' ba las //🔽skyo ba yod pa ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: by the difficult practices that require great effort.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis chog par mi bya ba nyid du 'dis bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis chog par mi bya ba nyid du 'dis bstan te /
translated: This shows that one who seeks the supramundane path should not be satisfied with mere concentration.

original: skye dang rga ba'i mtha' ma ltos //🔽zhes bya ba 'di smos so //
analyzed: skye dang rga ba'i mtha' ma ltos // zhes bya ba 'di smos so //
translated: See the end of birth and aging!

original: skye ba dang rga ba ni skye rga'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba ni skye rga'o //
translated: Birth and aging are birth and aging.

original: de gnyis kyi mtha' ma ni zad pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi mtha' ma ni zad pa ste /
translated: The end of those two is their exhaustion.

original: de lta bu'i tshul gang dag la yod pa de nyid ni 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gang dag la yod pa de nyid ni 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: That which has such a mode is the complete path of seeing.

original: phal cher skye ba zad de yun ring du thogs nas srid pa bdun yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang rga ba mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phal cher skye ba zad de yun ring du thogs nas srid pa bdun yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang rga ba mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the end of birth is long delayed, one sees the end of birth and aging in seven existences.

original: bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la ni skye ba mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir yang 'khor bar skye ba dang rga ba'i mtha' ma mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la ni skye ba mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir yang 'khor bar skye ba dang rga ba'i mtha' ma mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: On the complete path of meditation, one sees the end of birth and aging in cyclic existence because the end of birth is final.

original: ci zhig byas shing ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas shing ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is done and how does it happen?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / bdud rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / bdud rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The demons, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bdud de 'chi ba'i chos nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bdud de 'chi ba'i chos nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflictions are the demons, because they are the cause of the proximate production of death.

original: sde dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang @89b bcas pa ste /
analyzed: sde dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang @89b bcas pa ste /
translated: Together with the army means together with the retinue.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: together with the karma of the secondary afflictions.

original: mngon par zil gnon la zhes bya ba ni spangs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zil gnon la zhes bya ba ni spangs pa ste /
translated: The phrase having overcome means having abandoned.

original: 'dis ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: This shows the result of the path of cultivation.

original: de yang gang dag gis 'di ltar lam bsgom par nus she na /🔽smras pa / dge slong dag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang gang dag gis 'di ltar lam bsgom par nus she na / smras pa / dge slong dag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: And who are those who are able to cultivate the path in this way?🔽The text says monks.

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni rab tu byung zhing yongs su bzung ba spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni rab tu byung zhing yongs su bzung ba spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word monks means those who have gone forth and abandoned grasping.

original: de dag gis lus dang sems rna par dben pa dang / de dang rab tu 'brel ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis lus dang sems rna par dben pa dang / de dang rab tu 'brel ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they have physical and mental seclusion, the cultivation of the path is possible for them.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni de nyid las skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni de nyid las skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The phrase will go to means they will be reborn in that very place.

original: gzhan la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not for others.

original: gzhan dag tu ni 'gro bar gyis //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni 'gro bar gyis //
translated: Go to the other side!

original: zhes brjod // 'di'i don ni khyed cag gis 'grub cing 'di'i pha rol du 'gro bar gyis shig ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod // 'di'i don ni khyed cag gis 'grub cing 'di'i pha rol du 'gro bar gyis shig ces bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that you should go to the other side of this, i.e., you should go beyond it.

original: skye shi'i pha rol 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i pha rol du phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings der 'gro ba yin pas pha rol 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: skye shi'i pha rol 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i pha rol du phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings der 'gro ba yin pas pha rol 'gro ba ste /
translated: The other side of birth and death is the sphere of nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa la phan yon 'di yod de gang phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa la phan yon 'di yod de gang phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The benefit of abandoning the afflictions and secondary afflictions is that one enters the sphere of nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: bya ba ngan pa la gnas shing 'brel pa dag 'phags pa'i lam la sbyor ba'i phyir bsrungs so //
analyzed: bya ba ngan pa la gnas shing 'brel pa dag 'phags pa'i lam la sbyor ba'i phyir bsrungs so //
translated: They are protected because they are connected with the practice of the noble path.

original: mi rtag pa'i tshoms kyi rnam par 'grel ba ste dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i tshoms kyi rnam par 'grel ba ste dang po rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the first chapter on impermanence.

original: // / de'i 'og tu 'dod pa'i tshoms dgod pa'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu 'dod pa'i tshoms dgod pa'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then, after that, the chapter on the Verses on Desire should be stated.

original: mi rtag pa bstan pas skyo ba yang dag par bskyed nas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dngos po thob par bya ba'i phyir 'di nye bar 'god pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa bstan pas skyo ba yang dag par bskyed nas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dngos po thob par bya ba'i phyir 'di nye bar 'god pa yin no //
translated: Having generated true weariness through teaching impermanence, in order to attain the state of freedom from attachment, this [chapter] is presented.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad kyi dang por ni 'dod pa dag las chags pa med pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad kyi dang por ni 'dod pa dag las chags pa med pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Because first of all, freedom from attachment to desire [realm objects] arises.

original: de nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa las chags pa med pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa las chags pa med pa 'byung ste /
translated: Then, freedom from attachment to form and formless [realm objects] arises.

original: ma ma'i gos las thog ma dri ma rags pa dang bral bar byed la /
analyzed: ma ma'i gos las thog ma dri ma rags pa dang bral bar byed la /
translated: Just as, from a mother's cloth, one first removes coarse stains,

original: de'i 'og tu ni phra ba dag dang bral bar byed pa de bzhin du skabs brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni phra ba dag dang bral bar byed pa de bzhin du skabs brjod pa yin no //
translated: and then later removes the subtle ones, so it is with the chapter.

original: kun rtog las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kun rtog las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, From conceptualization... and so on.

original: 'di'i gleng gzhi ni bud med cig skyes pa gzhan zhig la chags te /
analyzed: 'di'i gleng gzhi ni bud med cig skyes pa gzhan zhig la chags te /
translated: The introduction is as follows: A certain woman was attached to another man.

original: de la lta ba dang kun du smra bas g-yen spyo ste chu blang pa'i phyir khron pa las bum pa dang chu blang bar bya'o zhes bsams nas @90a * //
analyzed: de la lta ba dang kun du smra bas g-yen spyo ste chu blang pa'i phyir khron pa las bum pa dang chu blang bar bya'o zhes bsams nas @90a * //
translated: He was reviled by the people for his views and for his talk. He thought, “I will get a pot and a rope from the well in order to get water.”

original: rang gi bu mgrin pa la thag pas bcings te /
analyzed: rang gi bu mgrin pa la thag pas bcings te /
translated: He tied a rope around his son’s neck.

original: nang du yud tsam zhig btang ba las de nas bu shi bar mthong ste /
analyzed: nang du yud tsam zhig btang ba las de nas bu shi bar mthong ste /
translated: He let him down into the well for a moment, but then he saw that his son was dead.

original: de skyo ba yang dag par skyes pa las tshigs bcad 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de skyo ba yang dag par skyes pa las tshigs bcad 'di gsungs so //
translated: He was filled with sorrow and he spoke this verse:

original: 'di yang ji ltar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang ji ltar gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How is this to be?”

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das phyogs der gshegs te ;
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das phyogs der gshegs te ;
translated: The Blessed One came to that place.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis yang dag par gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di zung shig ces gsungs te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis yang dag par gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di zung shig ces gsungs te /
translated: “Ānanda, you should remember this verse that was spoken by the Perfectly Awakened One.”

original: ci nas kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye ba dang / ci nas kyang skye ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye ba dang / ci nas kyang skye ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning is: “In any case, desire-attachment arises, and in any case, there is no arising.”

original: tshig gi don so so'i bshad pa /
analyzed: tshig gi don so so'i bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the individual words.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod par byed pas na 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod par byed pas na 'dod pa ste /
translated: “Desire” is that which is desired,

original: don du gnyer bar byed ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: don du gnyer bar byed ces pa'i don to //
translated: meaning that which is sought.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags la dgongs so //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags la dgongs so //
translated: Moreover, it is intended to be the desire-attachment of longing for the five sense objects.

original: de la bod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bod pa yin te /
translated: It is said:

original: kye 'dod pa zhes so //
analyzed: kye 'dod pa zhes so //
translated: “Oh, desire!”

original: shes kyis te zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid nges par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: shes kyis te zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid nges par byas pa yin te /
translated: “Know” means that this is ascertained.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / khyod ni rtsa bar zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / khyod ni rtsa bar zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: “You are the root.”

original: 'dod pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: It is the cause of generating desire,

original: gang gi phyir de ni 'khrig pa dang ldan pa kun tu rtog pa'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni 'khrig pa dang ldan pa kun tu rtog pa'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: because it is the root of the conception of one who has sexual intercourse.

original: de dag nyid kyi yul la mi 'gro ba'i 'du shes las ni 'dod chags mi skye la mi dge ba'i 'du shes kyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi yul la mi 'gro ba'i 'du shes las ni 'dod chags mi skye la mi dge ba'i 'du shes kyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Attachment does not arise from the perception of the non-existence of those very objects, and one becomes free from attachment through the perception of non-virtue.🔽And, in regard to empty abodes, one is destroyed by the attachment of false imagination.

original: gnas stong pa dag la yang log pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags kyis rlag pa yin no zhes 'dod pa'i rtsa ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gnas stong pa dag la yang log pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags kyis rlag pa yin no zhes 'dod pa'i rtsa ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the root of desire, he says:

original: kun rtog las ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kun rtog las ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: From imagination.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pas rang bzhin med pa dag la gnas rjes su dran zhing gzugs su brtag pa de la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pas rang bzhin med pa dag la gnas rjes su dran zhing gzugs su brtag pa de la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Through the possession of improper mental attention, one recollects the abode in regard to that which is devoid of intrinsic nature and imagines form. Desire-attachment arises in regard to that.

original: kye 'dod pa zhes so //
analyzed: kye 'dod pa zhes so //
translated: Oh, desire!

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba yang smos pa ni gcig tu ma rung ba yin pas spang bar bya ba nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba yang smos pa ni gcig tu ma rung ba yin pas spang bar bya ba nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
translated: The statement “desire” is also used in the sense of “unsuitable” in order to prove that it is to be abandoned.

original: yang na de'i yul la mi bzod pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na de'i yul la mi bzod pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, in order to prove that one is intolerant of its object.

original: skyes pas zhes bya ba mngon du byung ba dang / sems kyi rgyud las skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes pas zhes bya ba mngon du byung ba dang / sems kyi rgyud las skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “By a man” means by one who has appeared, and “arisen from the mind-continuum” means the meaning of that.

original: sman la sogs pa'i gzhis yongs su spangs pa ma yin pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sman la sogs pa'i gzhis yongs su spangs pa ma yin pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show the way of not abandoning the basis of medicine, etc., he said:

original: khyod ni kun rtog ma byed dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyod ni kun rtog ma byed dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Do not imagine anything at all”

original: 'dod pa @90b dag la dge bar ma sems dang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: 'dod pa @90b dag la dge bar ma sems dang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: means do not think that desires are virtuous, and you will be liberated.

original: des na khyod la 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des na khyod la 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: “Then it will not arise for you”

original: zhes bya ba ni de bas na dge bar kun tu ma rtogs pas khyod kyi rgyud la skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bas na dge bar kun tu ma rtogs pas khyod kyi rgyud la skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: means therefore, since you do not imagine anything to be virtuous, it will not arise in your mind-continuum,

original: rgyu med pas 'bras bu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pas 'bras bu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because without a cause there is no effect.

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ni rab tu skye bar mi 'gyur zhing rab tu skye bar mi nus pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ni rab tu skye bar mi 'gyur zhing rab tu skye bar mi nus pa nyid du ston to //
translated: “Will not arise” shows that it will not arise at all, and that it will not be able to arise at all.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spong bar 'dod pa rnams la gzhi med par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir dang // 'dod pa byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spong bar 'dod pa rnams la gzhi med par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir dang // 'dod pa byed pa'am /
translated: In order to show those who desire to abandon the passion of desire that they are groundless,🔽and in order to refute those who say that desire is based on agitation,

original: 'dod par byed pa dag ni rgod pa la brten yin no zhes smra ba rnams tshar gcad pa'i gnas dang / bdag tu smra ba rnams tshar bcad pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod par byed pa dag ni rgod pa la brten yin no zhes smra ba rnams tshar gcad pa'i gnas dang / bdag tu smra ba rnams tshar bcad pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: and in order to refute those who say that desire is the self, this is said.

original: 'dod pa yul dang bcas pa 'di dag ni ches kyang spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa yul dang bcas pa 'di dag ni ches kyang spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: These desires and their objects are to be abandoned even by those who are not renunciates,

original: gnod pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because they are the cause of all harm.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / 'dod pa rnams las mya ngan skye //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / 'dod pa rnams las mya ngan skye //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: From desires, grief is born.

original: bud med de nyid bu dang bral ba yod pa'i dbang gis brang brdung zhing mya ngan gyis gdungs te /
analyzed: bud med de nyid bu dang bral ba yod pa'i dbang gis brang brdung zhing mya ngan gyis gdungs te /
translated: Because of the loss of that very woman, a son beats his chest, is tormented by grief,

original: smre sngags 'don pa dang / khyim thab la 'jigs pa yin te /
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa dang / khyim thab la 'jigs pa yin te /
translated: and laments in fear of his wife.

original: des 'di ltar bu'i don thos par gyur na bdag la gnod pa byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa de'i dbang du byas na tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: des 'di ltar bu'i don thos par gyur na bdag la gnod pa byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa de'i dbang du byas na tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: He said this, thinking, If he hears this meaning of the verse, he will do me harm. With that in mind, he spoke these verses.

original: de la re zhig dang po'i rnam par 'grel ba smras pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po'i rnam par 'grel ba smras pa /
translated: Here, first of all, the commentary on the first verse is stated:

original: 'dod pa rnams las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, from desires.

original: 'dod pa rnams la ro mya bar byas pa'i nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba byas pa'i phan yon 'dir bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la ro mya bar byas pa'i nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba byas pa'i phan yon 'dir bstan pa yin te /
translated: The disadvantages of tasting desires and the benefits of renunciation are taught here.

original: de la 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, desires are of two kinds:

original: yul gyi 'dod pa ste gzugs sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dag ste yul de dag nyid la chags pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi 'dod pa ste gzugs sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dag ste yul de dag nyid la chags pa'o //
translated: desires for objects, such as forms, sounds, and so on, and desires as afflictions, which are attachments to those very objects.

original: 'dod pa byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa byed pa'am /
translated: Desires are created or

original: 'dod par byed pa dag ni rgod pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod par byed pa dag ni rgod pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: desires create, because they are based on agitation.

original: de gnyi ga dag las skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga dag las skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: Birth from both of those is arising.

original: mya ngan zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang bral pa'i sems kyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang bral pa'i sems kyi gdung ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is mental anguish from being separated from what is loved.

original: bdag nyid kyi gzi mdangs skem par byed pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi gzi mdangs skem par byed pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The term drying up is a verbal root meaning to dry up.

original: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dag la dmigs nas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa skye ba'i sems kyi las te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dag la dmigs nas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa skye ba'i sems kyi las te /
translated: Fear is the activity of the mind that arises from observing signs and is the apprehension that harm will occur.

original: yang dag par skrag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de gnyi ga yang go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang yul gyi 'dod @91a * //
analyzed: yang dag par skrag pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de gnyi ga yang go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang yul gyi 'dod @91a * //
translated: The meaning is perfect fear.

original: pa dag las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: pa dag las skyes pa ste /
translated: Both of these arise from the desire for objects and the desire for afflictions, respectively.

original: gang gi phyir yul med pa dag la yongs su gzung ba med pa'am yod par gyur na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni de dang bral ba las skyes pa'i mya ngan dang / de dang bral du dogs pa las skyes pa'i 'jigs pa med par 'gyur bas so ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul med pa dag la yongs su gzung ba med pa'am yod par gyur na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni de dang bral ba las skyes pa'i mya ngan dang / de dang bral du dogs pa las skyes pa'i 'jigs pa med par 'gyur bas so ;
translated: Because those who are free from attachment do not have grief that arises from separation from the desired object or fear that arises from the apprehension of separation from the desired object, even though they have the desired object or even though they do not have the desired object.

original: / re zhig 'di dag gi ni 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dag gi nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: / re zhig 'di dag gi ni 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dag gi nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: The disadvantages of the desired and the undesired have been explained.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that there is no effect because there is no cause, he says:

original: 'dod pa dag ni rnam spangs na //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag ni rnam spangs na //
translated: Having completely abandoned desires,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he does not grieve,🔽nor does he fear future existence.

original: 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phan yon bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phan yon bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the benefit of freedom from desire.

original: gang yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs sam bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'dod pa rnams la chags pa med pas btsal ba dang rtsa ba dang bcas par spangs na gnyis kyis 'dod pa dag las chags pa dang bral ba dag la ni sdug pa dang bral bar gyur kyang
analyzed: gang yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs sam bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'dod pa rnams la chags pa med pas btsal ba dang rtsa ba dang bcas par spangs na gnyis kyis 'dod pa dag las chags pa dang bral ba dag la ni sdug pa dang bral bar gyur kyang
translated: When one is free from attachment to desires through the power of thorough analysis or the power of meditation, and abandons desires with their roots, then those who are free from attachment to desires, even though they are separated from the pleasant,

original: mya ngan med cing gnod pa byung bar dogs pa'i 'jigs pa lta ga la yod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan med cing gnod pa byung bar dogs pa'i 'jigs pa lta ga la yod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: how could they have any grief? How could they have any fear of the danger of harm arising?

original: mya ngan gyis ni da ltar gyi nye bar gnas pa'i gnod pa bstan to //
analyzed: mya ngan gyis ni da ltar gyi nye bar gnas pa'i gnod pa bstan to //
translated: Grief teaches the harm that exists in the present.

original: 'jigs pas ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'jigs pas ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa bstan to //
translated: Fear teaches the harm that will arise in the future.

original: 'dod pa'i don du gnyer ba dang / 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa dag 'dod pa dag la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so ;
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don du gnyer ba dang / 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa dag 'dod pa dag la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so ;
translated: This was taught in order to abandon the desire realm attachment of those who pursue the desire realm and are attached to the desire realm.

original: / ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa de lta bu ni yul gyi 'dod pa dag gi phan yon las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: / ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa de lta bu ni yul gyi 'dod pa dag gi phan yon las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The desire realm attachment that is an affliction does not arise from the benefits of the desire realm objects.

original: de yang tshor ba'i rang bzhin gyi dbang yin te /
analyzed: de yang tshor ba'i rang bzhin gyi dbang yin te /
translated: It arises from the power of the nature of feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
translated: The words “craving arises due to feeling” indicate this.

original: des na rtsa ba'i rtsa ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: des na rtsa ba'i rtsa ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the root of the root, it is said:

original: dga' ba rnams las mya ngan skyes ;🔽/ zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dga' ba rnams las mya ngan skyes ; / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Sorrow arises from joy.

original: shin tu chags par byed pa'i phyir dga' ba dag ste //
analyzed: shin tu chags par byed pa'i phyir dga' ba dag ste //
translated: Joy is that which causes great attachment.

original: nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i chags pa yid bde ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i chags pa yid bde ba ste /
translated: It is mental satisfaction that is attachment arising simultaneously with the afflictions.

original: de dag las lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be explained as before.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: This shows the following.

original: 'dod pa de gnyis ni tshe las mya ngan la sogs pa 'byung bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa de gnyis ni tshe las mya ngan la sogs pa 'byung bar ma zad kyi /
translated: These two desires not only arise from life, but also

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i tshogs 'jug par gyur pa yang yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i tshogs 'jug par gyur pa yang yin te /
translated: from the multitude of afflicted desires.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag nyid ma spangs pa dag la mya ngan la sogs pa 'jug cing 'di dag las ni dga' ba dang shin tu chags pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag nyid ma spangs pa dag la mya ngan la sogs pa 'jug cing 'di dag las ni dga' ba dang shin tu chags pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sorrow, etc., arise in those who have not abandoned those minds and mental factors, because they are in accord with joy and attachment.

original: mngon sum du smos pa ni @91b gzhan dang tu de dang mtshungs par ldan pa de bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du smos pa ni @91b gzhan dang tu de dang mtshungs par ldan pa de bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
translated: The direct mention of sorrow is to be extended to those associated with it.

original: chags pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: They are in accord with attachment.

original: 'di la ji skad du gsungs pa bde bar tshor ba dag ni chags pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la ji skad du gsungs pa bde bar tshor ba dag ni chags pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: As it is said, “Those who experience pleasure abide in attachment.

original: gang bde ba dang bde ba'i tshor ba 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang bde ba dang bde ba'i tshor ba 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When there is pleasure and the feeling of pleasure, etc.”

original: 'dod pa mya ngan la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa yang gang gi don du nye bar spyod pa yang dga' ba nye bar spyad pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'dod pa mya ngan la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa yang gang gi don du nye bar spyod pa yang dga' ba nye bar spyad pa'i don te /
translated: The desire that is the cause of sorrow, etc., is also for the sake of the enjoyment of pleasure.

original: des byas pa yin pas 'di dag thams cad ni 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des byas pa yin pas 'di dag thams cad ni 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs su shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all of this should be understood as the disadvantage of desire.

original: gang yul gyis 'dod chags spangs kyang kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags kyis rnam par rtog pa'i dga' ba spangs pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yul gyis 'dod chags spangs kyang kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags kyis rnam par rtog pa'i dga' ba spangs pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was stated in order to abandon the desire for the objects of desire, as well as the desire for the pleasure of conceptualization that is abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'dir 'di dag gis mya ngan dang 'jigs pa'i nyes dmigs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: 'dir 'di dag gis mya ngan dang 'jigs pa'i nyes dmigs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: Here, it is not only the disadvantages of sorrow and fear that arise from these desires,

original: sdig pa'i dra ba ma lus pa 'di dag kyang 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sdig pa'i dra ba ma lus pa 'di dag kyang 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: but also the entire net of evil. In order to demonstrate this, he said:

original: 'dod dga'i rnam smin sdug bsngal te //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dod dga'i rnam smin sdug bsngal te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The result of the pleasure of desire is suffering.

original: skyes bu gti mug can 'phags skyes bos 'gran zla'i sha khon can ma lus par bsad cing phyung ste /
analyzed: skyes bu gti mug can 'phags skyes bos 'gran zla'i sha khon can ma lus par bsad cing phyung ste /
translated: The foolish king Virūḍhaka killed all of his rivals and expelled them.

original: rgyal srid kyi bde ba la longs spyod cing bden pa mthong ba'i sh'akya dpag tu med pa rnams bsad pa de'i 'og tu zhag bdun pa'i nyi ma la btsun mo'i 'khor dang blon po dang g-yog 'khor dang bcas pa chu la rtse ba'i phyir chas pa na dmyal
analyzed: rgyal srid kyi bde ba la longs spyod cing bden pa mthong ba'i sh'akya dpag tu med pa rnams bsad pa de'i 'og tu zhag bdun pa'i nyi ma la btsun mo'i 'khor dang blon po dang g-yog 'khor dang bcas pa chu la rtse ba'i phyir chas pa na dmyal
translated: After he had killed countless Śākyas who had seen the truth and enjoyed the pleasures of the kingdom, on the seventh day after that, he went with his retinue of queens, ministers, and servants to play in the water.🔽

original: ba'i me 'bar bas kun du bskor te /
analyzed: ba'i me 'bar bas kun du bskor te /
translated: After he had killed countless Śākyas who were enjoying the pleasures of sovereignty and had seen the truth, on the seventh day after that, he went with his harem, ministers, and retinue to play in the water, but was surrounded by the blazing fire of hell.

original: 'o dod 'bod bzhin du mnar med pa'i dmyal ba chen por skyes te /
analyzed: 'o dod 'bod bzhin du mnar med pa'i dmyal ba chen por skyes te /
translated: Screaming, he was born in the great Avīci hell.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: With him as the basis, this was said.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'dod pa dag la ro myong bar byed pa ni dang po mngar bas bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'dod pa dag la ro myong bar byed pa ni dang po mngar bas bstan to //
translated: Here, the condensed meaning: enjoying the taste of desires is taught by the first sweet taste.

original: lhag ma ni nyes dmigs te 'bras bu tsha bas ni mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes dmigs bstan te mya ngan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni nyes dmigs te 'bras bu tsha bas ni mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes dmigs bstan te mya ngan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rest is the disadvantage, taught by the hot result, the disadvantage in this life, because it is the cause of sorrow.

original: rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bas ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi nyes dmigs bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bas ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi nyes dmigs bstan te /
translated: By the suffering of ripening, the disadvantage in the next world is taught.

original: sreg par byed pa dang chos mthun pa yin pas me sgron gyi dpe bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sreg par byed pa dang chos mthun pa yin pas me sgron gyi dpe bstan pa yin no //
translated: The example of the lamp is taught because it is similar to that which burns.

original: mngar ba ni yid du 'ong ba dang dga' ba dang sdug pa'o //
analyzed: mngar ba ni yid du 'ong ba dang dga' ba dang sdug pa'o //
translated: Sweet means agreeable, delightful, and pleasing.

original: dang po la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid do //
analyzed: dang po la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid do //
translated: The first and so on are just that.

original: 'dir dang po'i sgra ni thog ma'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i sgra ni thog ma'i tshig ste /
translated: Here, the word first is a word for beginning.

original: sngar chu btang nas bsod snyoms byin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: sngar chu btang nas bsod snyoms byin pa bzhin te /
translated: Like first giving water and then giving alms.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni thog mar dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'bras bu tsha ba zhes bya ba ni tsha zhing yid @92a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni thog mar dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don to // 'bras bu tsha ba zhes bya ba ni tsha zhing yid @92a * //
translated: The meaning is that desires are delightful in the beginning.

original: du mi 'ong ba dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa de ni 'bras bu tsha ba'o //
analyzed: du mi 'ong ba dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa de ni 'bras bu tsha ba'o //
translated: The fruit is hot means that the hot, disagreeable, and undesirable fruit that ripens is the hot fruit.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'dod pa dag las 'jig rten bsad dang bcing ba byung //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las 'jig rten bsad dang bcing ba byung //
translated: From desires, killing and binding arise in the world.

original: mya ngan 'jig dang ngal dang sna tshogs sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: mya ngan 'jig dang ngal dang sna tshogs sdug bsngal te //
translated: Sorrow, destruction, fatigue, and various sufferings.

original: 'dod pa de nyid kyis kyang rgyal po ltung gyur te //
analyzed: 'dod pa de nyid kyis kyang rgyal po ltung gyur te //
translated: By those very desires, kings fall.

original: chos nyams bab col pha rol tu ni dmyal bar 'gro //
analyzed: chos nyams bab col pha rol tu ni dmyal bar 'gro //
translated: One who violates the Dharma goes to hell in the next world.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba rnams tha mar 'byung ba dang / de'i rgyus ngan par spyod pa bsags pas ngan song gi sdug bsngal rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba rnams tha mar 'byung ba dang / de'i rgyus ngan par spyod pa bsags pas ngan song gi sdug bsngal rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one who violates the Dharma experiences the suffering of the miserable destinies, because he has accumulated evil conduct due to grief, lamentation, suffering, and mental anguish that occur in this very life, and because of that cause, he experiences the fruition of suffering in the miserable destinies.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rnam sman sdug bsngal te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam sman sdug bsngal te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The fruition of violation is suffering.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni mngon par mi 'dod pa yin te ngan song gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni mngon par mi 'dod pa yin te ngan song gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fruition of violation is undesirable, because it is the fruition of the miserable destinies.

original: yang ci 'di dag gnas skabs thams cad du de ltar yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci 'di dag gnas skabs thams cad du de ltar yin nam zhe na /
translated: Moreover, is this always so?

original: thams cad la ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not so in all cases.🔽However, it is said:

original: 'on kyang dga' zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dga' zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: When there is joy, there is no violation.

original: mngon par don du gnyer ba ste gang gi phyir sred pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod pa mngon par 'dod pa de dag nyid la dang po mngar bzhin 'bras bu tsha la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par don du gnyer ba ste gang gi phyir sred pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod pa mngon par 'dod pa de dag nyid la dang po mngar bzhin 'bras bu tsha la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because of craving, one desires and seeks objects, and they are the cause of suffering results, since they are sweet in the beginning but have a bitter result.

original: dga' ba med par 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba med par 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: But this is not so for those who are free from attachment, who do not delight in them.

original: rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang yin la dga' ba yang yin pas dga' ba'i rnam smin sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang yin la dga' ba yang yin pas dga' ba'i rnam smin sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: The result is both suffering and delightful, thus it is a delightful result that is suffering.

original: las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This is the retention of karma.

original: tshig rkang 'og ma ni tha dad par byas la 'di ni bsdu ba byas pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshig rkang 'og ma ni tha dad par byas la 'di ni bsdu ba byas pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is the latter half of the verse stated separately and the former half combined?

original: smras pa / spyi dang khyad par bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / spyi dang khyad par bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it establishes the general and the specific.

original: spyi ni 'di ltar 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa gnyis kyi 'di dag dang po mngar ba dang 'bras bu tsha ba yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni 'di ltar 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa gnyis kyi 'di dag dang po mngar ba dang 'bras bu tsha ba yin no //
translated: The general is stated thus: “These are sweet in the beginning but have a bitter result for both āryas and non-āryas.”

original: sdig pa spyod par 'jug pa rnams dga' bar gyur na ni rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: sdig pa spyod par 'jug pa rnams dga' bar gyur na ni rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: When those who engage in evil deeds are happy, the result is suffering.

original: dang po dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: dang po dga' ba yin no //
translated: This is the first kind of happiness.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs sdug gu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs sdug gu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “desire” refers to attractive forms, etc.

original: ji ltar dga' ba yod pa las rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dga' ba yod pa las rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
translated: How can there be suffering as a result of happiness?🔽The response is:

original: sreg byed ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sreg byed ces bya ba smos te /
translated: “It burns”

original: rjes su mched nas yongs su sreg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mched nas yongs su sreg par byed pa'o //
translated: because it burns after spreading.

original: gang sreg par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang sreg par byed ce na /
translated: What does it burn?🔽The response is:

original: smras pa / byis pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / byis pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “The childish”

original: 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba so so'i skye bo ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba so so'i skye bo ste /
translated: refers to ordinary beings who pursue desires.

original: de yang bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa @92b la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa @92b la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: They are confused about what should and should not be done.

original: ji lta bur sreg par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bur sreg par byed ce na /
translated: How does it burn?🔽The response is:

original: smras pa / me sgron zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / me sgron zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Like a torch”

original: 'bar ba dang bcas bzhin du phyar bas bzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba dang bcas bzhin du phyar bas bzung ba'o //
translated: refers to a torch that is burning and is grasped.

original: me sgron gyis gang sreg par byed ce na /
analyzed: me sgron gyis gang sreg par byed ce na /
translated: What does the torch burn?

original: smras pa / ma bor ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma bor ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He said, “Those who are not released.”

original: gang ma bor ba de'i lag pa sreg par byed do //
analyzed: gang ma bor ba de'i lag pa sreg par byed do //
translated: Those who are not released have their hands burned.

original: de bzhin du gang dag 'dod pa dag la dga' ba de nyid des tshig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag 'dod pa dag la dga' ba de nyid des tshig par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, those who delight in sensual pleasures are burned by that very thing.

original: mthong ba'i chos la ni mya ngan gyi mes so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la ni mya ngan gyi mes so //
translated: In this very life, they are burned by the fire of grief.

original: pha rol du ni sdug bsngal gyi mes so //
analyzed: pha rol du ni sdug bsngal gyi mes so //
translated: In the next life, they are burned by the fire of hell.

original: 'dod pa dag la mnog tu mthong zhing nyes dmigs su ma mthong ba rnams la 'dod pa rnams skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //🔽'dod pa'i ching ma dag ni dgrol bar dka' ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la mnog tu mthong zhing nyes dmigs su ma mthong ba rnams la 'dod pa rnams skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so // 'dod pa'i ching ma dag ni dgrol bar dka' ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: This verse was spoken in order to generate disgust for sensual pleasures in those who see sensual pleasures as good and do not see their danger.

original: nor bu'i rna cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: nor bu'i rna cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
translated: Two verses on the difficulty of releasing the bonds of sensual pleasures.

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis skye bo'i tshogs chen po rnam par bcings zhes grag ste /
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis skye bo'i tshogs chen po rnam par bcings zhes grag ste /
translated: King Prasenajit is said to have bound a great crowd of people.

original: kha cig ni lcags kyi ching mas bcings so ;
analyzed: kha cig ni lcags kyi ching mas bcings so ;
translated: Some he bound with iron chains.

original: / kha cig ni shing gi ching mas bcings so //
analyzed: / kha cig ni shing gi ching mas bcings so //
translated: Some were bound with ropes of wood.

original: kha cig ni gres ma'i ching mas bcings so //
analyzed: kha cig ni gres ma'i ching mas bcings so //
translated: Some were bound with ropes of bamboo.

original: dge slong rnams mnyan yod du bsod snyoms spyod pa dag gis de thos nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol te /
analyzed: dge slong rnams mnyan yod du bsod snyoms spyod pa dag gis de thos nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol te /
translated: The monks who were begging for alms in Śrāvastī heard about this and reported it to the Blessed One.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs so //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One said this:

original: gzhan dag ni g-yul las rgyal ba zhes bya ba skyo ba chen po skyes te rab tu byung nas de'i sngar gyi bu khye'u gnyis zhig nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni g-yul las rgyal ba zhes bya ba skyo ba chen po skyes te rab tu byung nas de'i sngar gyi bu khye'u gnyis zhig nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: Others, called 'victorious in battle,' gave rise to great weariness, went forth, and placed their two previous sons nearby.

original: chags pa med par byung ba las bu de chags pas yang dang yang du bzlog nas ji srid du bdun pa nyid la dgra bcom pa thob par gyur te /
analyzed: chags pa med par byung ba las bu de chags pas yang dang yang du bzlog nas ji srid du bdun pa nyid la dgra bcom pa thob par gyur te /
translated: Because of attachment to his sons, he repeatedly turned back. However, up to the seventh time, he attained arhatship.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: With him in mind, this was said.

original: 'phags pa dag gang bcings pa dam po ma yin par 'dod pa dang / gang dam por 'dod pa dang / ji ltar yang gang gis de dam por yin yang 'phags pa rnams kyis myur du gcod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag gang bcings pa dam po ma yin par 'dod pa dang / gang dam por 'dod pa dang / ji ltar yang gang gis de dam por yin yang 'phags pa rnams kyis myur du gcod par byed pa yin te /
translated: The noble ones consider that which is not a tight bondage, and that which is a tight bondage, and by whatever means the noble ones quickly cut through that which is a tight bondage.

original: 'di ni tshigs bcad 'di gnyis kyi bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshigs bcad 'di gnyis kyi bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the condensed meaning of these two verses.

original: de dag dam po min zhes bya ba de brtan pa ma yin zhing gcad par mi nus pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag dam po min zhes bya ba de brtan pa ma yin zhing gcad par mi nus pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are not tight means they are not firm and cannot be cut.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ching ma'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ching ma'o //
translated: They means the bonds.

original: gang gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa de ni ching ma ste /
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa de ni ching ma ste /
translated: That which is under the control of another is a bond.

original: gzhan dbang gi yo byad ces bya ba'i don to //🔽'phags pa ni lung dang sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos so //
analyzed: gzhan dbang gi yo byad ces bya ba'i don to // 'phags pa ni lung dang sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos so //
translated: The meaning is that they are objects under the control of another.

original: gsungs @93a * //
analyzed: gsungs @93a * //
translated: The noble ones are the scriptures, the Buddha, and his śrāvakas.

original: pa ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Spoken means taught.

original: de gang zhig yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de gang zhig yin zhe na smras pa /
translated: What is that? It is said:

original: gang lcags zhes bya ba ni lcags las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang lcags zhes bya ba ni lcags las gyur pa ste /
translated: That which is iron means that which is made of iron.

original: de yang lcags kyi rang bzhin lcags sgrog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang lcags kyi rang bzhin lcags sgrog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The iron one is made of iron, such as fetters, and so on.

original: shing ni shing gi rang bzhin las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: shing ni shing gi rang bzhin las gyur pa ste /
translated: The wooden one is made of wood,

original: shing gi rnam pa las byas pa'o //
analyzed: shing gi rnam pa las byas pa'o //
translated: such as a wooden collar.

original: gres ma ni rtsva las byas pa ste /
analyzed: gres ma ni rtsva las byas pa ste /
translated: The rope one is made of grass,

original: thag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as a rope, and so on.

original: 'dis ni phyi rol gyi 'ching ba la 'phags pa rnams brtan po ma yin par 'dod pa nyid du rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyi rol gyi 'ching ba la 'phags pa rnams brtan po ma yin par 'dod pa nyid du rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: By this, one should understand that the noble ones consider external bonds to be weak.

original: de lta na gang dam po yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na gang dam po yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is strong?

original: smras pa / yongs su chags sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / yongs su chags sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said: “The mind that is attached, and so on.

original: gang la kun du chags pa'i sems yod pa de ni yongs su chags sems te /
analyzed: gang la kun du chags pa'i sems yod pa de ni yongs su chags sems te /
translated: ” The mind that is attached is the mind that is attached.

original: sems la nye ba'i nyon mongs pas kun du nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems la nye ba'i nyon mongs pas kun du nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind is defiled by the secondary defilement of attachment.

original: gang yang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i yid kyis yongs su chags pa'i sems ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang yang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i yid kyis yongs su chags pa'i sems ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Even if the mind is not defiled, the mind that is attached is like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can la snying rje dang bcas pa'i ngo bo yin zhing sred pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can la snying rje dang bcas pa'i ngo bo yin zhing sred pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are compassionate by nature, not by the nature of craving.

original: yun ring snying rjes 'brel pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yun ring snying rjes 'brel pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are long-enduring through compassion.

original: zhes bya ba'i bstod pa las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bstod pa las so //
translated: This is the praise.

original: de gang la 'jug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang la 'jug pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that they enter?

original: smras pa / nor bu'i rna cha zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / nor bu'i rna cha zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: “earrings of jewels.”

original: nor bu'i rna cha ni nor bu'i rna cha ste zlas dbye ba ste /
analyzed: nor bu'i rna cha ni nor bu'i rna cha ste zlas dbye ba ste /
translated: Earring of jewels is a compound.

original: de dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la'o //
translated: They are for those.

original: nor bu zhes bya ba ni bzo ma byas pa'i nor gyi dpe don to //
analyzed: nor bu zhes bya ba ni bzo ma byas pa'i nor gyi dpe don to //
translated: Jewel means an example of wealth that is not man-made.

original: bzo byas pa'i dpe'i don ni rna cha ste /
analyzed: bzo byas pa'i dpe'i don ni rna cha ste /
translated: The example of what is man-made is an earring.

original: rna ba'i rgyan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rna ba'i rgyan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means an ornament for the ear.

original: 'dis ni sems can du gtogs pa ma yin pa'i dngos po de la ltos pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can du gtogs pa ma yin pa'i dngos po de la ltos pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows that they are dependent on that which is not included among sentient beings.

original: bu dang bu mo la zhes bya ba ni sems can du gtogs pa'i dngos po la ltos pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: bu dang bu mo la zhes bya ba ni sems can du gtogs pa'i dngos po la ltos pa nyid du ston to //
translated: “Sons and daughters” shows that they are dependent on that which is included among sentient beings.

original: bu la zhes bya ba ni bdag las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bu la zhes bya ba ni bdag las skyes pa'o //
translated: “Sons” means those born from oneself.

original: bu mo la zhes bya bas ni chung ma yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: bu mo la zhes bya bas ni chung ma yang bsdu'o //
translated: The word daughter includes wife.

original: dang gi sgra ni nor bu la sogs pa nyi tshe ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni nor bu la sogs pa nyi tshe ma yin gyi /
translated: The word and is used because it is not only the jewel, etc.,

original: bu la sogs pa la yang yin pa'i phyir dang gi sgra smos so //
analyzed: bu la sogs pa la yang yin pa'i phyir dang gi sgra smos so //
translated: but also the son, etc.

original: gang yin la ltos zhes bya ba ni sred pa yongs su ma spangs pa'i bsam pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yin la ltos zhes bya ba ni sred pa yongs su ma spangs pa'i bsam pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word whoever means who has not abandoned craving.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa ltos pa dang ldan pa ni sred pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa ltos pa dang ldan pa ni sred pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As it is said, One who is dependent is said to be one who has craving.

original: rab tu dgrol bar dka' zhes 'phags pas gsungs //
analyzed: rab tu dgrol bar dka' zhes 'phags pas gsungs //
translated: The noble ones say, It is difficult to liberate.

original: zhes bya ba ni yongs su chags pa'i sems la ltos pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yongs su chags pa'i sems la ltos pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This refers to the mind that is attached.

original: 'di nyid ni shin tu 'ching ba dam po yin no @93b zhes mkhas pa rnams ston te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni shin tu 'ching ba dam po yin no @93b zhes mkhas pa rnams ston te /
translated: The wise teach that this is a very strong bondage.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na smras pa /
translated: Why is that? It is said:

original: 'dod pa'i ching mas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i ching mas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because of the bondage of desire, etc.

original: gang yin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word whoever indicates the cause.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag la ltos pa'i ching ma ni spang bar bya ba la 'gog cing gags byed pas 'dod chags pa la sogs pa bcad par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag la ltos pa'i ching ma ni spang bar bya ba la 'gog cing gags byed pas 'dod chags pa la sogs pa bcad par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, the fetter that is based on these is not able to cut off and destroy attachment, etc., because it obstructs and hinders the abandonment of that which is to be abandoned.

original: bcings pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: bcings pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba ste /
translated: One who is bound is not able to go as he wishes,

original: rgyug pa dang mchong ba la sogs pa bya ba'i mthu med do //
analyzed: rgyug pa dang mchong ba la sogs pa bya ba'i mthu med do //
translated: because he lacks the power to act, such as running and jumping.

original: lag na mtshon cha la sogs pa dang ldan pas ni bde bar bcad du rung ba'i phyir grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag na mtshon cha la sogs pa dang ldan pas ni bde bar bcad du rung ba'i phyir grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But one who is endowed with weapons, etc., in his hands is able to cut off and destroy easily, and thus he is liberated.

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so for the fetters.

original: des na de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni dgrol bar dka'o zhes 'phags pas gsungs so //
analyzed: des na de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni dgrol bar dka'o zhes 'phags pas gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the noble ones have said that it is difficult to liberate from them.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dod pa'i ching ma ni chags par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dod pa'i ching ma ni chags par byed pa ste /
translated: Others say: The fetter of desire causes attachment,

original: sems 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it steals the mind.

original: lhod kyang zhes bya ba 'gro ba thams cad du bcings kyang nyam nga ba med do //
analyzed: lhod kyang zhes bya ba 'gro ba thams cad du bcings kyang nyam nga ba med do //
translated: Even when relaxed, one is bound in all migrations, but there is no danger.

original: lhod pa'i phyir dgrol sla ba yin no zhes rtog pa dag bzlog pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: lhod pa'i phyir dgrol sla ba yin no zhes rtog pa dag bzlog pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to refute the idea that it is easy to release the mind because it is relaxed, he says:

original: rab tu dgrol bar dka' zhes bya ba smos te /🔽dka' bas thar cing bcad par bya //
analyzed: rab tu dgrol bar dka' zhes bya ba smos te / dka' bas thar cing bcad par bya //
translated: It is very difficult to release.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is difficult to liberate and cut.

original: mtshon dang me dang chu dang / sngags dang sman la sogs pa dang / thams cad du rab tu smra ba rnams kyis shin tu dgrol bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshon dang me dang chu dang / sngags dang sman la sogs pa dang / thams cad du rab tu smra ba rnams kyis shin tu dgrol bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it cannot be released at all by weapons, fire, water, mantras, medicine, etc.

original: 'di nyid ni ching ma dam po yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni ching ma dam po yin te /
translated: This is a very tight bondage.

original: gang gi phyir ltos pa'i ching ma de la btsal bar 'dod cing de bzhin du gang brjod par gyur na yang gcod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ltos pa'i ching ma de la btsal bar 'dod cing de bzhin du gang brjod par gyur na yang gcod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bondage of dependence is sought after, and likewise, when it is expressed, it cannot be cut.

original: lhod pas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'jug pa na bdag ni bcings so zhes mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: lhod pas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'jug pa na bdag ni bcings so zhes mi shes pa yin no //
translated: When it is relaxed, one does not know that one is bound, because one engages as one wishes.

original: de rab tu dgrol bar dka' bas dgrol bar 'dod kyang dgrol bar mi nus pa yin te /
analyzed: de rab tu dgrol bar dka' bas dgrol bar 'dod kyang dgrol bar mi nus pa yin te /
translated: Since it is very difficult to release, one wishes to release it, but one cannot release it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa dang / brtan pas so sor brtags pa dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa dang / brtan pas so sor brtags pa dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs ni ma gtogs so //
translated: except for the power of the Buddha's teaching, the power of discernment, and the power of cultivation.

original: rgyu 'di gsum gyis ni ltos pa'i bcings pa nyid dam po yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu 'di gsum gyis ni ltos pa'i bcings pa nyid dam po yin gyi /
translated: By these three causes, the bondage of dependence is the highest bondage.

original: lcags la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lcags la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not iron, etc.

original: 'di nyid 'ching ba dam po yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'ching ba dam po yin no //
translated: This is the highest bondage.

original: rab tu dgrol dka' ba de ji ltar su zhig gis gcad par nus she na /
analyzed: rab tu dgrol dka' ba de ji ltar su zhig gis gcad par nus she na /
translated: How can it be cut by anyone?

original: smras pa / de dag gtubs nas zhes smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / de dag gtubs nas zhes smos te /
translated: It is said: Having cut them.

original: gtubs pa ni bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gtubs pa ni bcad pa'o //
translated: Cutting is cutting.

original: myur du zhes bya ba ni ring po mi thogs par te /🔽lam myur du byed pa'i phyir te sbyor ba gcig gis kyang khams gsum po thams @94a * //
analyzed: myur du zhes bya ba ni ring po mi thogs par te / lam myur du byed pa'i phyir te sbyor ba gcig gis kyang khams gsum po thams @94a * //
translated: Quickly means not long after.

original: cad kyi bag la nyal spangs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cad kyi bag la nyal spangs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path is quickly made, by one application, all the latent tendencies of the three realms are abandoned.

original: de dag myur du gtubs nas ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: de dag myur du gtubs nas ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: Having quickly cut them, what is done?

original: smras pa / 'gro bar byed ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'gro bar byed ces bya ba yin te /
translated: It is said: One goes.

original: 'khor ba yongs su spangs nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su spangs nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Having abandoned samsara, one goes to nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: One goes to nirvana through arhatship.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is it done?

original: smras pa / mi lta bar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / mi lta bar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: “without looking.”

original: ltos shing sred pa gang la yod pa de ni lta ba ste /
analyzed: ltos shing sred pa gang la yod pa de ni lta ba ste /
translated: One who has craving and views is one who looks.

original: de dgag pa ni mi lta ba ste /
analyzed: de dgag pa ni mi lta ba ste /
translated: The negation of that is “without looking.”

original: ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa'o //
translated: That is nonattachment.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa'i bde la zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa'i bde la zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is said: “at the pleasure of desire.”

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod la zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽lus dang sems dben pa nyid rtog par smras pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod la zhes bya ba'i don to // lus dang sems dben pa nyid rtog par smras pa /
translated: The meaning is “at the enjoyment of desire.”

original: brtan rnams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brtan rnams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The isolation of body and mind is said to be “the stability of the wise.”

original: blo dang ldan pas so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis skyo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis skyo ba med pa ste /
translated: The wise ones, through the power of discernment and cultivation, are without weariness.

original: de yang brtson 'grus dang shes rab kyi mi dge ba la 'jug pa'i la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba rtsom pa de la ltos pa bcad pas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings rtogs shing yongs su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang brtson 'grus dang shes rab kyi mi dge ba la 'jug pa'i la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba rtsom pa de la ltos pa bcad pas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings rtogs shing yongs su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, by cutting off the application of the preparation for engaging in the non-virtue of effort and wisdom, one realizes and goes to the realm of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains the realm of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: phyi rol gyi 'ching bas skyo bar byas te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'ching bas skyo bar byas te /
translated: Having become weary of external bondage,

original: nang gi lus la sred pas bcings pa la yongs su skyo ba skyed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: nang gi lus la sred pas bcings pa la yongs su skyo ba skyed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: in order to generate weariness with internal bondage by craving for the body, this verse was spoken.

original: 'di dag yang dag par brtags na ni sred pa nyid 'dod pa yin te /🔽yul ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'di dag yang dag par brtags na ni sred pa nyid 'dod pa yin te / yul ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: If these are properly examined, craving itself is desire,🔽and not objects. In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The various worlds... and so forth.

original: yul koo sh'amb'i na dge bsnyen rab tu mang po ltad mo lta ba'i khang pa na 'dus shing 'dug pa las bar skabs su 'di lta bu'i gtam brjod par gyur te /
analyzed: yul koo sh'amb'i na dge bsnyen rab tu mang po ltad mo lta ba'i khang pa na 'dus shing 'dug pa las bar skabs su 'di lta bu'i gtam brjod par gyur te /
translated: In the land of Kauśāmbī, many lay vow holders were gathered in a hall to watch a show. In the middle of the show, they had this kind of discussion:

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba gang yin zhe'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba gang yin zhe'o //
translated: “What is called desire?”

original: de na kha cig gis 'di skad du /
analyzed: de na kha cig gis 'di skad du /
translated: Some said,

original: yid du 'ong ba'i chung ma'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i chung ma'o zhes zer ro //
translated: “A beautiful wife.”🔽Others said,

original: gzhan dag na re zhes ngag nyan pa'i bu yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes ngag nyan pa'i bu yin no zhes so //
translated: “A son who listens to your words.”🔽Others said,

original: gzhan dag ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs yin no zhe'o //
translated: “The form that is the object of visual consciousness.”

original: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then they went into the presence of the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags nyid 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags nyid 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: “Desire is just the desire of longing.🔽What will these external inanimate things, such as beautiful forms, do?”

original: phyi rol gyi bems po gzugs sdug pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes rgya cher @94b gsungs te tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bems po gzugs sdug pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes rgya cher @94b gsungs te tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to //
translated: He spoke extensively and uttered this verse:

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni gang 'dod pa ma yin pa dang / ci nas kyang de bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni gang 'dod pa ma yin pa dang / ci nas kyang de bstan pa'o //
translated: The condensed meaning of this is: not that, and how that is taught.

original: de 'dod min zhes bya ba ni yul rnams rang bzhin gyis 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'dod min zhes bya ba ni yul rnams rang bzhin gyis 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba dgag pa yin no //
translated: Not that is the negation of the assertion that objects are intrinsically desirable.
