original: gang dang de gnyis ni rtag tu 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang de gnyis ni rtag tu 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The two, that and not that, are always related.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /🔽gang 'dod pa zhes bya ba de smras pa /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na / gang 'dod pa zhes bya ba de smras pa /
translated: What is that?

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs gang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs gang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That which is desirable is stated: that which is the variety of the world.

original: gang ni gang zhig go //
analyzed: gang ni gang zhig go //
translated: What is that?

original: 'jig rten ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: The world is the world of sentient beings.

original: sna tshogs pa ni sems skyo bar byed pa ste /🔽yid tshim par byed pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni sems skyo bar byed pa ste / yid tshim par byed pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: The variety is the variety of mental states that cause weariness.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'o //
translated: Because it satisfies the mind, it is the variety of desirable things that are agreeable to the passion of sense desire, namely, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects.

original: de ni 'dir 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dir 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not desirable here,

original: seng ge'i phug seng ger mi 'gyur ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: seng ge'i phug seng ger mi 'gyur ba de bzhin no //
translated: just as a lion's cave is not a lion.

original: de ltar na 'dod pa zhes smos pa de gang yin zhe na smras pa //🔽kun rtog 'dod chags zhes bya ba smos te /🔽'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags sam /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa zhes smos pa de gang yin zhe na smras pa // kun rtog 'dod chags zhes bya ba smos te / 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags sam /
translated: It is the desire that is discursive thought.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las skyes pa'o /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las skyes pa'o /
translated: It is the desire that is associated with discursive thought, or it is the desire that arises from incorrect mental attention.

original: 'dir 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa'i yul rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas brtags pa ni kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa'i yul rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas brtags pa ni kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: Here, the incorrect mental attention to past and future objects is discursive thought.

original: da ltar byung ba la lhag par zhen pa ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la lhag par zhen pa ni 'dod chags so //
translated: The attachment to present objects is desire.

original: yang na ma thob pa thob pa'i phyir bskyed pa ni kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ma thob pa thob pa'i phyir bskyed pa ni kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: Or else, discursive thought is the desire to obtain what has not been obtained.

original: thob pa la zhen pa ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: thob pa la zhen pa ni 'dod chags te /
translated: Desire is the attachment to what has been obtained.

original: kun du rtog pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'dod chags ni kun rtog 'dod chags so //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'dod chags ni kun rtog 'dod chags so //
translated: The desire that is associated with discursive thought is the desire that is discursive thought.

original: yang na 'dun pa'i 'dod chags ni 'dun pa nyid 'dod chags yin pas 'dun pa'i 'dod chags to /
analyzed: yang na 'dun pa'i 'dod chags ni 'dun pa nyid 'dod chags yin pas 'dun pa'i 'dod chags to /
translated: Or else, the desire that is will is the desire that is will, because will itself is desire.

original: don du gnyer ba'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'i 'dod chags so //
translated: It is the desire to obtain.

original: 'dun pa yod la 'dod chags med pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dun pa yod la 'dod chags med pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also desire without attachment,

original: dper na 'gro bar 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na 'gro bar 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as the desire to go, etc.

original: 'dod chags yod la 'dun pa med pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dod chags yod la 'dun pa med pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also attachment without desire,

original: dper na gos la mngon par zhen pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na gos la mngon par zhen pa lta bu ste /
translated: such as the attachment to clothing, etc.

original: de bas na 'dir gnyi ga gzung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir gnyi ga gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, both are included here.

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The term “person” refers to the afflicted class of entities,

original: yang dang yang du las dang nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang ci 'dod pa'i rgyu ni kun rtog nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: yang dang yang du las dang nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i phyir ro // yang ci 'dod pa'i rgyu ni kun rtog nyid yin gyi /
translated: because they repeatedly destroy karma and the afflictions.

original: dngos po sna tshogs ni ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dngos po sna tshogs ni ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that the cause of desire is only imagination and not the variety of things, it is said:

original: 'di ltar sna tshogs gnas kyang ni //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sna tshogs gnas kyang ni // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because, although the variety exists,

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams pa sna tshogs @95a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams pa sna tshogs @95a * //
translated: The term “variety” refers to the variety of forms, etc.

original: gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa yin no //
translated: It exists.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyi gzugs gang yin pa gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa gnas pa bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na yang de bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyi gzugs gang yin pa gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa gnas pa bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na yang de bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: Just as it is in the state of desire, so it is in the state of freedom from desire.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But, however, means although that is so.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzugs rnam pa dang ldan pa rnams te /🔽so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs dang ldan pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzugs rnam pa dang ldan pa rnams te / so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs dang ldan pa rnams te /
translated: In this regard, means in regard to the forms that are endowed with aspects.

original: so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the power of investigation and cultivation means endowed with the power of investigation and the power of cultivation.🔽The power of investigation is the power of wisdom.🔽The power of cultivation is the power of concentration.

original: 'dul zhes bya ba ni rnam par sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul zhes bya ba ni rnam par sel bar byed pa ste /
translated: Subdues means eliminates.

original: rnam par 'jig par byed ces bya ba'i don to //🔽'dun pa ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig par byed ces bya ba'i don to // 'dun pa ni 'dod chags te /
translated: The meaning is that it destroys.🔽Desire is attachment.

original: don du gnyer ba'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'i sred pa'o //
translated: It is craving for an object.

original: gal te yul rnams 'dod pa yin par gyur na ni des na rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par gcod par mi nus pa nyid yin gyi brtan rnams 'dod pa spang bar 'dod pas 'dun pa de nyid 'dul bar byed de gang gi phyir gnas pa bzhin
analyzed: gal te yul rnams 'dod pa yin par gyur na ni des na rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par gcod par mi nus pa nyid yin gyi brtan rnams 'dod pa spang bar 'dod pas 'dun pa de nyid 'dul bar byed de gang gi phyir gnas pa bzhin
translated: But the wise, who wish to abandon desire, subdue that desire itself, because they are like those who wish to abandon the four abodes.

original: du yang de la blo dang ldan pa rnams spong bar 'dod pas des na 'dun pa nyid 'dul bar byed de /
analyzed: du yang de la blo dang ldan pa rnams spong bar 'dod pas des na 'dun pa nyid 'dul bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, the wise subdue desire itself, because they wish to abandon it, as if it were the four abodes.

original: de bas na 'dun pa'i 'dod chags nyid 'dod pa'i yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'dun pa'i 'dod chags nyid 'dod pa'i yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, desire is the desire for desire,

original: yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul ni ma yin no //
translated: not for objects.

original: gzhan du na su yang 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na su yang 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, no one would be free from desire,

original: yul ni de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ni de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because objects would remain as they are.

original: gang dag yul spangs pa tsam gyis 'dod pa dag las thar par 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa de tsam spangs pas chog par 'dzin pa rnams kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags spang ba la gzung ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: gang dag yul spangs pa tsam gyis 'dod pa dag las thar par 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa de tsam spangs pas chog par 'dzin pa rnams kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags spang ba la gzung ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to lead those who think that liberation from desire is merely the abandonment of objects and who are content with the mere abandonment of that much, to abandon the desire of imagination.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis yul dag la yang 'dod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /🔽mi rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis yul dag la yang 'dod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / mi rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the objects are also desired in another way, he says:

original: kun du rgyu zhing 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: kun du rgyu zhing 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smra ste /
translated: “For people who are wandering around, who view in this way and speak in this way,

original: 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni med de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni med de /
translated: the forms, etc. that are desired do not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag nyid la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag nyid la /
translated: Because those very forms, etc.

original: la la la ni yid du 'ong //
analyzed: la la la ni yid du 'ong //
translated: are agreeable to some,

original: la la la ni yid du mi 'ong ba ste skyes bu so sos dngos po de bzhin dang gzhan du bsgom pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: la la la ni yid du mi 'ong ba ste skyes bu so sos dngos po de bzhin dang gzhan du bsgom pa mi rigs so //
translated: and disagreeable to others. It is not reasonable for individuals to cultivate those things in one way and in another way.

original: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs par des thos te /
analyzed: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs par des thos te /
translated: When he heard that the Blessed One was dwelling in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas don 'di zhus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas don 'di zhus te /
translated: he went into the Blessed One’s presence and asked about this matter.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was spoken with reference to him.

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni tshig rkang dang pos ni nyes dmigs @95b yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni tshig rkang dang pos ni nyes dmigs @95b yongs su bstan to //
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows: By the first verse, the disadvantage is taught.

original: gnyis pas ni ro myang ba la skye bo gang gis chags pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni ro myang ba la skye bo gang gis chags pa'o //
translated: The second line shows that people are attached to the enjoyment of the objects of desire.

original: lhag mas ni nyes dmigs mthong bas nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: lhag mas ni nyes dmigs mthong bas nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The remaining lines show that one should be free from the objects of desire because one sees their disadvantage.

original: gang gi phyir ro myang ba la rgyab kyis bltas pa yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ro myang ba la rgyab kyis bltas pa yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Because one turns one’s back on the enjoyment of the objects of desire, one is free from them.

original: da ni tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the meaning of the words will be explained.

original: med ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa ste 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: med ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa ste 'dod pa'o //
translated: “ Non-existent” means not existing, not desired.

original: ji ltar med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar med ce na /
translated: How is it non-existent?

original: smras pa / rtag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / rtag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: “permanent.”

original: rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: It is a phenomenon that does not change.

original: mi rtag pa ni yod do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni yod do //
translated: “ Impermanent” does exist.

original: 'dis ni ji ltar 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par bya ba med pa ma yin pas de ltar ston to //🔽gang la zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: 'dis ni ji ltar 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par bya ba med pa ma yin pas de ltar ston to // gang la zhe na smras pa /
translated: This shows that the objects of desire are not non-existent, as one might think.🔽Where? It is said: “among people.”

original: mi rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /🔽shed bu dag la'o //
analyzed: mi rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /🔽shed bu dag la'o //
translated: Among humans.

original: 'di la rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can rnams 'dod pa dag 'jig pa nye bar mthong ba'i phyir yid ches par bya ba rnyed sla ba yin pas mi zhes bya ba tsam smos kyi /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can rnams 'dod pa dag 'jig pa nye bar mthong ba'i phyir yid ches par bya ba rnyed sla ba yin pas mi zhes bya ba tsam smos kyi /
translated: Here, the things that are subject to change are easily found to be credible because one sees their destruction, so it is said that they are “merely called ‘things.’”

original: 'dod pa thams cad kyang tshul de lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad kyang tshul de lta bu nyid do //
translated: All things are just like that.

original: gal te 'di dag rtag par med na ni de lta na dngos po yod pa zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin du med pa yin no zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag rtag par med na ni de lta na dngos po yod pa zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin du med pa yin no zhe na smras pa /
translated: If they are permanent, they do not exist, like a second moon.

original: de yod pa'ang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yod pa'ang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The word “also” is stated because

original: re zhig yod pa'i rkyen la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig yod pa'i rkyen la yod pa yin no //
translated: they exist as a condition of existence.

original: yang gi sgra ni dngos po yang dag par yod pa ste /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni dngos po yang dag par yod pa ste /
translated: The word “also” means that things exist in reality,

original: 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i sa bon bzhin no //
translated: like a seed that possesses a fruit.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do unconditioned things exist?

original: des na khyad par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: des na khyad par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show the difference, it is said:

original: mi rtag pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Impermanent” is stated.

original: rnam par 'jig  pa'i chos can yin pas mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig  pa'i chos can yin pas mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Impermanent means that which is subject to destruction.

original: gang la yod ce na /
analyzed: gang la yod ce na /
translated: Where does it exist?

original: 'di ltar 'dod can zhes bya ba smos te /🔽'dod pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang la yod pa de ni 'dod can te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod can zhes bya ba smos te / 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang la yod pa de ni 'dod can te /
translated: Thus, it is said, “one who is desirous.🔽” One who is desirous is one who has the attachment of desire for sense objects.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'o //
translated: One who is not free from attachment to sense objects.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni yul gyi 'dod pa dag la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni yul gyi 'dod pa dag la'o //
translated: “In regard to what” refers to sense objects.

original: chags pa ni rang dbang du ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni rang dbang du ma byas pa'o //
translated: “Attachment” means not being in control.

original: gang gi phyir btson ra'i nang na yod na su zhig bsdams par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir btson ra'i nang na yod na su zhig bsdams par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because, when one is in prison, who is not bound?

original: de ltar rtag pa nyid du yang dag par brtags te yod pa de spangs shing bor nas 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa nyid du yang dag par brtags te yod pa de spangs shing bor nas 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: Thus, having thoroughly examined the existence of permanence, one should abandon and reject the sense objects and fully understand them.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: blang bar bya ba dang / dor bar bya ba dang / lhag par btang snyoms su bya ba gsum po 'di'i dngos po yod cing gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba dang / dor bar bya ba dang / lhag par btang snyoms su bya ba gsum po 'di'i dngos po yod cing gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three things to be taken up, to be rejected, and to be left as they are exist and endure.

original: smras pa / spang bar bya ba ni nges par zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spang gi de nyid ni spang bar bya ba ni rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / spang bar bya ba ni nges par zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spang gi de nyid ni spang bar bya ba ni rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //

original: yang srid med phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang srid med phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is that one should abandon the affliction that takes the eye as its object, but one should not abandon the eye itself.🔽The

original: ci nas kyang yang skye ba med par 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang yang skye ba med par 'gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the non-arising of any of the proclivities of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis spang bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis spang bar bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on what is to be abandoned by the path of the noble ones.

original: de'i phyir dge slong dag gang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spang bar bya'o zhes pa'i tshig gis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dag gang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spang bar bya'o zhes pa'i tshig gis te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “monks, those that are to be abandoned by the wisdom of the noble ones” is stated.

original: gang 'phags pas 'di dag spangs pa ni yang srid par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'phags pas 'di dag spangs pa ni yang srid par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those that are abandoned by the noble ones do not arise again.

analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis spangs pa 'di dag ni yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those that are abandoned by ordinary beings arise again.

original: de ltar spang bar bya ba'i 'dod pa'i phra rgyas gang yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar spang bar bya ba'i 'dod pa'i phra rgyas gang yin zhe na smras pa /
translated: What are the proclivities of the desire realm that are to be abandoned in this way? It is said:

original: mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “They do not arise again.”

original: mi 'ong bar zhes bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: mi 'ong bar zhes bya ba nyid de /
translated: This is the same as “they do not come.”

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag de zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag de zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “that noble being” is a remainder of the sentence.

original: mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “they do not arise again”?

original: smras pa / 'chi ba'i gnas zhes smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'chi ba'i gnas zhes smos te /
translated: It is said: “The state of death.”

original: 'chi ba'i gnas ni gnas pa gang la yod pa de 'chi ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas ni gnas pa gang la yod pa de 'chi ba'i gnas te /
translated: The state of death is that in which death exists.

original: 'chi ba'i gnas ni skye ba'i sgo ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas ni skye ba'i sgo ste /
translated: The place of death is the door of birth.

original: yang skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of birth is to be born again.

original: gang gi phyir ma skyes na ni 'chi bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma skyes na ni 'chi bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: For if one is not born, one does not die.

original: gang zhig skyes nas mi 'chi ba ni med de des na skye ba la brten pa ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig skyes nas mi 'chi ba ni med de des na skye ba la brten pa ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: There is no one who is born and does not die. Thus death is based on birth.

original: gzhan dag na re 'chi ba nyid 'chi ba nyid 'chi ba'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'chi ba nyid 'chi ba nyid 'chi ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: Others say: Death itself is the place of death,

original: ming nyid ming gi gnas lta bu'o zhes so //
analyzed: ming nyid ming gi gnas lta bu'o zhes so //
translated: just as name itself is the place of name.

original: 'o na yang gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba yang phyir mi 'ong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na yang gtan du 'dod chags dang bral ba yang phyir mi 'ong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if this is so, then one who is completely detached would not be a non-returner,

original: 'chi ba'i gnas nyid du 'ong ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas nyid du 'ong ba yod do zhe na /
translated: because he would return to the place of death.

original: de ni de ltar bden pa nyid de 'on kyang nges par ni 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: de ni de ltar bden pa nyid de 'on kyang nges par ni 'ong ba med do //
translated: This is true, but he does not definitely return.

original: yang na srid pa tha ma pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: yang na srid pa tha ma pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Or else, this is stated with reference to one in his last existence.

original: de la dgongs pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la dgongs pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Thus there is no fault, because this is the intended meaning.

original: yang na thams cad bsdus te spang ba'i dus su de dang bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir de spang ba bstan te /
analyzed: yang na thams cad bsdus te spang ba'i dus su de dang bral ba'i thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir de spang ba bstan te /
translated: Or else, when all are abandoned together, the obtainment of separation from them is acquired, and thus their abandonment is taught.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: dgra bcom pa'i gnas skabs de la 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / @96b srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i gnas skabs de la 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / @96b srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: “At the time of becoming an arhat, the mind is liberated from the defilement of desire, the defilement of existence, and the defilement of ignorance.”

original: kha cig tu ni mi 'gro bar zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni mi 'gro bar zhes brjod do //
translated: Some say: “It does not go to any other place.”

original: mi 'ong ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i don zhes gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni bdag nyid kyis de skad bshad pa yin gyi //
analyzed: mi 'ong ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i don zhes gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni bdag nyid kyis de skad bshad pa yin gyi //
translated: The meaning of “non-returner” and “non-arising” is explained by the Buddha himself,

original: gzhan dag gis ni ston par mi nus so zhes ston to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni ston par mi nus so zhes ston to //
translated: indicating that others cannot teach it.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: rgyu gsum gyis ni 'dod pa rnams spang bar mi rung bar 'gyur te /🔽gal te yang rtag par gyur na ni gter lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis ni 'dod pa rnams spang bar mi rung bar 'gyur te / gal te yang rtag par gyur na ni gter lta bu'o //
translated: Desire is not suitable to be abandoned due to three reasons.🔽If it were permanent, it would be like a treasure.

original: gal te mi rtag par gyur na ni ri bong gi rva lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag par gyur na ni ri bong gi rva lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were impermanent, it would be like a rabbit’s horns.

original: gal te gnod par ma gyur na ni 'phags pa'i lam lta__ bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gnod par ma gyur na ni 'phags pa'i lam lta__ bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not harmful, they would be like the noble path.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa ni rtag pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa ni rtag pa med de /
translated: Thus, desire does not exist permanently,

original: mi rtag pa ni yod do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni yod do //
translated: but impermanence does exist.

original: yul 'di dag la yang 'dod pa can chags pa yin te /
analyzed: yul 'di dag la yang 'dod pa can chags pa yin te /
translated: Desire is attached to these objects,

original: des na gtan du 'di dag yang srid pa med par bya ba'i phyir spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na gtan du 'di dag yang srid pa med par bya ba'i phyir spang bar bya ste /
translated: and therefore they should be abandoned in order to eliminate them forever.

original: 'di spangs pas ni 'chi ba'i gnas su mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis phan yon bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'di spangs pas ni 'chi ba'i gnas su mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis phan yon bstan pa yin no ;
translated: The benefit is taught by the method of not becoming a basis for death through abandoning them.

original: /'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par bya ba nas shes shing gzung ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: /'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par bya ba nas shes shing gzung ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was stated in order to understand and hold the teaching that desire should be fully understood.

original: 'dod pa rnams spang bar gyur pa la ni dgra bcom pa nyid ma thob kyang 'dod pa spangs pa'i phan yon bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams spang bar gyur pa la ni dgra bcom pa nyid ma thob kyang 'dod pa spangs pa'i phan yon bshad pa /
translated: The benefit of abandoning desire is explained even if the state of an arhat is not attained.

original: 'dun pa skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dun pa skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse begins, “When desire is born in the mind.

original: mdo las phyir mi 'ong ba ni rnam pa lnga zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las phyir mi 'ong ba ni rnam pa lnga zhes gsungs so //
translated: The sutra mentions five types of nonreturners.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
translated: one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state, one who attains nirvana upon birth, one who attains nirvana with effort, one who attains nirvana without effort,🔽and one who goes upstream.

original: gong du 'pho ba zhes bya ba bstan pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba zhes bya ba bstan pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs so //
translated: Here, in brief, the Blessed One taught:

original: 'dir yang mdor bsdu na tshul khrims la rab tu gnas pa'i dge slong gis khyad par rtog par bya ba'i phyir gang gis yang dag par sbyor ba dang / gang yang dag par sbyor ba dang / gang yang dag par sbyor ba'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: 'dir yang mdor bsdu na tshul khrims la rab tu gnas pa'i dge slong gis khyad par rtog par bya ba'i phyir gang gis yang dag par sbyor ba dang / gang yang dag par sbyor ba dang / gang yang dag par sbyor ba'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: for a monk who is well-established in morality, in order to investigate the distinctions, by what one is rightly applied, what one is rightly applied to, the fruit of right application,

original: gang yang de'i 'bras bu'i phan yon de dag 'dir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang de'i 'bras bu'i phan yon de dag 'dir bstan pa yin no //
translated: and the benefit of that fruit.

original: de la 'dun pa skyes pa zhes pas ni gang gis yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa skyes pa zhes pas ni gang gis yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Here, arisen aspiration refers to by what one is rightly applied.

original: zad par mi byed pa dang / sems la skyon med pa dang dran pas ni gang yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zad par mi byed pa dang / sems la skyon med pa dang dran pas ni gang yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: He does not exhaust it, and he is faultless in his mind. He is mindful in his right application.

original: gcig gis ni grong du bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba na dbang po'i sgo @97a * //🔽yongs su bsdams pas cho ga dag pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gis ni grong du bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba na dbang po'i sgo @97a * // yongs su bsdams pas cho ga dag pa'o //
translated: By one, he is pure in his conduct, since he is restrained in his sense faculties when he goes to the village for alms.

original: gnyis pa la gnas pas ni sgrib pa dag las sems yongs su sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la gnas pas ni sgrib pa dag las sems yongs su sbyangs pa ste /
translated: By the second, he purifies his mind from obscurations, since he is established in the second stage.

original: gnas pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dag pa'o //
translated: This is his purity of station.

original: gsum pas ni yongs su dag pa'i spyod pa la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin la brten nas bag chags spangs pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pas so //
analyzed: gsum pas ni yongs su dag pa'i spyod pa la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin la brten nas bag chags spangs pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pas so //
translated: By the third, he is established in the pure conduct, and he cultivates the applications of mindfulness as the counteragents to that, since he abandons the latent tendencies in dependence on meditative concentration.

original: 'di yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na yang dag par sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na yang dag par sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This is also his right application in the two modes, when he is not in meditative concentration.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnam pa gcig tu bstan to //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnam pa gcig tu bstan to //
translated: But when he is in meditative concentration, it is taught as a single mode.

original: gang yang dag par sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa rnams la so sor ma chags pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: gang yang dag par sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa rnams la so sor ma chags pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The result of correct application is shown by the phrase “he is not attached to any desires.”

original: 'bras bu de'i phan yon ni gang du 'pho ba ste 'di dag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu de'i phan yon ni gang du 'pho ba ste 'di dag go //
translated: The benefits of that result are the “transferences” that follow.

original: tshig re re'i dbye ba yang 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni gang la 'dun pa 'di skyes pa yod pa de ni 'dun pa skyes pa ste /
analyzed: tshig re re'i dbye ba yang 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni gang la 'dun pa 'di skyes pa yod pa de ni 'dun pa skyes pa ste /
translated: The analysis of each term: “arisen aspiration” means that aspiration has arisen for him.

original: 'dod pa skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that desire has arisen.

original: gang la 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis chos ni 'dun pa skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis chos ni 'dun pa skyes pa yin te /
translated: The Dharma for which aspiration has arisen in this way🔽is that for which he thinks, “When will I be able to complete the bases and abide in them?”

original: nam zhig na de'i tshe skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / gang 'phags pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa skyes pa'i sgra'i don to //
analyzed: nam zhig na de'i tshe skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / gang 'phags pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa skyes pa'i sgra'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “arisen aspiration” is that he thinks, “When will I be able to complete the bases of the noble ones and abide in them?”

original: 'dis ni dang po'i sbyor bas gong du 'pho ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dang po'i sbyor bas gong du 'pho ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the transference that is due to the initial application.

original: zag par mi byed dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i yul la 'jug pa ni zag pa'o //
analyzed: zag par mi byed dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i yul la 'jug pa ni zag pa'o //
translated: “He does not allow the defilements to flow out” means that the objects of the defilements are flowing out.

original: rgyun du zag cing 'byung ba'i phyir rnag 'dzag pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zag cing 'byung ba'i phyir rnag 'dzag pa lta bu ste /
translated: Because they flow out and arise continuously, they are like pus flowing out.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni zag pa ste /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni zag pa ste /
translated: That which has them is defiled.

original: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa'o //
translated: It is the unguarded sense-gate.

original: de'i phyir mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said in the sutra:

original: ji ltar yang dge slong dag rab tu zag par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dge slong dag rab tu zag par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: “O monks, how does one allow the defilements to flow out?

original: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams par gnas pa'o zhes pas so //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams par gnas pa'o zhes pas so //
translated: It is by not guarding the sense-gates.”

original: ci'i phyir de la zag pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la zag pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called defilement?

original: smras pa / de la skye mched drug dag las yul rnams su zag par byed pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de la skye mched drug dag las yul rnams su zag par byed pa ste /
translated: It is said: “In the six sense-spheres, the defilements flow out to the objects.

original: rkyal pa'i bug pa dag las chu 'dzag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rkyal pa'i bug pa dag las chu 'dzag pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like water flowing out from the holes in a dam.”

original: zag par mi byed pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zag par mi byed pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: “He does not allow the defilements to flow out” should be understood as the opposite of that.

original: sems la skyon med ces bya ba ni yid la skyon dang rnyog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sems la skyon med ces bya ba ni yid la skyon dang rnyog pa med pa ste /
translated: “His mind is faultless” means that his mind is without fault or turbidity.

original: rnyog pa'i kun du rtog pas kun du mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa'i kun du rtog pas kun du mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is not conceptualized by the conceptualization of turbidity.

original: rnyog pa'i kun du rtog pa de yang 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i kun du rtog pa zhes grags pa ste /
analyzed: rnyog pa'i kun du rtog pa de yang 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i kun du rtog pa zhes grags pa ste /
translated: Moreover, that defiled conception is known as the conception of desire, malice, and violence.🔽Because he is without the fault of the conception of desire, malice, and violence,

original: nges par mi 'byung ba dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i kun du rtog pa @97b dag gi skyon med par gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges par mi 'byung ba dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i kun du rtog pa @97b dag gi skyon med par gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: and because he is without the fault of the conception of non-liberation, malice, and violence.

original: de ltar na mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is as stated in the sutra.

original: ji ltar skyon med par kun du rtog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar skyon med par kun du rtog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does he become without fault in conception?

original: nges par 'byung ba dang / gnod sems med pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i kun du rtog par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang / gnod sems med pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i kun du rtog par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: He does not conceive of liberation, malice, and violence.

original: de ltar rim pa 'dis snod du gyur pa dang / rnal 'byor can bden pa rtog par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba rtsom 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis snod du gyur pa dang / rnal 'byor can bden pa rtog par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba rtsom 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, by this process, he becomes one who is a fit vessel and one who is endowed with yoga, and he begins the practice of the desire to realize the truth.

original: dang por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i bsgom pa 'di nyid la brtson par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dang por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i bsgom pa 'di nyid la brtson par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he first strives in the cultivation of the four foundations of mindfulness, it is said:

original: dran pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dran pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Mindfulness is mentioned.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la gnas pa yin te /
translated: He is one who is established in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: de ltar na mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is as stated in the sutra.

original: yang dge slong ji ltar dran par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang dge slong ji ltar dran par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, how does a bhikṣu become mindful?

original: 'di la nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: 'di la nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Here, he dwells observing the internal body as a body.

original: rgya cher chos la'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgya cher chos la'o zhes pa'o //
translated: And so on, extensively, in regard to phenomena.

original: ji 'di tsam nyid la gong du 'pho ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ji 'di tsam nyid la gong du 'pho ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this the one who is a once-returner?🔽No, it is not.

original: de ni ma yin te smras pa /🔽'on kyang 'dod pa rnams la so sor ma chags pa gang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te smras pa / 'on kyang 'dod pa rnams la so sor ma chags pa gang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But it is said:🔽He is one who is not individually attached to the sense objects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dag la chags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dag la chags pa med pa ste /
translated: He is one who is not attached to objects such as form.

original: gang gi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal zag pa med pa'i lam gyis rab tu spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de ni gong du 'pho ba yin zhes gsungs zhes bya ba la /🔽gong ni shas cher steng du'o //
analyzed: gang gi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal zag pa med pa'i lam gyis rab tu spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de ni gong du 'pho ba yin zhes gsungs zhes bya ba la / gong ni shas cher steng du'o //
translated: The meaning is that he is one who has completely abandoned the latent dispositions of attachment to the sense objects through the uncontaminated path.🔽He is the one who is a once-returner.🔽The higher is the upper direction.

original: 'pho ba ni 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'pho ba ni 'gro ba ste /
translated: To go there is to go to the higher.

original: gang gi skye ba rang gi gnas dang 'og tu ma yin pa gang du skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi skye ba rang gi gnas dang 'og tu ma yin pa gang du skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Where is it produced? In the place where one is born, not in a lower place.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa bzhi ma gtogs pa de ltar de nyid smos pa ni nyams pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa bzhi ma gtogs pa de ltar de nyid smos pa ni nyams pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Except for the four types of nonreturners, the rest are mentioned because they are in the state of regression.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo thams cad dang so so'i skye bo ma yin pa dag ni nyams pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo thams cad dang so so'i skye bo ma yin pa dag ni nyams pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, all ordinary beings who experience the desire realm and those who are not ordinary beings are in the state of regression.

original: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba thams cad la yang gang 'gros gzhan pas khyad par ma thob pa de ni nges par gang du 'gro bar 'gyur de la lam gyi tshogs 'dun pa skyes pa la sogs pa dang dran pas ni lam bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba thams cad la yang gang 'gros gzhan pas khyad par ma thob pa de ni nges par gang du 'gro bar 'gyur de la lam gyi tshogs 'dun pa skyes pa la sogs pa dang dran pas ni lam bstan to //
translated: This is for all nonreturners who have not attained distinction by another course. That is, they definitely go to the place where they will be reborn. The path is taught by the path of preparation, such as the generation of aspiration, and by mindfulness.

original: lhag mas ni phan yon dang bcas pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: lhag mas ni phan yon dang bcas pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu yongs su bstan to //
translated: The remaining verses teach the result of the path together with its benefits.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhi dang bcas pa'i bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i thabs 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / phan yon dang bcas pa 'dir bstan to zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhi dang bcas pa'i bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i thabs 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / phan yon dang bcas pa 'dir bstan to zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that this teaches the means of purifying the three trainings together with their bases, together with their results and their benefits.

original: de la 'dun pa skyes pa zhes bya bas ni bzhi'o //🔽zag par mi byed ces bya bas ni lhag pa'i tshul @98a * //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa skyes pa zhes bya bas ni bzhi'o // zag par mi byed ces bya bas ni lhag pa'i tshul @98a * //
translated: Among them, the four beginning with “arousing aspiration”

original: khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i thabs so //
translated: are the means of purifying the training in superior morality.

original: sems la skyon med ces bya bas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: sems la skyon med ces bya bas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i thabs te /
translated: “A mind free from faults” is the means of purifying the training in superior mind,

original: 'dir ting nge 'dzin la ro myang ba med pas skyon med pa'i sems su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ting nge 'dzin la ro myang ba med pas skyon med pa'i sems su rig par bya'o //
translated: because here it should be understood that the mind is free from faults due to the absence of relishing in meditative concentration.

original: dran pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: dran pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i thabs so //
translated: “Mindfulness” is the means of purifying the training in superior wisdom.

original: 'og ma dag gis ni phan yon dang bcas pa dang de'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: 'og ma dag gis ni phan yon dang bcas pa dang de'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The remaining verses teach the benefits and their results.

original: de la 'di ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'phags pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir dang / de las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis mi slob pa'i lam mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de la 'di ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'phags pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir dang / de las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis mi slob pa'i lam mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to cause the āryas who are not free from attachment to transcend the desire realm and in order to cause those who are free from attachment to manifest the path of no-more-learning.

original: ci dge ba'i 'dun pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'thob pa dang / skyon thams cad spang ba cig car du'am /
analyzed: ci dge ba'i 'dun pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'thob pa dang / skyon thams cad spang ba cig car du'am /
translated: Do the qualities of obtaining the will to virtue and so on and the abandonment of all faults occur simultaneously or do both occur gradually?

original: 'on te gnyi ga rim gyis 'gyur zhes bya ba la de nyid nges par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga rim gyis 'gyur zhes bya ba la de nyid nges par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that they are definitely sequential, he says:

original: mgar ba yis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mgar ba yis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The blacksmith, etc.

original: dge slong zhig du ma'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa nye bar bstan pa thos te /
analyzed: dge slong zhig du ma'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa nye bar bstan pa thos te /
translated: A monk heard the teaching on the afflictions through many doors.

original: bdag gis nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba ni ji ltar nus te /
analyzed: bdag gis nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba ni ji ltar nus te /
translated: “How can I abandon the afflictions?”

original: 'di dag ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir cig car spang bar sus kyang mi nus so zhes rnam par rtog cing yid mi bde ba chen po skyes par gyur pa las ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das de gdul ba'i phyir grong khyer du rgyu zhing gshegs pa las dngul
analyzed: 'di dag ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir cig car spang bar sus kyang mi nus so zhes rnam par rtog cing yid mi bde ba chen po skyes par gyur pa las ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das de gdul ba'i phyir grong khyer du rgyu zhing gshegs pa las dngul
translated: Since these are infinite, no one can eliminate them all at once. He thought in this way and great mental dissatisfaction arose. Then, in order to tame him, the Blessed One entered the city while walking for alms.

original: mgar dngul la rim gyis dri ma sel bar byed pa dag gzegs pa dang / yang dge slong de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mgar dngul la rim gyis dri ma sel bar byed pa dag gzegs pa dang / yang dge slong de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He saw a silversmith gradually removing the impurities from silver with a blowtorch, and said to the monk:

original: dge slong mgar ba 'dis rim gyis dngul gyi dri ma mtha' dag sel bar byed pa ltos shig /
analyzed: dge slong mgar ba 'dis rim gyis dngul gyi dri ma mtha' dag sel bar byed pa ltos shig /
translated: Look, monk, this silversmith gradually removes all the impurities from silver.

original: btsun pa de de bzhin no zhes gsol to //
analyzed: btsun pa de de bzhin no zhes gsol to //
translated: Venerable One, it is so.

original: de bzhin du dge slong khyod kyis cung zad tsam gyis sems kyi dri ma bstsal bar byas na ring po mi thogs par dri ma med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong khyod kyis cung zad tsam gyis sems kyi dri ma bstsal bar byas na ring po mi thogs par dri ma med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, monk, if you remove the impurities of the mind little by little, you will soon become stainless. Having taught like this, he spoke this verse:

original: gang gi tshe dang gang gis dang / ji ltar yang nyon mongs pa spang bar nus pa de dang mthun pa dang / dpe de 'dir bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dang gang gis dang / ji ltar yang nyon mongs pa spang bar nus pa de dang mthun pa dang / dpe de 'dir bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning in brief is this: when, by whom, and how one is able to abandon the afflictions, that is the example, and it is taught here.

original: de la rim pa bzhin zhes bya bas ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'i dus bstan to //
analyzed: de la rim pa bzhin zhes bya bas ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'i dus bstan to //
translated: Therein, “in due order” teaches the time, “when.”

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni blo gros dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni blo gros dang ldan pas so //
translated: “By whom” is by one who is intelligent.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “How” is taught by

original: skad cig skad cig cung zad @98b tsam ;🔽/ zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: skad cig skad cig cung zad @98b tsam ; / zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: “moment by moment, a little bit.”

original: mgar ba dang dngul gyis ni dpe bstan to //
analyzed: mgar ba dang dngul gyis ni dpe bstan to //
translated: The smith and the silver teach the example.

original: rim pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: rim pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: “In due order” is the perfection of aspiration,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: by the order of the perfection of the accumulations of moral discipline, learning, and so on, by relying on a spiritual friend.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshogs med par ni yon tan 'thob pa med de /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshogs med par ni yon tan 'thob pa med de /
translated: Without the accumulation that is concordant with that, there is no attainment of good qualities.

original: ji skad gsungs pa de la re zhig dge slong dag dge slong la gus pa med par gnas pa ni ma bsngags te /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa de la re zhig dge slong dag dge slong la gus pa med par gnas pa ni ma bsngags te /
translated: As for what was said, monks, it is not praiseworthy for monks to live without respect for one another.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag la ji srid yang dag par kun du spyod pas chos yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / rgya cher rnam par rol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas med de /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag la ji srid yang dag par kun du spyod pas chos yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / rgya cher rnam par rol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas med de /
translated: It is not possible that those who live together in the same religious community will complete the teachings by living together, or complete the aggregate of knowledge and insight by living together.

original: de bas na rim pa bzhin du bslab na rab tu shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rim pa bzhin du bslab na rab tu shes pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, if one trains in stages, one will understand well.

original: tshul khrims dang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽blo gros dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang blo gang la yod pa de ni blo gros dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // blo gros dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang blo gang la yod pa de ni blo gros dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One will have morality and realization, and so on.🔽Having intelligence means having wisdom and understanding.

original: blo dang ldan zhing thabs shes pa bzhin bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo dang ldan zhing thabs shes pa bzhin bya ba'i don to //
translated: One who has intelligence and knows the means should act in this way.

original: cung zad cung zad ces bya ba ni nyung du nyung du ste dri ma zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: cung zad cung zad ces bya ba ni nyung du nyung du ste dri ma zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term a little means a small amount, and this is connected with the term impurity.

original: skad cig skad cig tsam zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang ste /
analyzed: skad cig skad cig tsam zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang ste /
translated: The term moment by moment means again and again,

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and this is equivalent to the term constantly.

original: de lta na 'di ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'di ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is this like?

original: 'dir dpe smras pa /🔽mgar ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir dpe smras pa / mgar ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here is an example.🔽A silversmith is one who works with silver,

original: lcags dang gser dang dngul la sogs pa thams cad byed pa dag la mgar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lcags dang gser dang dngul la sogs pa thams cad byed pa dag la mgar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and the term silversmith is used for those who work with iron, gold, silver, and so on.

original: 'dir ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis dngul mgar la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis dngul mgar la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Here, however, the term silversmith is used in the sense of a person who works with silver, as is appropriate to the context.

original: dngul bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dngul lta bu ste /
analyzed: dngul bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dngul lta bu ste /
translated: The term like silver means like the nature of silver.

original: de'i phyir des bsregs pa dang brdungs pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis dngul gyi dri ma nag po sel ba de bzhin du blo gros dang ldan pas rang gi dri ma bsal bar bya zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir des bsregs pa dang brdungs pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis dngul gyi dri ma nag po sel ba de bzhin du blo gros dang ldan pas rang gi dri ma bsal bar bya zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, just as a silversmith removes the black impurities from silver by means of the methods of burning, cutting, and so on, in the same way, the wise person should remove his own impurities.

original: zag pa med par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / zad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa med par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / zad par bya ba'o //
translated: to be purified, to be abandoned, and to be exhausted.

original: dri ma ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags la lus 'di'i dri ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dri ma ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags la lus 'di'i dri ma zhes brjod do //
translated: The defilement is the instinct of passion, etc. It is called the defilement of this body.

original: rang gi zhes bya ba la rkyen gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'dir ni rang gi sems kyi don la blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis bdag tu dgongs so //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba la rkyen gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'dir ni rang gi sems kyi don la blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis bdag tu dgongs so //
translated: In this context, the wise consider the meaning of one's own mind to be the self, because it is the condition of all things.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa yin na yang de'i dri ma ni nyon mongs pa nyid do //🔽de la 'di ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa myur du zag pa zad par 'dod pa rnams rgyud yongs su ma smin pa de dag ma thob pas yongs su @99a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa yin na yang de'i dri ma ni nyon mongs pa nyid do // de la 'di ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa myur du zag pa zad par 'dod pa rnams rgyud yongs su ma smin pa de dag ma thob pas yongs su @99a * //
translated: Although all things are selfless, the defilement is the passion itself.

original: skyo ba la de mi skyo bar bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: skyo ba la de mi skyo bar bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: For those who are diligent and wish to quickly exhaust the contaminants, this is taught in order to prevent their discouragement, since they have not attained the full maturation of their mind-streams.🔽It is said:

original: ji srid dri ma spangs pa de tsam du phan yon du 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ji srid dri ma spangs pa de tsam du phan yon du 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: As long as there is the abandonment of defilement, there is the arising of benefit.

original: lham mkhan gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lham mkhan gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The shoemaker, etc.

original: grong gi tsher ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa 'di'i tshig bla dags yin te /
analyzed: grong gi tsher ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa 'di'i tshig bla dags yin te /
translated: The thorns of the village are a term for the sense objects.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong dag 'dod pa ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong dag 'dod pa ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba yin te /
translated: Because the sense objects are a great suffering for the monks.

original: ji srid 'di yongs su spangs pa de srid na yid bde ba 'thob par 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: ji srid 'di yongs su spangs pa de srid na yid bde ba 'thob par 'gyur zhes so //
translated: As long as they are not abandoned, they do not obtain happiness.

original: de'i tshe yul ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi lham mkhan dang ha cang mi ring ba zhig na rgyal po'i shing rta'i bzo byed de de dang nye bar 'tsham pa'i ko ba dag yongs su sbyor bar byed pa las rgya cher de nyid kyi
analyzed: de'i tshe yul ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi lham mkhan dang ha cang mi ring ba zhig na rgyal po'i shing rta'i bzo byed de de dang nye bar 'tsham pa'i ko ba dag yongs su sbyor bar byed pa las rgya cher de nyid kyi
translated: At that time, not far from the king of Koshala Prasenajit’s shoemaker, there was a chariot maker. He was preparing leather suitable for that purpose.

original: dpe'i dbang du byas nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: dpe'i dbang du byas nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught by the Blessed One as an example.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni sdug bsngal ba yin pa'i phyir de yongs su spangs na ni bde ba 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni sdug bsngal ba yin pa'i phyir de yongs su spangs na ni bde ba 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning is: “Because the sense objects are suffering, if they are abandoned, happiness is obtained.”

original: lham mkhan zhes bya ba ni gang lham mkhan byed cing lham gyi bzo la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lham mkhan zhes bya ba ni gang lham mkhan byed cing lham gyi bzo la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term “shoemaker” means one who makes shoes and is skilled in the craft of shoemaking.

original: ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe nye bar 'jal ba ston to //
analyzed: ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe nye bar 'jal ba ston to //
translated: The term “likewise” indicates a comparison.

original: ko ba dag ces bya ba ni ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ko ba dag ces bya ba ni ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “hides” refers to those of cows, buffaloes, etc.

original: yongs su sbyangs nas zhes bya ba la sbyangs pa ni bcad pa ste mtshon gyis bskyed cing sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs nas zhes bya ba la sbyangs pa ni bcad pa ste mtshon gyis bskyed cing sbyangs pa'o //
translated: “Having processed” means having cut up, having produced, and having processed with a knife.

original: yongs su zhes bya ba ni thams cad nas te /
analyzed: yongs su zhes bya ba ni thams cad nas te /
translated: The term “completely” means entirely.

original: kun nas sbyangs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun nas sbyangs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term “having processed” means having processed completely.

original: ci zhig yongs su sbyangs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig yongs su sbyangs pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is processed?

original: smras pa / lham zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / lham zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The term “shoes” is stated.

original: shing rta'i 'khor lo la bcing ba ste ko ba gang gis shing rta'i 'khor lo bcing zhing nye bar spel ba de ni lham zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: shing rta'i 'khor lo la bcing ba ste ko ba gang gis shing rta'i 'khor lo bcing zhing nye bar spel ba de ni lham zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: The term “shoes” is a term that refers to the hides that are used to bind and fasten the wheels of a chariot.

original: n'a ha ban da na zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: n'a ha ban da na zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the term “shoes” is taught by the verbal root “nāha-bandhana.”

original: yang na lham mkhan ni ko lpags mkhan te /
analyzed: yang na lham mkhan ni ko lpags mkhan te /
translated: Or else, the cobbler is the one who works with leather.

original: 'dis rkang pa la nye bar 'gebs pa yin pas lham ste /
analyzed: 'dis rkang pa la nye bar 'gebs pa yin pas lham ste /
translated: The shoe is that which covers the foot.

original: rkang pa skyob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rkang pa skyob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it protects the foot.

original: gang dang gang spangs pa zhes bya ba dang ko ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang spangs pa zhes bya ba dang ko ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “having abandoned” is to be connected with “the shoe” and “the leather.”

original: de ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the way it is explained.

original: ji ltar lham mkhan gyis lham de'i mtha' 'di la yang gang dgos pa yongs su sbyangs nas gang dang gang mi dgos pa'i ko ba dag ni yongs su dor bar byas pas de dang des mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar lham mkhan gyis lham de'i mtha' 'di la yang gang dgos pa yongs su sbyangs nas gang dang gang mi dgos pa'i ko ba dag ni yongs su dor bar byas pas de dang des mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub par byed do //
translated: Just as the cobbler, having finished the shoe, having discarded the leather that is not needed for the shoe, accomplishes the desired purpose with that which is needed,

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa spong bar byed pas kyang gang dang gang cung zad skyes pa'i rnam pa spang bar byas pa de dang des ni bde ba dang @99b ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa spong bar byed pas kyang gang dang gang cung zad skyes pa'i rnam pa spang bar byas pa de dang des ni bde ba dang @99b ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: in the same way, the one who abandons desire, having abandoned the aspect of whatever arises, becomes endowed with pleasure through that very thing.

original: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he becomes the cause of pleasure.

original: de yongs su spang bas ni de'i gzhis sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang nges par 'byung ba'i bde ba 'byung ba'i phyir bde ba dang ldan pa yin pas rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yongs su spang bas ni de'i gzhis sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang nges par 'byung ba'i bde ba 'byung ba'i phyir bde ba dang ldan pa yin pas rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since suffering does not arise due to the basis of that, and since the happiness of definite emergence arises, he is endowed with happiness.

original: 'di ltar bde ba ni nad sel ba'i sman bsten pa bde ba yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba ni nad sel ba'i sman bsten pa bde ba yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin no //
translated: Thus, happiness is the result of the cause, just as it is said that the use of medicine to cure an illness is happiness.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Desire is also twofold:

original: dngos po dang nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po dang nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: the nature of things and the nature of the afflictions.

original: de la dngos po 'dod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnam pa lnga dang / khyim rnams yongs su gzung ba pha dang ma dang bu smad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po 'dod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnam pa lnga dang / khyim rnams yongs su gzung ba pha dang ma dang bu smad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The desire for things is the five sense objects such as form, and the desire for a home, parents, children, and so on.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams kyi ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti'o ;
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams kyi ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti'o ;
translated: For those who have gone forth, it is the desire for gain and honor.

original: / nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid ni 'dod pa de yang dngos po de dag nyid la 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid ni 'dod pa de yang dngos po de dag nyid la 'dod pa ste /
translated: The nature of the afflictions is the desire for those things,

original: gang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: gang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: which is the longing of desire realm beings.

original: de gnyi ga'i sbyor ba 'di dag gi rnam pa yongs su spangs pa de ni bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i sbyor ba 'di dag gi rnam pa yongs su spangs pa de ni bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of both of these kinds of practice is happiness.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: yongs su bzung ba spang byas na //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba spang byas na //
translated: When you give up what is to be abandoned,

original: gnod pa de dag mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: gnod pa de dag mi 'byung ste //
translated: those harms do not occur.

original: de bzhin sems kyi dri ma dag / spang byas gnod pa de mi 'byung //
analyzed: de bzhin sems kyi dri ma dag / spang byas gnod pa de mi 'byung //
translated: In the same way, when you give up the mental defilements, those harms do not occur.

original: zhes so // de la 'di ni 'dod pa la mngon par dga' ba rnams 'dod pa spangs pa la gzud pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes so // de la 'di ni 'dod pa la mngon par dga' ba rnams 'dod pa spangs pa la gzud pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to introduce those who delight in desire to the abandonment of desire.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni cung zad tsam spangs pa las bde ba cung zad tsam nyid yin la mtha' dag spangs na ni bde ba phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni cung zad tsam spangs pa las bde ba cung zad tsam nyid yin la mtha' dag spangs na ni bde ba phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Desire is a slight happiness that comes from slight abandonment, but when all is abandoned, there is perfect happiness.

original: gal te bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:🔽If you think that what is called “happiness” is a slight happiness that comes from slight abandonment, then you should know that what is called “suffering” is a slight suffering that comes from slight non-abandonment.

original: bram ze zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song ste /
analyzed: bram ze zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song ste /
translated: A certain brahmin went before the Blessed One and said:

original: gsol pa / kye goo ta ma ci zhig spangs na bde ba thams cad thob par 'gyur zhes pa dang / de'i dbang du mdzad de tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: gsol pa / kye goo ta ma ci zhig spangs na bde ba thams cad thob par 'gyur zhes pa dang / de'i dbang du mdzad de tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: He asked, “O Gautama, what is it that, when abandoned, leads to the attainment of all happiness?”🔽The following verse was uttered with reference to that question.

original: 'dod pa thams cad spangs pa phan yon dang bcas pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad spangs pa phan yon dang bcas pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The summary of the meaning of this chapter is as follows: the abandonment of all desires is taught along with its benefits.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba ma lus pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba ma lus pa gzung ngo //
translated: “All” refers to the inclusion of all mundane and supramundane happiness.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste'o //
translated: “If” means “when.”

original: bde ba ni 'dod pa rjes su myong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni 'dod pa rjes su myong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Happiness” refers to the experience of desire and so on.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brel ba dang mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brel ba dang mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Desire” refers to the connection with and the desire for that.

original: 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni dngos po'i 'dod chags dang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni dngos po'i 'dod chags dang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: “All desires” refers to the attachment to things and the attachment to afflictions.

original: yongs su spong zhes bya ba ni rab tu dor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su spong zhes bya ba ni rab tu dor ba'o //
translated: “Abandon” means to completely let go.

original: 'dod pa gang dang gang spangs pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa gang dang gang spangs pa //
translated: “Whatever desires are abandoned”

original: zhes bya ba @100a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba @100a * //
translated: is stated.

original: ni bde ba'i 'du shes kyi 'dod pa rnams phyogs gcig ma spangs na ni zang zing med pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ni bde ba'i 'du shes kyi 'dod pa rnams phyogs gcig ma spangs na ni zang zing med pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not abandon the desire for the pleasure of the perception of pleasure, one will not attain the perfection of the pleasure of the absence of passion.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Therefore, the Lord has said:

original: gal te bde ba yongs su rdzogs 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te bde ba yongs su rdzogs 'dod na //
translated: If you desire the perfection of pleasure,

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su spang bar bya ;🔽/ zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su spang bar bya ; / zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: you should abandon all desires.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of the abandonment of all desires.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i ngang tshul gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i ngang tshul gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: The one who has the nature of giving up all desires is the one who has abandoned all desires.🔽How does one give up all desires?

original: ji ltar yang 'dod pa thams cad yongs su spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'dod pa thams cad yongs su spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: smras pa / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i ris gnyis spong bas so //
analyzed: smras pa / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i ris gnyis spong bas so //
translated: By abandoning the two classes of afflictions that occur in the desire realm through the two paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni gtan du'o //
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni gtan du'o //
translated: Supreme means permanent.

original: yang na zag pa med pa'i lam gyis spangs pas bde ba khyad par can du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yang na zag pa med pa'i lam gyis spangs pas bde ba khyad par can du gyur pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is a special bliss due to the abandonment by the uncontaminated path.

original: khyad par du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “special” is “distinguished.”

original: bde ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba rjes su myong ba dang / bde ba la gnas pa dang thob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba rjes su myong ba dang / bde ba la gnas pa dang thob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “attains bliss” is that he experiences bliss, abides in bliss, and attains bliss.

original: ji ltar de yongs su spangs pas mchog tu bde ba thob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de yongs su spangs pas mchog tu bde ba thob pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he attain supreme bliss by completely abandoning that?

original: gang gi phyir de ni phyir mi 'ong bar gyur nas 'dod pa'i khams su yang mi 'ong ba dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'gro ba yin te ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni phyir mi 'ong bar gyur nas 'dod pa'i khams su yang mi 'ong ba dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'gro ba yin te ;
translated: Because, having become a non-returner, he does not come back to the desire realm, and he goes to the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: des na gnod pa dang bcas pa'i khams las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i bde ba 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gnod pa dang bcas pa'i khams las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i bde ba 'thob pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because he has completely transcended the realm with injury, he attains the bliss that is truly desired.

original: 'dod phyogs gcig spangs pas chog par 'dzin pa dag 'dod pa thams cad spangs pa la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod phyogs gcig spangs pas chog par 'dzin pa dag 'dod pa thams cad spangs pa la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to lead those who are content with abandoning just one part of the desire realm to abandon all of the desire realm.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa spangs pas mchog tu bde ba thob par brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa spangs pas mchog tu bde ba thob par brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said that one obtains supreme happiness by abandoning desire?

original: gang gi phyir ngoms mi shes pa'i phyir 'dod pa ni sdug bsngal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngoms mi shes pa'i phyir 'dod pa ni sdug bsngal ba yin te /
translated: Desire is suffering because it is insatiable.

original: des na 'dod pa de dag spangs pa 'di ni bde ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: des na 'dod pa de dag spangs pa 'di ni bde ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to show that the abandonment of those desires is happiness, it is said:

original: ji srid 'dod pa'i rjes 'brang ba //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji srid 'dod pa'i rjes 'brang ba // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: As long as one follows after desire,🔽one is not satisfied with the pleasures of desire.

original: bde ba 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i gcer bu pa de ni 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smras te /
analyzed: bde ba 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i gcer bu pa de ni 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smras te /
translated: The Nirgrantha who is called “Desire for Happiness” has this view and speaks in this way:

original: 'di lta ste dka' thub drag pos thar pa thob pa de nyid ngoms pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dka' thub drag pos thar pa thob pa de nyid ngoms pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Liberation is obtained through severe austerities.

original: mchod sbyin gyi bdag po zhes bya ba'i bram ze de yang 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smras te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi bdag po zhes bya ba'i bram ze de yang 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smras te /
translated: The Brahmin who is called “Master of Sacrifice” has this view and speaks in this way:

original: 'di lta ste /
