analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'dod pa las longs spyod pa nyid kyis ngoms pa yin @100b gyi ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'dod pa las longs spyod pa nyid kyis ngoms pa yin @100b gyi ;
translated: One is satisfied by enjoying the pleasures of desire as one wishes,

original: thabs gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thabs gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: but not by any other means.

original: dper na chu nye bar longs spyod pas skom pa dang bral ba ni de'i dngos po nyid kyis thar pa'o //
analyzed: dper na chu nye bar longs spyod pas skom pa dang bral ba ni de'i dngos po nyid kyis thar pa'o //
translated: For example, the quenching of thirst by the enjoyment of water is liberation by its very nature.

original: de bas na de gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, these two verses are stated with reference to those two.

original: de la re zhig dang po'i bshad pa smras pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po'i bshad pa smras pa /
translated: Here, first of all, the explanation of the first verse is stated:

original: ji srid ces bya ba ni dus ji srid kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid ces bya ba ni dus ji srid kyi bar du'o //
translated: For as long as means for as much time as.

original: 'dod pa'i rjes 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs sdug pa la sogs pa yul gyi rjes su 'brang zhing rab tu ston pa dang spyod pa'o //🔽de srid bar du ngoms mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rjes 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs sdug pa la sogs pa yul gyi rjes su 'brang zhing rab tu ston pa dang spyod pa'o // de srid bar du ngoms mi 'gyur //
translated: Following after desire means following after, demonstrating, and engaging in attractive forms, etc., objects.

original: zhes bya ba ni dus de srid kyi bar du sred pa dang bral ba'i mtha' gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dus de srid kyi bar du sred pa dang bral ba'i mtha' gnyis so //
translated: One is not satisfied for that long means that for that long, one is not satisfied with the two extremes of freedom from craving.

original: yang thabs gang gis ngoms pa rnyed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang thabs gang gis ngoms pa rnyed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, by what means does one attain satisfaction?

original: smras pa / de las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / de las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: from that.

original: 'dod pa dag las so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las so //
translated: From desire.

original: ldog byed ces bya ba ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ldog byed ces bya ba ni spangs pa'o //
translated: One turns away means one abandons.

original: de'i phyir ji srid ji srid du 'dod pa spong bar gyur pa de dang de srid du don gnyer ba dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid ji srid du 'dod pa spong bar gyur pa de dang de srid du don gnyer ba dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, as long as one abandons desire, one is free from craving.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gcig tu spang bya spang bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu spang bya spang bya ste /
translated: “The object to be abandoned is to be abandoned;

original: yang dag spyan na 'dzeg par 'gyur //🔽rang gi lus la 'dod pa yi //
analyzed: yang dag spyan na 'dzeg par 'gyur // rang gi lus la 'dod pa yi //
translated: one climbs the ladder of right view.🔽It is not right to make

original: skas ni bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: skas ni bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: one’s own body a ladder for desire.”

original: zhes so // lus dang sems kyi skyo bar yang dag par bstan pas ting nge 'dzin 'thob par 'dis ston pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // lus dang sems kyi skyo bar yang dag par bstan pas ting nge 'dzin 'thob par 'dis ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that one attains concentration by teaching the weariness of body and mind.

original: gang gi phyir sred pa bsal ba'i thabs ni dben pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sred pa bsal ba'i thabs ni dben pa'o //
translated: Since the means of removing craving is solitude,

original: ci zhig byas nas nyon mongs pa dang 'dod pa rtsa ba nas 'byin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas nyon mongs pa dang 'dod pa rtsa ba nas 'byin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what is done to uproot the afflictions and desires?

original: smras pa / shes rab kyis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / shes rab kyis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: “By wisdom.”

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa yin te /
translated: By uncontaminated knowledge, desire is fully known as it is.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa las /
translated: As it is said:🔽“The wise one, having seen with wisdom🔽the truth of cessation,

original: gcig kyang mngon par mi shes shing yongs su mi shes pas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes nga mi smra'o zhes so //
analyzed: gcig kyang mngon par mi shes shing yongs su mi shes pas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes nga mi smra'o zhes so //
translated: I do not say that they will make an end of suffering without knowing and fully understanding even one thing.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni gang la ste sngar bstan pa'i rim pas dmigs te /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni gang la ste sngar bstan pa'i rim pas dmigs te /
translated: “Those who” refers to those who, in the sequence taught above, have taken up the practice.

original: rgyal rigs dang bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs la ltos pa med de /
analyzed: rgyal rigs dang bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs la ltos pa med de /
translated: They are not concerned with the caste of a kṣatriya, brahmin, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rus dang rigs dang rgyud la yongs su mi gzigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rus dang rigs dang rgyud la yongs su mi gzigs te /
translated: The Tathāgata does not look at family, caste, or lineage.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las la yang dag par gzegs so //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las la yang dag par gzegs so //
translated: He looks at wholesome and unwholesome actions.

original: gang gi phyir dag pa ni shes rab la rag las pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dag pa ni shes rab la rag las pa yin gyi /
translated: Because purity depends on wisdom,

original: rigs la rag las pa ni ma yin no //🔽tshim pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rigs la rag las pa ni ma yin no // tshim pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: not on caste.🔽“Contentment” is freedom from craving.

original: don du gnyer ba spangs pa'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of striving.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i thabs rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i thabs rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: “Those” refers to those who follow the unmistaken method.

original: gang dag gi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: gang dag gi sgras bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the word “who.”

original: 'thob ces bya ba ni rnyed @101a * //
analyzed: 'thob ces bya ba ni rnyed @101a * //
translated: “Attain” means to obtain.

original: pa'o ; / gang shin tu dka' bas dka' thub la gnas pa dang 'dod pa la brten pa ni bzlog pa yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: pa'o ; / gang shin tu dka' bas dka' thub la gnas pa dang 'dod pa la brten pa ni bzlog pa yin no zhes ston te /
translated: The opposite of that is the one who is devoted to desire.

original: yun ring por yang 'dod pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring por yang 'dod pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is devoted to desire for a long time.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: 'dod pa dag la bde blag tu rjes su sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la bde blag tu rjes su sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because he is devoted to desire in an easy way.

original: de yang bdag nyid nyon mongs pa la sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang ngoms par mi byed pa dang / rab tu bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid nyon mongs pa la sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang ngoms par mi byed pa dang / rab tu bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, he is devoted to the afflictions, and he is not satisfied with that, and he does not accomplish it.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas yang dag par gzung bas ni ngoms par byed pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas yang dag par gzung bas ni ngoms par byed pa nyid du ston to //
translated: But he who is devoted to the truth is satisfied with it, because he is grasped by right view.

original: de la 'di ni 'dod pa bsten pa dang dka' thub byas pa las ni ngoms par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la 'di ni 'dod pa bsten pa dang dka' thub byas pa las ni ngoms par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Here, he is not satisfied by devotion to desire and by asceticism.

original: de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa dang thabs shes pas ni ngoms par 'gyur bas de nyid la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa dang thabs shes pas ni ngoms par 'gyur bas de nyid la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: But he is satisfied by unerring knowledge of reality and by knowledge of means. Therefore, this is taught in order to introduce him to that.

original: dus ji srid 'dod pa nye bar longs spyad pas kyang ngoms pa nyid do zhes rtog pa la smras pa /
analyzed: dus ji srid 'dod pa nye bar longs spyad pas kyang ngoms pa nyid do zhes rtog pa la smras pa /
translated: One may think, I will enjoy the objects of desire for as long as I want, and then I will be satisfied.🔽

original: 'dod pas ngoms par mi 'gyur bas //
analyzed: 'dod pas ngoms par mi 'gyur bas //
translated: One might think, I will enjoy sense objects for as long as I want, and then I will be satisfied.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To this, the verse states:🔽One is not satisfied by sense objects.

original: skyid pa zhes bya ba ni skyid par byed pa ste 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i ngoms pa bas khyad par du ngoms pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyid pa zhes bya ba ni skyid par byed pa ste 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i ngoms pa bas khyad par du ngoms pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word satisfied means to be satisfied by the enjoyment of sense objects. The meaning is that one is satisfied by something superior to that.

original: ngoms pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir sbyar te /
analyzed: ngoms pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir sbyar te /
translated: The word satisfied is to be supplied here.

original: gang zhig gis ngoms she na /
analyzed: gang zhig gis ngoms she na /
translated: By what is one satisfied?

original: smras pa / shes rab kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / shes rab kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The verse states: By wisdom.

original: gang de bzhin nyid shes pa'i rgyu des bskyed pa'i ngoms pa de'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid shes pa'i rgyu des bskyed pa'i ngoms pa de'o //
translated: That satisfaction is produced by the cause of the knowledge of thatness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa / mi 'gyur bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / mi 'gyur bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The verse states: Because of immutability.

original: 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pas su zhig gtan du ngoms par 'gyur te mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pas su zhig gtan du ngoms par 'gyur te mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: By the enjoyment of sense objects, who is permanently satisfied? No one is!

original: 'dod pa dag las ldog par 'dod pas kyang 'dod pa dag la brten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las ldog par 'dod pas kyang 'dod pa dag la brten par mi bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to turn away from sense objects should not rely on sense objects.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'dod pas ngoms par mi 'gyur bas //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / smras pa / 'dod pas ngoms par mi 'gyur bas //
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes smos te //
analyzed: zhes smos te //
translated: It is said:🔽Because one is never satisfied with desire.

original: 'di ltar nam yang 'dod pa la longs spyod pas ni chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam yang 'dod pa la longs spyod pas ni chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one is never free from attachment by enjoying desire.

original: rgas pa'i gnas skabs na yang dregs pa dang 'dod pa las ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgas pa'i gnas skabs na yang dregs pa dang 'dod pa las ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even in the state of old age, one is not free from desire and arrogance.

original: ji skad bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rga bas lus ni rgas gyur cing //
analyzed: rga bas lus ni rgas gyur cing //
translated: Even though old age has come to the body,🔽even though the head has turned white,

original: mgo ni skya bor gyur pa dang // dbang po rnams ni rnyis gyur kyang //
analyzed: mgo ni skya bor gyur pa dang // dbang po rnams ni rnyis gyur kyang //
translated: even though the faculties have decayed,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang rga mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang rga mi 'gyur //
translated: attachment and aversion do not age.

original: zhes pa'o // gang gi phyir rgas pa na 'dod pa dag la lhag par bsten du lus mtha' dag skams par gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gang gi phyir rgas pa na 'dod pa dag la lhag par bsten du lus mtha' dag skams par gyur te /
translated: Because in old age, one relies on desire even more, the whole body dries up.

original: sred pas sems la khyab par gyur kyang de la longs spyod par mi nus pa yin te /
analyzed: sred pas sems la khyab par gyur kyang de la longs spyod par mi nus pa yin te /
translated: Even though craving pervades the mind, one is unable to enjoy it.

original: des na mi bsten pa yin gyi ngoms pa ni ma @101b yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na mi bsten pa yin gyi ngoms pa ni ma @101b yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not relied upon, but not because of satisfaction.

original: shes rab kyis kyang de bzhin du ngoms par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyis kyang de bzhin du ngoms par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that wisdom is also not satisfied?

original: de ni ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: No, it is not. Why is that?

original: smras pa / shes rab kyis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / shes rab kyis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, But wisdom is not like that.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis skyes bu gang ngoms na ni srid pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis skyes bu gang ngoms na ni srid pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: If a person is satisfied with uncontaminated wisdom, he is free from existence.

original: de ni yang 'dod cing sred pa'i dbang du mi 'gro'o ;🔽/ de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de ni yang 'dod cing sred pa'i dbang du mi 'gro'o ; / de nyid smras pa /
translated: He does not go under the sway of desire and craving.

original: srid pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: srid pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The same text says, He does not come under the sway of existence.

original: dbang du mi byed pa ni bdag dang rjes su mthun pa sred pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: dbang du mi byed pa ni bdag dang rjes su mthun pa sred pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gro ba ste /
translated: He does not come under the sway of existence means that he does not go under the sway of craving, which is in accord with the self.

original: de'i bdag nyid la rag ma lus pa zhes so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la rag ma lus pa zhes so //
translated: He is not dependent on that self.

original: ngoms par 'dod pas ni ye shes nyid la goms par bya'i 'dod pa bskyed par ni mi bya'o zhes nges pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ngoms par 'dod pas ni ye shes nyid la goms par bya'i 'dod pa bskyed par ni mi bya'o zhes nges pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in order to generate certainty that one who desires satisfaction should cultivate wisdom itself and should not generate desire.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang du 'gro ba ni skyon 'di yod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang du 'gro ba ni skyon 'di yod de /
translated: The fault of going under the sway of desire is stated in the following:

original: gang du ngan par spyod pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / 'dod pas ni de bzhin nyid shes pa la bar du gcod par byed pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang du ngan par spyod pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / 'dod pas ni de bzhin nyid shes pa la bar du gcod par byed pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to prove this, he says:

original: 'dod la chags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs bcad gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dod la chags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs bcad gnyis so //
translated: Two verses on the topic of attachment to desire.

original: yul yangs pa can na khyim bdag drag shul can zhes bya ba bran pho dang bran mo dang las byed pa dag la chad pas bsdigs pa dang 'jigs pas bsdigs pa dag byas nas nyin par bud med kyi tshogs dang rol mos rtse zhing dga' bar spyod la
analyzed: yul yangs pa can na khyim bdag drag shul can zhes bya ba bran pho dang bran mo dang las byed pa dag la chad pas bsdigs pa dang 'jigs pas bsdigs pa dag byas nas nyin par bud med kyi tshogs dang rol mos rtse zhing dga' bar spyod la
translated: In Vaishali, there was a householder named Chanda who, having threatened and frightened his male and female servants and workers with punishment, played, enjoyed, and amused himself with a crowd of women during the day.

original: skyed mos tshal nas skyed mos tshal du 'gro ba de gzigs nas /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal nas skyed mos tshal du 'gro ba de gzigs nas /
translated: He went from park to park.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One saw him and said this:

original: 'dod pa la sred pa ni ngan par spyod pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / kun tu rmongs par bstan pa dang / de la chags pas bya ba ma yin pa la 'bad cing 'jug par 'gyur bas nges par mi rtag par 'gyur ba des ma mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sred pa ni ngan par spyod pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / kun tu rmongs par bstan pa dang / de la chags pas bya ba ma yin pa la 'bad cing 'jug par 'gyur bas nges par mi rtag par 'gyur ba des ma mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The craving for sense-objects is the cause of evil conduct, and is taught to be a kind of delusion. Because of attachment to that, one strives and engages in what should not be done. Therefore, it is not seen to be definitely impermanent. This is the summarized meaning.

original: 'dod la zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dod la zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i 'dod pa la'o //
translated: As for sense-objects, it refers to the craving for things.

original: mi gang yin zhes bya ba ni sems can gang dag go //
analyzed: mi gang yin zhes bya ba ni sems can gang dag go //
translated: As for what person, it refers to what sentient beings.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen pa ste /
translated: As for attachment, it means excessive clinging.

original: so so'i skye bo 'dod pa na spyod pa dag go //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'dod pa na spyod pa dag go //
translated: It refers to ordinary beings who engage in sense-objects.

original: chos min zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: chos min zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ste /
translated: As for unrighteousness, it refers to evil conduct by body, speech, and mind.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is unrighteousness?

original: 'di la gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di la gcig ste /
translated: It is this:

original: srog gcod par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: srog gcod par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: taking life, and so on. This is extensively taught in the sutras.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das mi gtsang ba'i tshogs @102a * //
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das mi gtsang ba'i tshogs @102a * //
translated: Kye ma!🔽is for those who are attached to desire.🔽

original: kyi nang na srin bu gnas pa bzhin du thugs brtse ba yin te /
analyzed: kyi nang na srin bu gnas pa bzhin du thugs brtse ba yin te /
translated: Alas! is the exclamation of the Lord's compassion for those who are attached to sensual pleasures, as if they were worms living in a heap of filth.

original: mi gang dag 'dod pa la chags pa de dang dang 'dod pa rnams kyi don phun sum tshogs pas dregs pas ngan par spyod pa byed cing dga' bar 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: mi gang dag 'dod pa la chags pa de dang dang 'dod pa rnams kyi don phun sum tshogs pas dregs pas ngan par spyod pa byed cing dga' bar 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: Those who are attached to sensual pleasures and who are intoxicated by the success of their sensual pleasures, commit evil deeds and take delight in them.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i 'dod pa la chags pa de dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i 'dod pa la chags pa de dag go //
translated: Those refers to those who are attached to sensual pleasures as previously described.

original: chos ma yin pa ngan par spyod pa rnam pa bcu po de dag la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ngan par spyod pa rnam pa bcu po de dag la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They take delight in the ten kinds of evil deeds, which are contrary to the Dharma. Delight means to be endowed with delight.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'dod pa ni gsod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gsod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Sensual pleasures are killers.

original: 'dod pa'i gzhi dang 'dod pa'i rgyus rgyal rigs dang rgyal rigs su 'thab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzhi dang 'dod pa'i rgyus rgyal rigs dang rgyal rigs su 'thab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of sensual pleasures, because of the basis of sensual pleasures, because of the cause of sensual pleasures, there is fighting among the warrior class and the warrior class.

original: de dag 'dod pa la chags pa dang chos ma yin pa la dga' ba des kyang 'dod pas blo rnam par g-yen spyo ba de dag gis 'chi ba la nye bar gnas par gyur ba dang / bar chad mthong bar ma gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'dod pa la chags pa dang chos ma yin pa la dga' ba des kyang 'dod pas blo rnam par g-yen spyo ba de dag gis 'chi ba la nye bar gnas par gyur ba dang / bar chad mthong bar ma gyur pa yin te /
translated: They are attached to desire and delight in what is contrary to Dharma. They are distracted by desire and do not see the obstacles that are near to death.

original: gags ma rtogs shing bar du gcod pa mi bzad pa ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gags ma rtogs shing bar du gcod pa mi bzad pa ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they do not understand the obstacles and do not understand the terrible obstacles.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams la gang yod na glo bur du 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bgegs yod par 'gyur zhe na /🔽smras pa / cung zad gson por 'dug pa na //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams la gang yod na glo bur du 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bgegs yod par 'gyur zhe na / smras pa / cung zad gson por 'dug pa na //
translated: What is the obstacle that exists for those who possess desire, which has the nature of sudden death?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said:🔽As long as there is a little life remaining.

original: dus shin tu thung bar gnas pa'i tshe yod par gyur pa la ste gang de ltar yun ring du 'tsho ba de yang lo brgya'o zhes lung las gsungs pas so //
analyzed: dus shin tu thung bar gnas pa'i tshe yod par gyur pa la ste gang de ltar yun ring du 'tsho ba de yang lo brgya'o zhes lung las gsungs pas so //
translated: As long as there is a very short time remaining, there is life. It is said in the scriptures that even one who lives a long time lives for a hundred years.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi 'dun pa'am cung zad gson pa'i ched du bar chad mthong bar ma gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi 'dun pa'am cung zad gson pa'i ched du bar chad mthong bar ma gyur pa yin te /
translated: They do not see the obstacles for the sake of a little life, for the sake of a little desire.

original: ji skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: lkog mar srog phyin par gyur na ni thams cad kyang gzhan gyi lag tu 'gro ba nyid de ji srid 'tsho ba de srid kyi bar du ni 'dod pa yod do //
analyzed: lkog mar srog phyin par gyur na ni thams cad kyang gzhan gyi lag tu 'gro ba nyid de ji srid 'tsho ba de srid kyi bar du ni 'dod pa yod do //
translated: When the life-force has gone to the throat, all will go into the hands of others. As long as one lives, one has desires.

original: de dang bral na ni 'dod pa dang yang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de dang bral na ni 'dod pa dang yang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: When one is separated from it, one is separated from desires.

original: de la 'di ni 'dod ba la zhen pa dag de las 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs so //🔽ji ltar yang 'dod pa la chags pa dang / chos ma yin pa la dga' bas bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga nye bar 'joms pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de la 'di ni 'dod ba la zhen pa dag de las 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs so // ji ltar yang 'dod pa la chags pa dang / chos ma yin pa la dga' bas bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga nye bar 'joms pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: This is said in order to turn away the longing of those who are attached to desires.🔽In order to demonstrate how attachment to desires and delight in what is contrary to the Dharma destroy both oneself and others, it is said:

original: blo ngan longs spyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: blo ngan longs spyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The fool is destroyed by wealth,

original: blo ngan ni byis pa ste ;
analyzed: blo ngan ni byis pa ste ;
translated: The fool is a child.

original: longs spyod kyis byas pa'i sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang sred pas byas pa'i ngan par spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: longs spyod kyis byas pa'i sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang sred pas byas pa'i ngan par spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The afflicted state of craving that is caused by enjoyment and the afflicted state of evil conduct that is caused by craving are the meanings that are included here.

original: bcom pa ni nye bar gdung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bcom pa ni nye bar gdung bar byed pa ste /
translated: The word destroyed means tormented.

original: dge ba'i chos ring du byed cing rgyud rgud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ring du byed cing rgyud rgud par byed pa'o //
translated: It is that which causes the wholesome dharmas to be distant and causes the continuum to deteriorate.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?🔽 It is said:

original: smras pa / @102b blo ngan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / @102b blo ngan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The one who has an evil mind.

original: blo ngan pa gang la yod pa de ni blo ngan te shes rab dang rtog pa ngan pa ste /
analyzed: blo ngan pa gang la yod pa de ni blo ngan te shes rab dang rtog pa ngan pa ste /
translated: The one who has an evil mind is the one who has an evil mind, i.e., one who has an evil understanding and reflection.

original: rmongs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is one who is confused.

original: de yang gang gis she na /
analyzed: de yang gang gis she na /
translated: Moreover, by what?🔽 It is said:

original: smras pa / longs spyod kyi zhes bya ba smos te /🔽'dod pas nye bar spyod pa'i phyir longs spyod de /
analyzed: smras pa / longs spyod kyi zhes bya ba smos te / 'dod pas nye bar spyod pa'i phyir longs spyod de /
translated: By enjoyment.🔽 Enjoyment is that which is enjoyed by desire.

original: 'dod pa'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yul rnams so //
translated: It is the objects of desire.

original: de dag kyang rmongs pa'i skye bo nyid bcom par 'gyur zhing ji srid skyo ba chung ba'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyang g-yen spyo bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang rmongs pa'i skye bo nyid bcom par 'gyur zhing ji srid skyo ba chung ba'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyang g-yen spyo bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and they will be despised by even the noble persons who are of little sorrow.

original: mi byed cing zhes bya ba ni nam yang pha rol tshol bar mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi byed cing zhes bya ba ni nam yang pha rol tshol bar mi byed pa yin te /
translated: “They do not seek” means that they never seek the other shore.

original: 'dod pa dag las pha rol tu nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las pha rol tu nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: They are “certain to go beyond” the desire realm.

original: de tshol ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni de ste /
analyzed: de tshol ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni de ste /
translated: They are “of the nature of seeking” that.

original: de lta bur mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba med pa ste so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba med pa ste so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are “without the seeking of nirvana” in that way. The meaning is that they are ordinary persons.

original: gzhan dag tu ni bdag nyid tshol ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni bdag nyid tshol ba zhes brjod de /
translated: In other sources, they are called “those who seek for themselves.”

original: bdag nyid la phan pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid la phan pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are wise because they seek their own benefit.

original: 'dod pas rmongs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pas rmongs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Deluded by desire” means that

original: rmongs pa'i skye bo ni nye bar gdung ba yin te nye bar chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i skye bo ni nye bar gdung ba yin te nye bar chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: deluded persons are tormented and become attached.

original: des na ngan par spyod pa bsags pas bdag dang gzhan la nye bar gnod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: des na ngan par spyod pa bsags pas bdag dang gzhan la nye bar gnod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to show that the accumulation of bad conduct harms oneself and others, it is said:

original: bdag dang gzhan yang phung bar byed //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan yang phung bar byed // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It destroys oneself and others.

original: de yang longs spyod la chags pa dang longs spyod la sred pas bdag phung bar byed de de ngan song nye bar slong ba'i ngan par spyod pas so //
analyzed: de yang longs spyod la chags pa dang longs spyod la sred pas bdag phung bar byed de de ngan song nye bar slong ba'i ngan par spyod pas so //
translated: It destroys oneself through attachment to wealth and craving for wealth, because of bad conduct that brings about lower rebirths.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan yang phung bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan yang phung bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Others means other sentient beings.

original: rnam pa mang po'i gnod pa byed pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa mang po'i gnod pa byed pas so //
translated: It destroys them, because it causes harm in many ways.

original: dang gi sgra ni phung bar byed pa nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni phung bar byed pa nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “and” is used to include the destruction of oneself.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: bsam brlag ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsam brlag ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be “foolish.”

original: gang gi phyir longs spyod ma thob kyang de ni sred pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir longs spyod ma thob kyang de ni sred pa skyed par byed de /
translated: Because even if one does not obtain wealth, one generates craving for it.

original: de yang de la sred pa'i bag chags sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de yang de la sred pa'i bag chags sgom par byed do //
translated: And that cultivates the latent tendencies of craving for it.

original: de ltar na des longs spyod kyis phung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na des longs spyod kyis phung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, he is ruined by his wealth.

original: rang dbang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang dbang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not his own master.

original: de de ltar longs spyod la sred pa des phung bas bdag nyid kyang phung bar byed de ngan par spyod pa kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de de ltar longs spyod la sred pa des phung bas bdag nyid kyang phung bar byed de ngan par spyod pa kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Since he is ruined by his craving for wealth, he ruins himself, because he engages in all sorts of bad conduct.

original: / lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: / lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: gang gis de ltar phung bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar phung bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what is he ruined?

original: smras pa / 'dod la sred pa yis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod la sred pa yis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: “by craving for sensual pleasures.”

original: longs spyod la sred pas so //
analyzed: longs spyod la sred pas so //
translated: By craving for wealth.

original: longs spyod don du gnyer ba dang longs spyod la chags pa rnams 'dun pa de las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: longs spyod don du gnyer ba dang longs spyod la chags pa rnams 'dun pa de las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in order to dissuade those who are intent on wealth and those who are attached to wealth.

original: bcom pa @103a * //
analyzed: bcom pa @103a * //
translated: Ruin.

original: zhes bstan pa la ji ltar 'di dag bcom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa la ji ltar 'di dag bcom pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this ruin?

original: smras pa / chog mi shes pa'i phyir dang / mnog chung ba'i phyir dang / nyes pa mang bas so //
analyzed: smras pa / chog mi shes pa'i phyir dang / mnog chung ba'i phyir dang / nyes pa mang bas so //
translated: It is said: “because of discontent, because of smallness, and because of many faults.”

original: 'di nyid smras pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid smras pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: k'ar sh'a pa na'i char bab kyang //
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na'i char bab kyang //
translated: Even if a shower of gold coins falls,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi smos so //
translated: These are the four verses.

original: rgyal po nga las nus brgya byin brgya rtsa bcu bzhi'i tshe tshad dang mnyam pa snyed du lha dang mi'i bde ba nyams su myong nas /
analyzed: rgyal po nga las nus brgya byin brgya rtsa bcu bzhi'i tshe tshad dang mnyam pa snyed du lha dang mi'i bde ba nyams su myong nas /
translated: King Māndhātṛ experienced the happiness of gods and humans for as long as the lifespan of a hundred and ten koṭis of Śakras.

original: de'i tha mar rgya cher smras pa /
analyzed: de'i tha mar rgya cher smras pa /
translated: At the end of that, he said extensively:

original: bdag gis ni shin tu yun ring por nye bar longs spyod cing lhag par rol bar byas kyang 'dod pa rnams kyis ma ngoms te /
analyzed: bdag gis ni shin tu yun ring por nye bar longs spyod cing lhag par rol bar byas kyang 'dod pa rnams kyis ma ngoms te /
translated: I have enjoyed and indulged for a very long time, but I am not satisfied with desires.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: k'ar sh'a pa na'i char bab kyang //
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na'i char bab kyang //
translated: Even if coins rain down,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he said and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re mnyan yod na ba ka zhes bya ba rab tu byung ba la ni mngon par mi dga' ba la 'dod pa dag la ni dga' bas de dang dge slong dag las brtsams te dang po'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mnyan yod na ba ka zhes bya ba rab tu byung ba la ni mngon par mi dga' ba la 'dod pa dag la ni dga' bas de dang dge slong dag las brtsams te dang po'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so zhes so //
translated: Others say that in Śrāvastī there was one named Baka who was ordained, but he was not happy with that, and was happy with desires. Therefore, the first two verses were spoken in terms of him and the monks.

original: de dag kyang gcig la gcig 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dag kyang gcig la gcig 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “mutually related” is the condensed meaning here.

original: ji ltar yang 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par bya ba ni chog mi shes pa dang / mnog chung ba dang / nyes dmigs mang ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par bya ba ni chog mi shes pa dang / mnog chung ba dang / nyes dmigs mang ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of the unsatisfactoriness of sensual pleasure is the knowledge of their unsatisfactoriness, their insignificance, and their abundance of problems.

original: gal te 'dir ngoms par 'gyur na ni mnog chung ba dang nyes pa mang du zin kyang ngoms par 'gyur ba'i phyir don du gnyer bar 'gyur ro //🔽yang na mnog che bar gyur cing nyes pa med na ngoms par mi byed du zin kyang bde ba'i phyir don du gnyer bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dir ngoms par 'gyur na ni mnog chung ba dang nyes pa mang du zin kyang ngoms par 'gyur ba'i phyir don du gnyer bar 'gyur ro // yang na mnog che bar gyur cing nyes pa med na ngoms par mi byed du zin kyang bde ba'i phyir don du gnyer bar bya'o //
translated: If one were to be satisfied with sensual pleasures, one would pursue them even if they were insignificant and abundant in problems, because one would be satisfied with them.🔽Or, even if one were not satisfied with them, one would pursue them if they were abundant and free of problems, because they would be pleasurable.

original: yang na mnog chung ba yod cing sdug bsngal chung ba yin yang de lta na yang bde ba'i phyir don du gnyer bar bya ba nyid na /
analyzed: yang na mnog chung ba yod cing sdug bsngal chung ba yin yang de lta na yang bde ba'i phyir don du gnyer bar bya ba nyid na /
translated: Or, even if they were insignificant and free of problems, one would pursue them because they would be pleasurable.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa rnams ni ngoms par mi byed pa dang mnog chung ba dang nyes pa mang ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa rnams ni ngoms par mi byed pa dang mnog chung ba dang nyes pa mang ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, sensual pleasures are not satisfying, are insignificant, and are abundant in problems.

original: de bas na de ltar yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand it in this way.

original: gang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos kyis ni de yul du mi byed pas gang 'dod pa la ma chags pa'i phan yon rnams /
analyzed: gang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos kyis ni de yul du mi byed pas gang 'dod pa la ma chags pa'i phan yon rnams /
translated: Since the perfected Buddha and the disciples do not take that as an object, the benefits of non-attachment to desire are

original: de'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dgyes pa ste de 'dir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dgyes pa ste de 'dir bstan pa yin no //
translated: its result is delight in nirvana, which is taught here.

original: k'ar sh'a pa na'i char bab kyang //
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na'i char bab kyang //
translated: Even if a rain of karṣa coins falls,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: in this verse,

original: k'ar sh'a pa na'i gzugs bcom pa'i tshong gi tha snyad la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na'i gzugs bcom pa'i tshong gi tha snyad la dgongs pa ste /
translated: the convention of a karṣa coin is intended,

original: gser la sogs pa las byas pa'i pa na'i bye brag go //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa las byas pa'i pa na'i bye brag go //
translated: a specific coin made of gold and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re zangs ma'i pa na'i tshad k'ar sh'a yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zangs ma'i pa na'i tshad k'ar sh'a yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say a karṣa is the measure of a copper coin.

original: de dag 'bab pa @103b ni char te rgyun mi chad par 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'bab pa @103b ni char te rgyun mi chad par 'bab pa'o //
translated: A rain of those is a continuous fall.

original: des kyang sred pa dang ldan pa dag 'dod pas ngoms pa med do //
analyzed: des kyang sred pa dang ldan pa dag 'dod pas ngoms pa med do //
translated: Even that does not satisfy those with craving for desire.

original: ji skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang las rnyed pa de la chags //
analyzed: gang las rnyed pa de la chags //
translated: One is attached to that from which one obtains it.

original: rnyed las chags pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnyed las chags pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Attachment arises from acquisition.

original: zhes pa dang / sred pa'i dong 'di gting med de //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / sred pa'i dong 'di gting med de //
translated: And: This pit of craving is bottomless;

original: dgang dka' ci yis khengs par 'gyur //
analyzed: dgang dka' ci yis khengs par 'gyur //
translated: What can fill it, which is hard to fill?

original: gang zhig chen po blugs gyur kyang //
analyzed: gang zhig chen po blugs gyur kyang //
translated: Even if filled with something great,

original: khengs med gting du rgo bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khengs med gting du rgo bar 'gyur //
translated: It is not full, but rather sinks.

original: zhes so // gzhan dag na re rin po che sna bdun gyi char yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes so // gzhan dag na re rin po che sna bdun gyi char yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: It is a rain of the seven jewels.

original: 'di ltar yang rgyal po nga las nu'i pho brang gi nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du rin po che sna bdun gyi char bab ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rgyal po nga las nu'i pho brang gi nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du rin po che sna bdun gyi char bab ste /
translated: Thus, for seven days a rain of the seven jewels fell in the palace of King Māndhātṛ.

original: rin po che mang po 'dir thob par gyur pa'i phyir k'ar sh'a pa na ni de mtshon par bya ba'i phyir smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rin po che mang po 'dir thob par gyur pa'i phyir k'ar sh'a pa na ni de mtshon par bya ba'i phyir smras pa yin no //
translated: The term kārṣāpaṇa was used to indicate that many jewels were obtained here.

original: ngoms pa ni shin tu skom pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ngoms pa ni shin tu skom pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Satiation is the complete absence of thirst.

original: gang gis mi ngoms she na /
analyzed: gang gis mi ngoms she na /
translated: By what is one not satiated?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa rnams kyis te gzugs la sogs pas so //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa rnams kyis te gzugs la sogs pas so //
translated: It is said: By sense objects, such as forms.

original: nor phun sum tshogs pa las ni 'dod pa'i sred pa 'phel bar byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nor phun sum tshogs pa las ni 'dod pa'i sred pa 'phel bar byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: From the abundance of wealth, craving for sense objects increases.

original: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni med pa ste /🔽shes rab nyid kyis 'dir ngoms kyi //
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni med pa ste / shes rab nyid kyis 'dir ngoms kyi //
translated: “Not” means “not at all.”🔽“Here” means “in this life.”

original: 'dod pa'i yo byad yongs su gzung bas ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yo byad yongs su gzung bas ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one is satisfied with wisdom, not with the enjoyment of sense objects.

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyis ngoms she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyis ngoms she na /
translated: How is one satisfied with wisdom?

original: de bzhin nyid yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one keeps in mind suchness.

original: de ltar ngoms par mi byed pa'i skyon bstan nas gzhan bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ;
analyzed: de ltar ngoms par mi byed pa'i skyon bstan nas gzhan bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ;
translated: Having thus taught the fault of not being satisfied, he says,

original: 'dod pa mnog chung zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa mnog chung zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Sense objects are trifling,”

original: dug dang 'dres pa'i kha zas lta bur bde ba chung ba dang / rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //🔽nyes pa mang ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mang po gang la yod pa de ni nyes pa mang ba yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: dug dang 'dres pa'i kha zas lta bur bde ba chung ba dang / rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro // nyes pa mang ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mang po gang la yod pa de ni nyes pa mang ba yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: because they are like food mixed with poison, because they have little pleasure, and because they are like a dream.🔽“They have many faults” means that they have many sufferings.

original: gnod pa mang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod pa mang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they have many dangers.

original: ji skad bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:🔽The difference between Mount Meru and a mustard seed,🔽the difference between the vastness of the ocean and a drop,

original: gang zhig ri rab yungs 'bru'i khyad par dang // rgya mtsho'i che dang thigs pa'i khyad par dang // blo ngan bzang po gnyis kyi bye brag kyang //
analyzed: gang zhig ri rab yungs 'bru'i khyad par dang // rgya mtsho'i che dang thigs pa'i khyad par dang // blo ngan bzang po gnyis kyi bye brag kyang //
translated: the difference between the evil and the good,

original: mkhas pas bde dang sdug bsngal de ltar 'dod //
analyzed: mkhas pas bde dang sdug bsngal de ltar 'dod //
translated: the wise know it is like the difference between happiness and suffering.

original: ces so // khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid nges par byas shing tshul shin tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid nges par byas shing tshul shin tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: Understanding means ascertaining suchness and fully realizing the way.

original: mkhas pa ni blo rnam par gsal ba'i phyir mi dge ba la sogs pa la yang dag par yongs su brtags pas lam gyi tshogs la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni blo rnam par gsal ba'i phyir mi dge ba la sogs pa la yang dag par yongs su brtags pas lam gyi tshogs la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the wise have clear minds, by thoroughly investigating non-virtue and so on, the meaning is that they engage in the accumulation of the path.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyis 'dod pa yongs su shes par byas nas ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyis 'dod pa yongs su shes par byas nas ci zhig ce na /
translated: Having thus understood desire through these three aspects, what then?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / lha'i 'dod pa rnams las so //🔽zhes bya ba @104a * //
analyzed: smras pa / lha'i 'dod pa rnams las so // zhes bya ba @104a * //
translated: From the desires of the gods.

original: smos te / lha nyid yin pas lha'o //
analyzed: smos te / lha nyid yin pas lha'o //
translated: Because they are gods, they are gods.

original: de'i 'dod pa ni lhag par yid du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa ni lhag par yid du 'ong ba ste /
translated: Their desires are extremely pleasant.

original: de dag la ma 'ongs pa'i nyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir mkhas pas de nam yang mngon par mi 'thob na /
analyzed: de dag la ma 'ongs pa'i nyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir mkhas pas de nam yang mngon par mi 'thob na /
translated: The wise never attain them, because they see the future faults in them.

original: mi'i 'dod pa rnams la yang lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'dod pa rnams la yang lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'o //
translated: What need is there to mention human desires?

original: de de ltar 'dod pa rnams la ni mngon par dga' ba med na /
analyzed: de de ltar 'dod pa rnams la ni mngon par dga' ba med na /
translated: When one is thus without delight in desires,

original: gang la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba yod ce na /🔽smras pa / sred pa zad pas dgyes par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba yod ce na / smras pa / sred pa zad pas dgyes par 'gyur //
translated: in what does one delight?🔽It is said: One delights in the extinction of craving.

original: zhes bya ba smos te mya ngan las 'das pas mngon par dgyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te mya ngan las 'das pas mngon par dgyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one delights in nirvana.

original: ci thams cad kyang nges par 'dod pa dag la mi dga' zhing sred pa zad pas dga' bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad kyang nges par 'dod pa dag la mi dga' zhing sred pa zad pas dga' bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Do all delight in the extinction of craving without delighting in desires?

original: de ni ma yin te /🔽smras pa / rdzogs sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / smras pa / rdzogs sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams //
translated: This is not so.🔽It is said:🔽The perfect buddhas and śrāvakas🔽

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: The perfect buddhas and the disciples

original: de nyid gcig pu ji ltar dgyes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nyid gcig pu ji ltar dgyes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: How does one delight in the extinction of craving?

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: One delights in the extinction of craving, not in its arising.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po dag la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas bsam gtan la dga' bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po dag la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas bsam gtan la dga' bar gyur pa'am /
translated: Thus, having become free from attachment to external things, he delights in the meditative absorptions,

original: yang na gzugs med pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gzugs med pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: or else he delights in the formless states.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i chogs des de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po'i don mtha' dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //🔽de'i nyan thos ni /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i chogs des de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po'i don mtha' dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so // de'i nyan thos ni /
translated: By means of that unerring method, he realizes the entire meaning of the reality of thusness and becomes a perfect buddha.🔽His disciples

original: de'i bka'i rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bka'i rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: are those who follow his teaching,

original: de nyid la yang dag par rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la yang dag par rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have entered into the reality that he has realized.

original: de la 'di ni 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myong bar byed pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pas de las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de la 'di ni 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myong bar byed pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pas de las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: Here, this verse is stated in order to turn one away from the faults of relishing the pleasures, having shown their disadvantages.

original: k'ar sh'a pa na'i char bab pa nyi tshes ma ngoms pa ma yin te /
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na'i char bab pa nyi tshes ma ngoms pa ma yin te /
translated: The rain of coins does not satisfy,

original: gser gyi ri bo thob par gyur kyang 'dod pa dag gis ngoms pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gser gyi ri bo thob par gyur kyang 'dod pa dag gis ngoms pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: just as the attainment of a golden mountain does not satisfy the greedy.

original: gangs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gangs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The Blessed One said, In the snowy land, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das shi la ba ti zhes bya ba'i sh'akya rnams kyi grong rdal na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shi la ba ti zhes bya ba'i sh'akya rnams kyi grong rdal na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in the Śākya town called Śīlavatī.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought this:

original: rgyal srid ni nges par gsad pa dang gsod par byed du 'jug pas thob par bya ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang / ji tsam na bdud 'ongs te zhus pa /
analyzed: rgyal srid ni nges par gsad pa dang gsod par byed du 'jug pas thob par bya ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang / ji tsam na bdud 'ongs te zhus pa /
translated: Since a kingdom is obtained by killing and causing others to kill, it is said to be obtained by killing.🔽Then Māra came and asked:

original: btsun pa rgyal srid ni thob par bya ba rdzu 'phrul gyis te /
analyzed: btsun pa rgyal srid ni thob par bya ba rdzu 'phrul gyis te /
translated: Venerable, a kingdom is obtained by magical power.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i rgyal srid do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i rgyal srid do //
translated: Thus, a kingdom is desired.🔽The Blessed One said, Evil One, why do you say this?

original: sdig can ci'i phyir de skad ces smra zhes bka' stsal pa dang / btsun pa bdag gis ni bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos shing bzung ste gang la la zhig gis rdzu 'phrul @104b gyi rkang pa bzhi kun du bsten pa dang / bsgoms pa dang /
analyzed: sdig can ci'i phyir de skad ces smra zhes bka' stsal pa dang / btsun pa bdag gis ni bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos shing bzung ste gang la la zhig gis rdzu 'phrul @104b gyi rkang pa bzhi kun du bsten pa dang / bsgoms pa dang /
translated: Māra said, Venerable, I have heard and understood directly from the Blessed One that whoever relies on, cultivates, and increases the four bases of magical power,

original: mang du byas pa dang / 'dod par byas pa des ni ri gangs can dang mnyam pa'i gser gyi ri bo las kyang grol te de yang de bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: mang du byas pa dang / 'dod par byas pa des ni ri gangs can dang mnyam pa'i gser gyi ri bo las kyang grol te de yang de bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: and he has done so much and has desired it so much, he will be liberated from a mountain of gold equal to the snowy mountains, and that will happen just like that, not otherwise.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang ldan no zhes rgya cher smras te /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang ldan no zhes rgya cher smras te /
translated: The Blessed One has the four bases of supernatural power, and so on at length.🔽Therefore I speak like this.

original: de bas na bdag de ltar smra'o zhes pa dang / ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag de ltar smra'o zhes pa dang / ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these two verses:

original: de la 'dir dang po'i tshigs bcad kyis ni yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir dang po'i tshigs bcad kyis ni yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, in the first verse, he teaches and causes to take up.

original: de la 'di ji ltar yang dag par bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'di ji ltar yang dag par bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he teaches here?

analyzed: 'dod cing sred pa'i nyes pa ste mang zhing mchog tu gyur pa thun mong ma yin pa'i nor rnyed par gyur kyang ngoms pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: 'dod cing sred pa'i gzhis ngan par spyod pa las bzlog pa dang / legs par spyod pa la gzud pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //

analyzed: gang dang zhe na /

translated: This teaches the extraordinary time.🔽By that wealth,

analyzed: yang na 'dis shes pa yin pas nor de bde'o zhes rig cing thob pa dang rjes su myong ba ni nor zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, it is wealth because it is known, obtained, and experienced as happiness by that knowledge. This is the meaning of the word wealth.🔽Therefore,

analyzed: gyis la zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir ngoms par mi 'gyur ba de bas na 'dod pa yongs su spongs la dge ba gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /

analyzed: sems can mtha' dag gi spyod pa ni legs par spyod pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //

original: nye du mdza' bshes rtsa lag ni //
analyzed: nye du mdza' bshes rtsa lag ni //

analyzed: sdug bsngal byung nas ldog par 'gyur //

translated: This is stated in order to generate disgust for that in those who engage in evil conduct for the sake of acquiring wealth.🔽In order to demonstrate that one who understands that one is afflicted by desire in this way will become free from attachment to them, he says:

original: gang dag sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: are killed by enemies,🔽by kings, and by robbers,🔽and they are killed by their own minds.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang pos ni 'dod pa dag las ma nyams na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir skyon bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang pos ni 'dod pa dag las ma nyams na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir skyon bstan te /
translated: Here, the first half of the verse shows the fault of desire, because it is the cause of suffering when one does not fall away from desire.

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa dag yod na ni phyir rgol ba rnams dang / mang po gsad pa dang bcing ba dang sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po 'thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshigs bcad phyed 'og mas ni 'dod pa nyams pa la lhag par chags pa'i skyon bstan to //

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni gang la la'o //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni gang la la'o //

analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ste de kho na nyid mthong ba'o //

original: ci zhig shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig shes pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: mdor bsdu na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa ni ci rigs par thams cad la sbyar ro zhes gsungs pas so //

original: de'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni 'di las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni 'di las skyes pa ste /

analyzed: rgyu mtshan 'di dang 'dod pa'i rgyus //

original: zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is this:🔽“Because of this, and because of the cause of desire,

analyzed: sred pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yin no zhes pas so //
translated: “Desire” is the truth of origination.

analyzed: nam yang dga' mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //

analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni shes pa'o // nam yang dga' mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rtsa ba 'dod pa yin no zhes mkhas pas shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des na 'dod pa mnyam pa la yang su zhig khyad par du dga' bar byed de /

analyzed: ji ltar 'dod cing sred pa skyed par byed pa'o //

analyzed: 'dod pa nyams pa la yang bde ba yod par 'gyur ram zhe na de yang med de /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten dag na zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: zug rngur 'gyur ba'i rgyur shes par byas nas so //

analyzed: 'di lta ste / pha dang / ma dang / bu smad dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams dang / rta dang /
translated: For example,

analyzed: de nyams pa'i dus na yang shin tu mi bzad ba'i mya ngan gyi zug rngu 'byung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: des na 'di 'dod chen can dag la zug rngur gyur pa yin no //

analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni zug rngur gyur pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: “They” refers to the cause of pain.

original: brtan pa ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni mkhas pa'o //

analyzed: gdul phyir zhes bya ba ni bral ba dang spang ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: slob par byed ces bya ba ni spong bar byed pa'i lam la brten pa'o //

analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po ni 'phags pa'i lam du gzud pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dod pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa rnams de las 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to turn away from that path those who delight in sensual pleasures and are attached to sensual pleasures.

original: yang gcer bu pa'i phyogs la 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: yang gcer bu pa'i phyogs la 'di skad smra ste /
translated: The Nirgrantha faction says this:

original: bde ba'i yo byad spang ba'i sh'akya rnams la ni 'dod chags dag bral ba ga la yod ces smra ba la de dag 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur gyi /
