analyzed: yul gyi bsngags pa brjod pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs @106a * //
translated: But they will become free from attachment by being taught the faults of desire, not by being praised.

original: pa'o ; /'dod pa'i tshoms te gnyis pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: pa'o ; /'dod pa'i tshoms te gnyis pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter, having desire as its basis.

original: // / sred pa nyid don dam par 'dod pa yin gyi yul ni ma yin no zhes nges par bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: // / sred pa nyid don dam par 'dod pa yin gyi yul ni ma yin no zhes nges par bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: The point is to establish that craving is ultimately the desire, not the object.

original: de'i 'og tu sred pa'i tshoms bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sred pa'i tshoms bkod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the chapter on craving is presented next.

original: gang gi phyir ji skad du gzugs la sogs pa la 'dod pa'i sgro btags pa ni bram ze'i khye'u la me'i sgro btags pa lta bu'o //🔽'o na / 'jig rten sna tshogs gang de 'dod min gyi //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad du gzugs la sogs pa la 'dod pa'i sgro btags pa ni bram ze'i khye'u la me'i sgro btags pa lta bu'o // 'o na / 'jig rten sna tshogs gang de 'dod min gyi //
translated: Because the superimposition of desire on form and so on is like the superimposition of fire on a Brahmin boy,

original: zhes bya ba gong du bstan zin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gong du bstan zin na /
translated: then if it is as stated above, “The variety of the world is not desire,”

original: ji ltar de'i don du yang 'di'i don la 'bad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i don du yang 'di'i don la 'bad par bya zhe na /
translated: How can one strive for the meaning of that?

original: de ni de lta mod kyi skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don du bshad la //
analyzed: de ni de lta mod kyi skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don du bshad la //
translated: This is the condensed meaning: “The desire of a person is the desire of conceptual thought, which is passion.”

original: da ni rgya cher dbye ba bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni rgya cher dbye ba bshad pa yin te /
translated: Now, the extensive classification is explained.

original: lus can rnam par rtog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lus can rnam par rtog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The verse begins, “The body of conceptual thought of those who have bodies…”

original: 'di byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo'i sdig pa mi dge ba la rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo'i sdig pa mi dge ba la rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: The context for this is as follows: The Blessed One said, “Monks, these three are the sinful, unwholesome conceptual thoughts of a foolish, uneducated ordinary person.

original: gsum po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: They are the conceptual thoughts of passion, the conceptual thoughts of malice, and the conceptual thoughts of violence.

original: gang gi phyir byis pa ni ngan par bsam pa sems so zhes rgya cher bshad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byis pa ni ngan par bsam pa sems so zhes rgya cher bshad do //
translated: Because a foolish person thinks evil thoughts.”

original: 'phags pa la ni dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa gsum mnga' ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa la ni dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa gsum mnga' ste /
translated: The noble ones have three kinds of wholesome thoughts:🔽those of renunciation, etc.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'o zhes bstan nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'o zhes bstan nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Having taught this, he stated these two verses.

original: de la re zhig dang po smras pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po smras pa /
translated: Among them, first he said:

original: rnam par rtog pas rab bcom pa //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rab bcom pa //
translated: Those who are destroyed by conceptualization

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dod pa'i sred pa rgyu dang bcas pa 'phel bar bstan to ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dod pa'i sred pa rgyu dang bcas pa 'phel bar bstan to ;
translated: Here, the craving for the sense-pleasures together with its cause is taught.

original: / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / phyin ci log gis de 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / phyin ci log gis de 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: It increases through incorrect mental attention, forgetfulness, and error.

original: rgyu gsum po 'di dag 'dir go rims bzhin du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gsum po 'di dag 'dir go rims bzhin du ston pa yin no //
translated: These three causes are taught here in order.

original: mi 'dra bar rtog pas rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'dra bar rtog pas rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Conceptualization is the discrimination of the unreal.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the conceptualization associated with incorrect mental attention.

original: des bcom pa ni rtog pa dang dbang po byas pa ste /
analyzed: des bcom pa ni rtog pa dang dbang po byas pa ste /
translated: Those who are destroyed by it are those who are dominated by conceptualization and the sense faculties.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar rnam par rtog pas rab tu bcom par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rtog pas rab tu bcom par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are destroyed by discursive thought?

original: sngar thos pa dang sngar spyad pa'i 'dod pa rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed de /
analyzed: sngar thos pa dang sngar spyad pa'i 'dod pa rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed de /
translated: They attend improperly to their former desires and former conduct.

original: dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam @106b par rtog par mi byed de sdig pa la zhen cing gnas pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam @106b par rtog par mi byed de sdig pa la zhen cing gnas pa'o zhes so //
translated: They do not think with wholesome thoughts, but with thoughts of evil, they are attached to and dwell on evil.

original: lus can zhes bya ba ni lus de gang la yod pa ste sems can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus can zhes bya ba ni lus de gang la yod pa ste sems can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those who have bodies are those who have that body, which means sentient beings.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rtsig pa la sogs pa la ni sred pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rtsig pa la sogs pa la ni sred pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no craving for external things such as walls, etc.

original: ci 'di la log pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di la log pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Is craving increased here by mere false imagination?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'on kyang 'dod chags mi bzad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod chags mi bzad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: However, it is said: “with unbearable attachment.

original: 'dod chags drag po gang la yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags drag po gang la yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: ” That is, where there is strong attachment, that is what is meant by the phrase “with.🔽”

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bag la nyal gyi rgyu nye bar bsags shing gnyen po ma bsten pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bag la nyal gyi rgyu nye bar bsags shing gnyen po ma bsten pas so //
translated: Because the latent cause of desire realm attachment is accumulated and its antidote is not cultivated.

original: de'i gnyen po lus la sogs pa'i rnam pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po lus la sogs pa'i rnam pa dran pa'o //
translated: Its antidote is the mindfulness of the body and so on.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags mi bzad pas 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags mi bzad pas 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it arise from unbearable attachment?

original: sngar skye ba gzhan dag tu 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kun du bsten pa dang / bsgoms pa dang mang du byas pa de'i rgyus 'di yin no //
analyzed: sngar skye ba gzhan dag tu 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kun du bsten pa dang / bsgoms pa dang mang du byas pa de'i rgyus 'di yin no //
translated: It is due to the cause of relying on, cultivating, and frequently engaging in desire realm attachment in previous lives.

original: de lta mod kyi tshul bzhin du yid la byas pas sems kyi 'dod chags rjes su sel bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi tshul bzhin du yid la byas pas sems kyi 'dod chags rjes su sel bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: However, it is said that by properly attending to the mind, one eliminates mental attachment.

original: gtsang bar rjes su lta bas zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang reg pa dang nye bar spyod pa la sdug pa dang gtsang ba ste /
analyzed: gtsang bar rjes su lta bas zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang reg pa dang nye bar spyod pa la sdug pa dang gtsang ba ste /
translated: The phrase by observing purity refers to the pleasant and pure aspects of color, shape, touch, and enjoyment.

original: de ltar rjes su lta zhing dmigs pa'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni gtsang bar lta ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su lta zhing dmigs pa'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni gtsang bar lta ba ste /
translated: One who observes and focuses on such aspects is one who observes purity.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ji ltar gtsang bar rjes su lta bas yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gtsang bar rjes su lta bas yin zhe na /
translated: How does one view it as clean?

original: dbang po sdom pas nye bar mi gnas pa des bud med mthong bar gyur na dran pa rtse gcig pas chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po sdom pas nye bar mi gnas pa des bud med mthong bar gyur na dran pa rtse gcig pas chags par 'gyur te /
translated: When one who does not practice restraint of the senses sees a woman, one becomes attached through one-pointed recollection.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pas gtsang ba'i mtshan mar nye bar 'dzin te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pas gtsang ba'i mtshan mar nye bar 'dzin te /
translated: One grasps the sign of cleanliness through improper mental activity.

original: gzhi des na lus mngon par gdung ba dang / sems mngon par gdung bar byed pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gzhi des na lus mngon par gdung ba dang / sems mngon par gdung bar byed pa yin no zhes so //
translated: On that basis, one torments the body and torments the mind.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i lus can 'di la ni 'dod chags phyir zhing rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i lus can 'di la ni 'dod chags phyir zhing rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: For one who is like that, desire increases more and more.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags shas cher 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags shas cher 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Desire for sensual pleasure increases greatly.

original: rtags rnam pa lngas sred pa 'phel bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rtags rnam pa lngas sred pa 'phel bar rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that craving increases through five signs.

original: 'dod chags kyi yul chung ba la yang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi bzad pas kun nas dkris shing lhag par chags par 'gyur na gya nom pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi yul chung ba la yang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi bzad pas kun nas dkris shing lhag par chags par 'gyur na gya nom pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: One is completely bound by unbearable desire for sensual pleasure even with regard to a small object of desire, let alone a sublime one.

original: chos ma yin pas gang longs spyod mang po yang dag par len pa yin te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas gang longs spyod mang po yang dag par len pa yin te /
translated: He is not a Dharma practitioner, but one who accumulates much wealth.

original: chos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not a Dharma practitioner.

original: longs spyod shin tu mang po kun du 'dzin par 'gyur te /🔽de mi gces shing dgos @107a * //
analyzed: longs spyod shin tu mang po kun du 'dzin par 'gyur te / de mi gces shing dgos @107a * //
translated: He accumulates much wealth.

original: pa med pa'i dngos po yang 'dor bar mi byed na /
analyzed: pa med pa'i dngos po yang 'dor bar mi byed na /
translated: He does not give up even worthless things that are of no use to him.

original: gces pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gces pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention his giving up of valuable things?

original: dgos pa chung zhing ngan don tsam gyi don du yang ngan par spyod pa mang po spyod na /
analyzed: dgos pa chung zhing ngan don tsam gyi don du yang ngan par spyod pa mang po spyod na /
translated: He engages in many evil actions for the sake of a small, insignificant purpose.

original: dgos pa chen po la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: dgos pa chen po la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention his engaging in evil actions for the sake of a great purpose?

original: legs par spyod pa chung du yang de'i sems bsgrub cing 'jug par mi dga' na /
analyzed: legs par spyod pa chung du yang de'i sems bsgrub cing 'jug par mi dga' na /
translated: He does not enjoy engaging in even small virtuous actions.

original: chen po la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: chen po la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention his engaging in great virtuous actions?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thos par yang mi 'dod na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thos par yang mi 'dod na /
translated: He does not even want to hear about nirvana.

original: thob par bya ba lta ci smos pa ste /
analyzed: thob par bya ba lta ci smos pa ste /
translated: What need is there to mention his attaining it?

original: gang de lta bus ni sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang de lta bus ni sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, craving increases.

original: de yis dam por byed ces bya ba ni de nyid kyis lus can la 'ching ba dam por byed do //
analyzed: de yis dam por byed ces bya ba ni de nyid kyis lus can la 'ching ba dam por byed do //
translated: “It binds them tightly” means that it binds embodied beings tightly.

original: gang gi phyir dam por byed pa ni 'bad pas kyang dgrol bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam por byed pa ni 'bad pas kyang dgrol bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it binds tightly, it is difficult to liberate them even with effort.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis ni 'ching ba dam po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis ni 'ching ba dam po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: It is a tight binding in three ways:

original: shin tu sra ba dang / reg na sdug bsngal ba dang / dus yun ring du 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sra ba dang / reg na sdug bsngal ba dang / dus yun ring du 'brel pa'o //
translated: very firm, painful to touch, and long-lasting.

original: de la mthong ba'i chos la ngan par spyod pa'i rtsa ba ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug go //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i chos la ngan par spyod pa'i rtsa ba ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug go //
translated: Among them, attachment, aversion, and delusion are the roots of misconduct in the present life.

original: de ni shin tu sra ba'i 'ching bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni shin tu sra ba'i 'ching bar rig par bya'o //
translated: That should be known as a very firm binding.

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan song du skye bar rig na sdug bsngal ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan song du skye bar rig na sdug bsngal ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: When one is born in the lower realms such as hell, it should be known as painful.

original: yun ring por 'khor ba na gnas pa ni dus yun ring po dang 'brel par blta'o //
analyzed: yun ring por 'khor ba na gnas pa ni dus yun ring po dang 'brel par blta'o //
translated: Abiding in cyclic existence for a long time should be seen as long-lasting.

original: rang gi 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i sred pa 'ching ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rang gi 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i sred pa 'ching ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: “One’s own bonds” refers to the state of being bound by craving that is present in one’s own continuum.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi 'ching ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi 'ching ba yin te /
translated: Or else, it refers to the bonds of suffering.

original: gang gi phyir sred pa 'phel ba las skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lan du mar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sred pa 'phel ba las skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lan du mar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suffering such as birth occurs repeatedly due to the increase of craving.

original: de la 'di ni sred pa'i skyon bstan pas de nges par spang pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: de la 'di ni sred pa'i skyon bstan pas de nges par spang pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: Here, this is stated in order to definitely abandon craving by teaching the faults of craving.

original: sred pa spong ba'i gzugs nye bar blang ba nyid du ston pa'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: sred pa spong ba'i gzugs nye bar blang ba nyid du ston pa'i phyir smras pa //
translated: In order to teach that the form that is the abandonment of craving is to be appropriated, he said:

original: gang dag rnam rtog nye bar zhi dga' zhing //
analyzed: gang dag rnam rtog nye bar zhi dga' zhing //
translated: “Those who delight in the pacification of conceptualization,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di'i don ni tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i gnyen po nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i gnyen po nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood as the antidote to the previous verse.

original: gang gis 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi bar byas pa de ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi bar byas pa de ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: One who has pacified the conceptualization of desire and so on is one who has pacified conceptualization.

original: nges par 'byung ba la sogs par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la sogs par rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought of renunciation and so on.

original: de la gang dag dga' ba ni mgu ba yang dag par skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang dag dga' ba ni mgu ba yang dag par skyes pa ste /
translated: Among them, those who delight are those who have fully generated joy.

original: ji skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pas yongs su ma bsgoms shing spangs pa dang / bsal ba dang nges par byas pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pas yongs su ma bsgoms shing spangs pa dang / bsal ba dang nges par byas pa'o zhes so //
translated: By the arising of the thought of desire, one does not fully cultivate, abandons, removes, and determines.

original: mi sdug bsgom par byed ces bya ba ni lus kyi rnam @107b par 'gyur ba ste rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par rul par nang du dmigs pa gang yin pa'i yid la byed pa de ni sdug pa dang dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir mi sdug pa zhes brjod de phyin ci ma log par de bsgom zhing yang dang yang du mngon du byed pas so //
analyzed: mi sdug bsgom par byed ces bya ba ni lus kyi rnam @107b par 'gyur ba ste rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par rul par nang du dmigs pa gang yin pa'i yid la byed pa de ni sdug pa dang dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir mi sdug pa zhes brjod de phyin ci ma log par de bsgom zhing yang dang yang du mngon du byed pas so //
translated: Cultivating the unappealing means the transformation of the body, which is the attention that internally observes the blue-black and rotten state. That is called unappealing because it is the object of the appealing. By cultivating that without error and repeatedly manifesting it, one cultivates the unappealing.

original: rtag tu dran pa zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad dran pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu dran pa zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad dran pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: Always mindful means abiding in mindfulness at all times.

original: 'dod chags kyi 'jigs pa ni dus thams cad du dran pa la nye bar gnas shing bsgom par bya ste bar chad med par byed pa dang / skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis de ltar 'di la 'dod chags kyis skabs rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'jigs pa ni dus thams cad du dran pa la nye bar gnas shing bsgom par bya ste bar chad med par byed pa dang / skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis de ltar 'di la 'dod chags kyis skabs rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The fear of passion should be cultivated at all times by being mindful and by being free from obstacles and by being diligent without weariness. In this way, passion will not find an opportunity.

original: des de ltar ldan par byas nas ni yun ring pos nges par sred pa spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des de ltar ldan par byas nas ni yun ring pos nges par sred pa spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having become endowed in this way, one will certainly abandon craving after a long time.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: de yis sred pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yis sred pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “By that, craving” and so on.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa la bye brag med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa la bye brag med par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught without distinction on the level of non-equipoise.

original: de yis de ltar yang dag par ldan par byas pas rnal 'byor spyod pas ji srid du ma spangs pa de srid du de dag rul bar byed pa ni de nyid nyam chung bar byed pa ste spong zhing dgag par nus pa'o //
analyzed: de yis de ltar yang dag par ldan par byas pas rnal 'byor spyod pas ji srid du ma spangs pa de srid du de dag rul bar byed pa ni de nyid nyam chung bar byed pa ste spong zhing dgag par nus pa'o //
translated: By that, having become endowed in this way, the spiritual practitioner, for as long as they have not been abandoned, causes them to rot, that is, he weakens them, and is able to abandon and stop them.

original: sred pa spangs pa'i thabs la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: sred pa spangs pa'i thabs la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in order to introduce the means of abandoning craving.

original: sred pa ma spangs pa dag la ni rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: sred pa ma spangs pa dag la ni rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
translated: To teach this, he said:

original: 'dod pa mun nag 'dra bas g-yogs //
analyzed: 'dod pa mun nag 'dra bas g-yogs //
translated: Craving is like a dark cave.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya bzang ldan la sogs pa gdul ba'i dus la bab par mkhyen pa dang / gzhan yang khyad par du 'phags pa dag rab tu byung bar bya ba'i phyir chu bo nas rgyu zhing gshegs pa las chu bo'i 'gram zhig na skye bo'i tshogs chen po dga' ston gyi dus zhig la bab ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya bzang ldan la sogs pa gdul ba'i dus la bab par mkhyen pa dang / gzhan yang khyad par du 'phags pa dag rab tu byung bar bya ba'i phyir chu bo nas rgyu zhing gshegs pa las chu bo'i 'gram zhig na skye bo'i tshogs chen po dga' ston gyi dus zhig la bab ste /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, knowing that the time had come to tame Śākya Bhadrika and others, and in order to make others of superior qualities go forth, was wandering along the river. On the bank of the river, at a time of celebration, a great assembly of people

original: gar dang glu la sogs pa len pa de dang nye ba zhig na nya mang po zin pa dang / ba'i tshogs kyi rjes su 'o ma la sred pa'i be'u mang po dag 'breng ba gzigs te yang dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gar dang glu la sogs pa len pa de dang nye ba zhig na nya mang po zin pa dang / ba'i tshogs kyi rjes su 'o ma la sred pa'i be'u mang po dag 'breng ba gzigs te yang dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: were singing, dancing, and so on. Nearby, he saw many fish caught and a large number of calves, who were craving milk, tied to a herd of cows. Again, he said to the monks:🔽Monks!

original: dge slong dag 'jig rten ni 'dod pas ldongs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'jig rten ni 'dod pas ldongs pa yin te /
translated: Monks, the world is blinded by desire.

original: 'dod pa'i dra bas g-yogs pa'o zhes rgya cher bka' stsal te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dra bas g-yogs pa'o zhes rgya cher bka' stsal te /
translated: It is covered by the net of desire.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis gsungs so //
translated: These two verses were spoken.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni kun 'byung gi bden pa rnam pa lnga dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam pa gnyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni kun 'byung gi bden pa rnam pa lnga dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam pa gnyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the meaning in brief is the five aspects of the truth of origin and the two aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /🔽da ltar byung ba'i yul la chags pa dang / 'das pa'i @108a * //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na / da ltar byung ba'i yul la chags pa dang / 'das pa'i @108a * //
translated: What are the five aspects?

original: yul la rjes su myong nas chags pa'i kun du rtog pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yul la 'dod pa dang / de rnams skyes pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / de yang dge ba byed pa la rang dbang med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul la rjes su myong nas chags pa'i kun du rtog pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yul la 'dod pa dang / de rnams skyes pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / de yang dge ba byed pa la rang dbang med par byed pa'o //
translated: Attachment to present objects, conceptualization through experiencing past objects, desire for future objects, excessive attachment to those that have arisen, and lack of independence in virtuous action.

original: rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two aspects?

original: da ltar byung ba'i gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa'i rga ba dang ; ris mthun pa'i rgyun chad pa ste 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa'i rga ba dang ; ris mthun pa'i rgyun chad pa ste 'chi ba'o //
translated: Aging is the transformation of the present state, and death is the cessation of the continuum of the same type.

original: 'dod pa mun gnag dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa mun gnag dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The compound “covered by the darkness of desire” is a dvandva compound.

original: de la 'dod pa ni kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa ni kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: Therein, desire is the desire of conceptual thought.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The word “desire” is used because it is the desire of a person.

original: mun pa ni des 'dod pa'i skyon mi shes pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa mi shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mun pa ni des 'dod pa'i skyon mi shes pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa mi shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Darkness is the non-understanding of the faults of desire and the non-understanding of the Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mun nag gis ldongs par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mun nag gis ldongs par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: As the Lord has said, “One enters into blindness through darkness.

original: ldongs pas 'jug pa gang yin pa'i skyes bu ni 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ldongs pas 'jug pa gang yin pa'i skyes bu ni 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The person who enters into blindness is one who is together with desire.”

original: 'dod pas kyang dra bas nya'i tshogs bzhin du rnam par rtog pa rnam pa mang po dang ldan pas kun nas g-yogs pa dang / yongs su mkhyud par byed pa de 'dod chags can gyi rgyud la'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas kyang dra bas nya'i tshogs bzhin du rnam par rtog pa rnam pa mang po dang ldan pas kun nas g-yogs pa dang / yongs su mkhyud par byed pa de 'dod chags can gyi rgyud la'o //
translated: Desire also covers and completely binds the mind, like a net covering a multitude of fish, because it is associated with many kinds of conceptual thoughts.

original: gang du rjes su myong ba'i yul la 'dod chags shing de nyid la rnam pa mang po'i sgo nas kyang 'dod chags kyis kun du rtog pas so //
analyzed: gang du rjes su myong ba'i yul la 'dod chags shing de nyid la rnam pa mang po'i sgo nas kyang 'dod chags kyis kun du rtog pas so //
translated: It is the state of mind that is attached to the object that is experienced and that conceives of it in many ways through attachment.🔽Covered by the covering of craving,

original: sred pa'i dgab pas bkab pa dang // zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa'i sred pa bshad nas /
analyzed: sred pa'i dgab pas bkab pa dang // zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa'i sred pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained craving in the present and past,

original: 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa'i sred pa bshad de /
analyzed: 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa'i sred pa bshad de /
translated: he explains craving that focuses on the future.

original: sred pa ni sems can gyi rgyud la dgab pa'am sgrib pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: sred pa ni sems can gyi rgyud la dgab pa'am sgrib pa lta bu yin te /
translated: Craving is like a covering or obscuration in the mental continuum of sentient beings.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer sprin la sogs pas bkab pa lta bu'o //🔽des bkab pa ni bsgribs pa ste 'dod pa la sred pa de nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus las brtsams nas de'i skyon bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer sprin la sogs pas bkab pa lta bu'o // des bkab pa ni bsgribs pa ste 'dod pa la sred pa de nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus las brtsams nas de'i skyon bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is like the sun's rays being covered by clouds and so on.🔽Covered by that, one is obscured.

original: gang gi phyir yid la yang thar pa 'dod par mi byed na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid la yang thar pa 'dod par mi byed na /
translated: The future is taught to be the fault of that craving for sense objects, because if one does not even wish for liberation in one's mind,

original: de thob pa'i ched du brtson par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de thob pa'i ched du brtson par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to mention that one will strive for the attainment of that?

original: bag med pa ni bag med pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: bag med pa ni bag med pa'i gnas so //
translated: Negligence is the state of negligence.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gyur pa'i rgyud 'dod pa dag las byang sems bsrung la ngan par spyod pa dang des bsgom pa las sems bsrung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gyur pa'i rgyud 'dod pa dag las byang sems bsrung la ngan par spyod pa dang des bsgom pa las sems bsrung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who desire such a continuum should protect the bodhisattva from bad conduct and protect the mind from that meditation.

original: de yang de lta bur gang zag nyon mongs pas rang dbang med par byed pa'i phyir bcings par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang de lta bur gang zag nyon mongs pas rang dbang med par byed pa'i phyir bcings par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, since that person is made powerless by the afflictions, he is bound.

original: de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: 'ching bas bcings pa dag ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'ching bas bcings pa dag ces bya ba smos te /
translated: “Those who are bound by the bonds” are mentioned.

original: 'di la bcings pa yin pas 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la bcings pa yin pas 'ching ba ste /
translated: Here, since there is bondage, there are bonds.

original: 'khor ba'i btson rar @108b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i btson rar @108b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are imprisoned in saṃsāra.

original: sred pa'i 'ching ba des 'dod pa can bcings pa yin no //
analyzed: sred pa'i 'ching ba des 'dod pa can bcings pa yin no //
translated: Those who desire are bound by that bond of craving.🔽How is that?

original: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: smras pa / tshed mar chud pa'i nya dang 'dra //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / tshed mar chud pa'i nya dang 'dra // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Like a fish caught in a trap.”

original: nya ni chu'i nang du spyod pa'i srog chags nya nyid do //
analyzed: nya ni chu'i nang du spyod pa'i srog chags nya nyid do //
translated: A fish is a living being that moves in the water.

original: tshed ma ni rgya ste dra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshed ma ni rgya ste dra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: A trap is a net, meaning a snare.

original: der chud pa ni de'i kha dang nang du'o //
analyzed: der chud pa ni de'i kha dang nang du'o //
translated: Caught in that is being inside its mouth.

original: gzhan dag ni chu de'i nang na gnas pa'i chu srin kum bi ra la sogs pa'i rigs de dag gi khar chud pa'i nya ji lta ba bzhin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni chu de'i nang na gnas pa'i chu srin kum bi ra la sogs pa'i rigs de dag gi khar chud pa'i nya ji lta ba bzhin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Others say that they are like fish that have been caught in the jaws of a crocodile, etc. that lives in the water.

original: gzhan dag ni lcug ma las byas pa'i nang yangs shing spun la sogs pas bar tshag dam pa kha yod pa nya'i rigs 'dzin par byed cing 'ching ba ni tshed ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni lcug ma las byas pa'i nang yangs shing spun la sogs pas bar tshag dam pa kha yod pa nya'i rigs 'dzin par byed cing 'ching ba ni tshed ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that a fish trap is a large wicker cage with a narrow entrance, used to catch and hold fish.

original: ji ltar nya der 'dzin par byed pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa yang 'khor ba'i nang nas mi 'byung ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: ji ltar nya der 'dzin par byed pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa yang 'khor ba'i nang nas mi 'byung ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Just as a fish is caught in a trap, so those who are subject to the afflictions are caught in samsara, in the sense that they do not leave samsara.

original: der bcings pa la re zhig rgyun mi 'chad par bde ba khyad par can thob pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: der bcings pa la re zhig rgyun mi 'chad par bde ba khyad par can thob pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: But those who are caught there must experience a special kind of pleasure, at least for a while.🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / rga dang 'chi ba'i rjes su 'gro 'gyur te //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / rga dang 'chi ba'i rjes su 'gro 'gyur te // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: They follow old age and death.

original: rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they experience the suffering of old age and the suffering of death.

original: rga ba dang 'chi ba ni rga shi ste /
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi ba ni rga shi ste /
translated: Aging and death are old age and death.

original: zlas dbye ba gcig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: zlas dbye ba gcig tu byas pa'o //
translated: They are combined into one member.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni 'ong bar 'gyur ba dang thob par 'gyur ba de gang du rga ba dang 'chi ba yod pa der 'gro ba 'di dag 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni 'ong bar 'gyur ba dang thob par 'gyur ba de gang du rga ba dang 'chi ba yod pa der 'gro ba 'di dag 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The following is the one who goes to where there is old age and death, and the one who obtains it.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /🔽smras pa / ma drung nu zho 'dod pa'i be'u dang 'dra //
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na / smras pa / ma drung nu zho 'dod pa'i be'u dang 'dra //
translated: In what way?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said:🔽Like a calf desiring milk from its mother.

original: ba'i be'u nu zho 'thung ba 'o ma la sred pa de ni rtag tu ma'i rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: ba'i be'u nu zho 'thung ba 'o ma la sred pa de ni rtag tu ma'i rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: A calf that drinks milk and is attached to milk always follows its mother.

original: 'dis ni 'di'i thar pa ring du gnas pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di'i thar pa ring du gnas pa ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that liberation is far away for him.

original: sred pa dang ldan pa 'khor ba'i btson rar yongs su 'khyam pa dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba yin pas de spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: sred pa dang ldan pa 'khor ba'i btson rar yongs su 'khyam pa dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba yin pas de spang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: Since one who is attached to craving wanders in the prison of cyclic existence and experiences suffering, this is stated in order to abandon that.

original: 'dir rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong nas der gnas pa ni yang myong bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong nas der gnas pa ni yang myong bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, having experienced the suffering of old age, death, and so on, one who abides there does not experience it again.

original: mthong ba nyid du dug gis gnod pa bzhin no zhes mi bden par smra ba la de dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid du dug gis gnod pa bzhin no zhes mi bden par smra ba la de dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to refute such false speech, it is said:

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: A certain man, etc.

original: de nas bram ze zhig dgon pa'i gnas zhig tu lo bzhi bcur tshangs par spyod pa byas nas bu med pas ni gong mar 'gro ba med do zhes bsams te chung ma blang ba'i phyir mnyan yod du 'ongs te /
analyzed: de nas bram ze zhig dgon pa'i gnas zhig tu lo bzhi bcur tshangs par spyod pa byas nas bu med pas ni gong mar 'gro ba med do zhes bsams te chung ma blang ba'i phyir mnyan yod du 'ongs te /
translated: Then a certain Brahmin, in a certain forest abode, practiced pure conduct for forty years. Since he had no son, he thought, There is no going to the higher realms, and in order to take a wife, he came to Shravasti.

original: de la dgos pa'i nor bslangs pa las rgyal po gsal rgyal @109a * //
analyzed: de la dgos pa'i nor bslangs pa las rgyal po gsal rgyal @109a * //
translated: He asked King Prasenajit for wealth for his needs.

original: gyis khang pa brgya byin par khas blangs te /
analyzed: gyis khang pa brgya byin par khas blangs te /
translated: The king promised to give him a hundred houses.

original: gzhan du ma slongs shig ces smras so //
analyzed: gzhan du ma slongs shig ces smras so //
translated: He said, Do not ask elsewhere.

original: rgyal po chen po de ni stsal na gzhan yang khang pa brgya dang stong dang grong gi phyed nor dang bcas pa slong ngo zhes smras te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de ni stsal na gzhan yang khang pa brgya dang stong dang grong gi phyed nor dang bcas pa slong ngo zhes smras te /
translated: The Brahmin said, Great King, if that is given, I will ask for another hundred, a thousand houses, and half a town with wealth.

original: yang khas blangs so //
analyzed: yang khas blangs so //
translated: He promised again.

original: rgyal po chen po 'di yang stsal lags na /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'di yang stsal lags na /
translated: Great King, if this is also given,

original: gzhan yang bslang ngo zhes smra ba de dang de'i tshe rgyal byed kyi tshal dang nye ba na nags stug po na spre'u shing thog 'dod pa shing nas shing du rgyu ba las ltung ste shi bar gyur pa gzigs nas bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi tshe gtsug
analyzed: gzhan yang bslang ngo zhes smra ba de dang de'i tshe rgyal byed kyi tshal dang nye ba na nags stug po na spre'u shing thog 'dod pa shing nas shing du rgyu ba las ltung ste shi bar gyur pa gzigs nas bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi tshe gtsug
translated: Furthermore, when the Buddha said, “Rise up,” he saw that near Jetavana Grove in a thick forest a monkey who desired fruit fell from tree to tree and died.🔽

original: lag khang du gshegs te /
analyzed: lag khang du gshegs te /
translated: Moreover, when the Blessed One was asked, “Should one live in the forest?” he saw a monkey who desired fruit, moving from tree to tree in a dense forest near Jetavana, and he fell and died. At that time, the Blessed One went to the monastery and🔽he spoke this verse,

original: ji tsam na dus de'i gdul bya dag gi dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ji tsam na dus de'i gdul bya dag gi dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: in accordance with the disciples to be trained at that time.

original: ci rigs par sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba de'i skyon gang der bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs par sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba de'i skyon gang der bstan pa yin no //
translated: The fault of craving increases in accordance with the situation, and that is taught there.

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni mi ste de'i tshe nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni mi ste de'i tshe nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Person” means a human, because at that time he was present.

original: yang na sems can te de'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi rgyu nyid la 'jug gi / gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na sems can te de'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi rgyu nyid la 'jug gi / gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: Or it means a sentient being, because it is a synonym for that. It refers to the cause of a sentient being, not to anything else.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: smras pa / bag med rab tu spyod byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / bag med rab tu spyod byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: “One who acts carelessly.”

original: bag med par gyur nas rab tu spyod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bag med par gyur nas rab tu spyod par byed pa ste /
translated: One becomes heedless and indulges in the objects of the senses.

original: de'i dbang po ma bsrungs pas yul dag la spyod par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dbang po ma bsrungs pas yul dag la spyod par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not guard the sense faculties and indulges in the objects of the senses.

original: sred pa 'phel 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / yang srid pa'i sred pa yang 'phel bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sred pa 'phel 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / yang srid pa'i sred pa yang 'phel bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Craving increases means that craving for sense objects and craving for renewed existence increase.

original: yang dang yang shas cher spyad pa'i phyir dang / ngan par spyod pa lhag par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang shas cher spyad pa'i phyir dang / ngan par spyod pa lhag par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one indulges in them again and again and to a high degree, and because one indulges in bad conduct.

original: ji lta bur 'phel bar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ji lta bur 'phel bar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
translated: In what way do they increase?

original: 'khri shing bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'khri shing bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: like a creeper.

original: 'khri shing rigs ma lu ta zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: 'khri shing rigs ma lu ta zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: There is a creeper called mallika.

original: de ni shing la brten nas 'phel bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ni shing la brten nas 'phel bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: It increases in dependence on a tree.

original: ma brten par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma brten par ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not do so without a tree.

original: shing de nyid la yang gnod par byed do //
analyzed: shing de nyid la yang gnod par byed do //
translated: And it harms the tree itself.

original: de bzhin du sred pas bag med par spyod pa la brten nas 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sred pas bag med par spyod pa la brten nas 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, craving increases in dependence on heedless indulgence.

original: de nyid kyis gnod par yang byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis gnod par yang byed do //
translated: And it harms that very thing.

original: yang ji ltar yang gnod par byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar yang gnod par byed ce na /
translated: How does it harm?

original: smras pa / de yis 'khor bar 'khyam zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / de yis 'khor bar 'khyam zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: “One wanders in cyclic existence through that.”

original: sred pa 'phel ba de nyid kyis gang gi phyir 'khor bar 'khyam pa yin te /
analyzed: sred pa 'phel ba de nyid kyis gang gi phyir 'khor bar 'khyam pa yin te /
translated: One wanders in cyclic existence through the craving that is increased by that,

original: 'khor bar 'khor ba'i phyir shin tu gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'khor ba'i phyir shin tu gnod pa yin no //
translated: because one wanders in cyclic existence, it is a great harm.

original: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni so so so zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni so so so zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Again and again means “individually.”

original: de dang de 'gro ba sna tshogs pa dag tu rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rim pa las ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrubs pa @109b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang de 'gro ba sna tshogs pa dag tu rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rim pa las ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrubs pa @109b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In this and that realm, one is established in various ways through the various stages.

original: gzhan dag na re yang dang yang zhes bya ba'i don to zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re yang dang yang zhes bya ba'i don to zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: Others say that it means “again and again.”

original: de la 'dis ni 'di'i 'khor ba ring ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de la 'dis ni 'di'i 'khor ba ring ba nyid du ston to //
translated: Here, it shows that his cyclic existence is long.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni shing tog za bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni shing tog za bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: One who desires fruit is one who desires to eat fruit.

original: ji ltar spre'u nags na zhes bya ba shing stug po'i nang du spre'u ltogs pa 'bras bu 'dod pas rgyun mi 'chad par yang dang yang kun du 'khyam pa de bzhin du bag med pa rab tu spyod par byed pa yang sred pa 'phel bas 'khor bar 'khyam🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar spre'u nags na zhes bya ba shing stug po'i nang du spre'u ltogs pa 'bras bu 'dod pas rgyun mi 'chad par yang dang yang kun du 'khyam pa de bzhin du bag med pa rab tu spyod par byed pa yang sred pa 'phel bas 'khor bar 'khyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, one who practices heedlessness wanders in cyclic existence because of the increase of craving.

original: thar pa 'dod pas bag med pa rnams bag yod pa la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pas bag med pa rnams bag yod pa la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to lead those who are heedless to heedfulness, desiring liberation.

original: sred par byas pa nyid kyis phyir zhing yang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sred par byas pa nyid kyis phyir zhing yang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the affliction of rebirth again through the very craving, he said:

original: mi dag dran par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dag dran par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: People are made to remember.

original: yul kun du na rgyal po ko ra bya ri dags bshor ba'i tshal na tshe dang ldan pa yul 'khor skyong gnas te /
analyzed: yul kun du na rgyal po ko ra bya ri dags bshor ba'i tshal na tshe dang ldan pa yul 'khor skyong gnas te /
