analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang dang yang sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: The truth of suffering is taught by the statement, “again and again one obtains suffering.”

original: / sred pa rnams kyis mdun du bdar ba ni mngon par brdas pa dang zil gyis non pa'o //
analyzed: / sred pa rnams kyis mdun du bdar ba ni mngon par brdas pa dang zil gyis non pa'o //
translated: “Driven forward by craving” means being impelled and overwhelmed.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / skye dgu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / skye dgu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “the world of beings.”

original: sred pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang bcas pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
analyzed: sred pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang bcas pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the world of sentient beings together with various types of craving.

original: so so'i skye bo ni gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der sred pa rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der sred pa rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: Ordinary beings, wherever they are born, are born with craving following after them.

original: des bskul nas sdug bsngal rjes su myong ngo //
analyzed: des bskul nas sdug bsngal rjes su myong ngo //
translated: and, urged on by that, he experiences suffering.

original: yongs su rgyug pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas yongs su 'khor ba yin te /🔽'gro ba thams cad skye ba thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir 'dir dpe bstan pa /
analyzed: yongs su rgyug pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas yongs su 'khor ba yin te / 'gro ba thams cad skye ba thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir 'dir dpe bstan pa /
translated: “Wandering about” means that he is completely surrounded.

original: ri bong bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ri bong bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to illustrate this, he says, “like a hare in a trap.”

original: 'di gang la yongs su rgyug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang la yongs su rgyug pa yin zhe na /
translated: In what does he wander about?

original: @111b rgya gang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @111b rgya gang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “in the world.”

original: ri dags rnams yongs su gzung ba'i dra ba ste rgya'o //
analyzed: ri dags rnams yongs su gzung ba'i dra ba ste rgya'o //
translated: The world is a snare for animals.

original: ji ltar ri bong bde ba la sred pas 'ong ba dang 'bros par byed na yang rgya de nyid du 'jug par byed pa de bzhin du skye dgu bde ba la sred pas sdug bsngal nyid la yongs su rgyug pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ri bong bde ba la sred pas 'ong ba dang 'bros par byed na yang rgya de nyid du 'jug par byed pa de bzhin du skye dgu bde ba la sred pas sdug bsngal nyid la yongs su rgyug pa yin no //
translated: Just as a hare, out of craving for pleasure, comes and goes, but is caught in the snare, so living beings, out of craving for pleasure, wander about in suffering.

original: de nyid du yongs su rgyug pas rgyu gang gis ci zhig thob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid du yongs su rgyug pas rgyu gang gis ci zhig thob pa yin zhe na /
translated: By wandering about in this way, what does he obtain?

original: smras pa / kun sbyor zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / kun sbyor zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “he obtains the fetters.”

original: sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba la brten pa'i ro ni kun sbyor ro'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba la brten pa'i ro ni kun sbyor ro'o //
translated: The craving that is based on the fetter of taste is the fetter of taste.

original: 'dir ro yang bde ba nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ro yang bde ba nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, taste should be understood as pleasure.

original: ji skad bshad pa 'dod pa'i ro yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa 'dod pa'i ro yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the taste of the desire realm that has been explained?

original: gang 'dod pa'i yon tan la brten nas skyes pa'i yid bde ba'i bde ba 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i yon tan la brten nas skyes pa'i yid bde ba'i bde ba 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is the pleasure that arises based on the sense objects of the desire realm.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the pleasure of the afflictions.

original: de la dga' zhing lhag par zhen pa ni sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba la brten nas bde ba myong zhing rjes su 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dga' zhing lhag par zhen pa ni sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba la brten nas bde ba myong zhing rjes su 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who delights in that and is attached to it, based on the fetter of craving, experiences pleasure and is bound to it.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: smras pa / byis pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / byis pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: the childish.

original: khyad par du 'dun pa'i rgyu 'dis byas pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'dun pa'i rgyu 'dis byas pa ste /
translated: This is done by the cause of special longing.

original: mi shes pa dag dug dang 'dres pa'i kha zas la dga' ba bzhin du gang gi phyir de dang de'i nyes dmigs ma mthong ba'i rmongs pa de yang kun sbyor ro la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa dag dug dang 'dres pa'i kha zas la dga' ba bzhin du gang gi phyir de dang de'i nyes dmigs ma mthong ba'i rmongs pa de yang kun sbyor ro la dga' ba'o //
translated: The ignorant delight in food mixed with poison. Because of that, the delusion of not seeing the danger of that is also the delight in the fetter.

original: des na yang ngan par spyod pa rnam pa mang po byas nas yang dang yang du sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: des na yang ngan par spyod pa rnam pa mang po byas nas yang dang yang du sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, having again and again engaged in many kinds of evil conduct, one will again and again experience suffering.

original: lan du mar ngan song ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal lam bsad pa dang bcing ba dang brdung ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: lan du mar ngan song ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal lam bsad pa dang bcing ba dang brdung ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of the lower realms, the suffering of being killed, bound, beaten, and so on, is experienced many times.

original: ngan par spyod pas bkag na ni mi 'dod pa ma lus pa 'byung ba mi 'thob cing mi rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: ngan par spyod pas bkag na ni mi 'dod pa ma lus pa 'byung ba mi 'thob cing mi rnyed pa yin no //
translated: If one is restrained from evil conduct, one will not obtain or experience any misfortune.

original: de la 'di ni sred pa mang zhing 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i gdul bya dag la 'khor bas skyo bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs so //🔽sred pa'i dbang gis sems can 'di dag dga' ba dang 'chi ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de la 'di ni sred pa mang zhing 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i gdul bya dag la 'khor bas skyo bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs so // sred pa'i dbang gis sems can 'di dag dga' ba dang 'chi ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: This was taught for the sake of those disciples who have much craving and delight in cyclic existence, in order to make them weary of cyclic existence.🔽In order to demonstrate that these sentient beings follow after craving and death, it is said:

original: sred pa rnams kyis mdud pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sred pa rnams kyis mdud pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “By the power of craving, these sentient beings follow after craving and death.”

original: sred pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sred pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Craving is of three kinds:

original: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa dang ; srid pa med pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa dang ; srid pa med pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: craving for desire, craving for existence, and craving for non-existence.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, these two verses are stated.

original: gzhan dag na re gang su dag sdig pa rnam pa du ma dang mi dge ba'i chos yang dag par 'byung ba de thams cad ni sred pa'i kun du sbyor bas yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang su dag sdig pa rnam pa du ma dang mi dge ba'i chos yang dag par 'byung ba de thams cad ni sred pa'i kun du sbyor bas yin te /
translated: Others say that whatever is the arising of many kinds of evil and non-virtuous dharmas is all due to the fetter of craving.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mdor bsdu ba'i phyir sred @112a * //
analyzed: mdor bsdu ba'i phyir sred @112a * //
translated: in order to summarize,

original: pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni de rnams kyi nang nas mchog tu bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni de rnams kyi nang nas mchog tu bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: the fetter of craving is explained as the best of them.

original: dper na gang la la zhig gis glang sna phug nas khal bkal na des khal thams cad 'degs shing khal gnas pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dper na gang la la zhig gis glang sna phug nas khal bkal na des khal thams cad 'degs shing khal gnas pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: For example, if someone pierces an elephant's trunk and loads a burden on it, that burden carries all the loads and is the place where the loads are kept.

original: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni tshig rkang dang pos ni sred pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni tshig rkang dang pos ni sred pa bstan to //
translated: Here, the summarized meaning is as follows: By the first line, craving is taught.

original: tshig rkang gnyis pas ni sred pa'i las bstan to //
analyzed: tshig rkang gnyis pas ni sred pa'i las bstan to //
translated: By the second line, the action of craving is taught.

original: lhag mas ni de'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: lhag mas ni de'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: The rest of the verse shows the disadvantage of that.

original: de la sred pa rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag la sred pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de la sred pa rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag la sred pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad do //
translated: Therein, the craving is for the self, and that which is connected with that is all the defilements.

original: mdud pa zhes bya ba ni bcing zhing gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: mdud pa zhes bya ba ni bcing zhing gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The fetter is the bondage and the subjection to another.

original: 'jig rten 'di na sred pas 'khol ba'o zhes mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na sred pas 'khol ba'o zhes mdo las gsungs so //
translated: It is said in the sutra: “In this world, one is boiled by craving.”

original: gzhan dag na re 'dod pa'i sred pas mdud pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dod pa'i sred pas mdud pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: “The fetter is the craving for sense-pleasures.”

original: srid dang srid min dag la sems chags shing //
analyzed: srid dang srid min dag la sems chags shing //
translated: The mind is attached to existence and non-existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i sems gang la yod pa de ni sems chags pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i sems gang la yod pa de ni sems chags pas so //
translated: The mind that has attachment is the mind attached.

original: srid pa dang srid pa ma yin pa ni srid dang srid min no //
analyzed: srid pa dang srid pa ma yin pa ni srid dang srid min no //
translated: Existence and non-existence are existence and non-existence.

original: gang bdag la sred pa de la brten nas rtag par lta ba de ni srid pa la chags pa'i sems te mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gang bdag la sred pa de la brten nas rtag par lta ba de ni srid pa la chags pa'i sems te mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The view of permanence that is based on the craving for the self is the mind attached to existence, which is delight.

original: gang la yang chad par lta ba de ni srid pa med pa la sems chags shing mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gang la yang chad par lta ba de ni srid pa med pa la sems chags shing mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The view of annihilation is the mind's attachment to and delight in the nonexistence of existence.

original: 'dir srid pa'i sgra ni khams gsum la brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir srid pa'i sgra ni khams gsum la brjod de /
translated: Here, the term existence refers to the three realms.

original: 'dir srid pa gsum yang 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o zhes mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir srid pa gsum yang 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o zhes mdo las gsungs so //
translated: The three kinds of existence are the existence of the desire realm, the existence of the form realm, and the existence of the formless realm.

original: 'dir sred pa ma yin pa'i sgra ni sred pa med pa la brjod de /🔽khams gsum gyi ris mthun pa mi rtag pa'am med pa de la dmigs pa'i sred pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir sred pa ma yin pa'i sgra ni sred pa med pa la brjod de / khams gsum gyi ris mthun pa mi rtag pa'am med pa de la dmigs pa'i sred pa ste /
translated: The term nonexistence refers to the absence of craving.

original: sred pa med pa la dgongs so //
analyzed: sred pa med pa la dgongs so //
translated: Craving is the observation of the impermanence or nonexistence of the continuity of the three realms.🔽The Buddha had this in mind when he spoke of nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di la gcig tu sdug bsngal la sogs pa de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes smra ste /
analyzed: 'di la gcig tu sdug bsngal la sogs pa de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes smra ste /
translated: One who speaks in this way will be reborn in the realm of ultimate suffering.

original: kye ma'o bdag ni chad par 'gyur ba ste zhig nas pha rol tu skye ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba yin no //
analyzed: kye ma'o bdag ni chad par 'gyur ba ste zhig nas pha rol tu skye ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba yin no //
translated: Alas! I will be annihilated! After my destruction, I will not be reborn in the next life and so on.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa la skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa la skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the error in this?

original: smras pa / bdud kyi sbyor ba de zhes smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / bdud kyi sbyor ba de zhes smos te /
translated: He said: “That is the bond of Mara.

original: sred pas mdud pa rnams sred pa gsum dang srid pa ma yin pa dag la sems chags pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan te /
analyzed: sred pas mdud pa rnams sred pa gsum dang srid pa ma yin pa dag la sems chags pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan te /
translated: The danger of those who are attached to the three cravings and to non-existence is shown.

original: 'dis sbyor bar byed pas sbyor ba ste 'ching ba'o //🔽de dang ldan pa ni 'ching ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis sbyor bar byed pas sbyor ba ste 'ching ba'o // de dang ldan pa ni 'ching ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is a bond because it binds one to the three realms.🔽One who is endowed with that is said to be “endowed with the bond of Mara.”

original: bdud kyi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa @112b ste bdud kyi 'ching bas bcings pa ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa @112b ste bdud kyi 'ching bas bcings pa ste /
translated: Mara is the defilements. One is bound by the bond of Mara.

original: de thos na de las rgyal bar bya ba'i las la gzhan gyi dbang du byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de thos na de las rgyal bar bya ba'i las la gzhan gyi dbang du byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one hears this, one is made to be dependent on the activity of conquering that.

original: bdud kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa dang / 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa dang / 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that those who are endowed with the bond of Mara are accompanied by suffering and fear, he said:

original: grub dang bde rnams dang bral zhing //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub dang bde rnams dang bral zhing // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “They are deprived of success and happiness.

original: grub pa ni bde ba dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni bde ba dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: Success is connected with happiness.

original: bde ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Happiness is the absence of fear.

original: grub pa dang bde ba med pa ni grub pa dang bde ba dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba med pa ni grub pa dang bde ba dang bral ba ste /
translated: The absence of establishment and happiness is the absence of establishment and happiness.

original: bral ba yod pa de nyid ni de ste /
analyzed: bral ba yod pa de nyid ni de ste /
translated: The existence of that absence is just that.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang 'jigs pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang 'jigs pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the existence of suffering and fear.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa /
translated: He himself says:

original: gang gi phyir de rga ba dang 'chi ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rga ba dang 'chi ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of aging and death.

original: rga bas ni sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / 'chi bas ni 'jigs pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rga bas ni sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / 'chi bas ni 'jigs pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Aging indicates suffering and death indicates fear.

original: rjes su 'gro 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thob par 'gyur ba dang rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thob par 'gyur ba dang rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: It is said that they follow, i.e., are obtained and accompany,

original: gang gis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: by whom and how?

original: ma drung nu zho 'dod pa'i be'u dang 'dra //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma drung nu zho 'dod pa'i be'u dang 'dra //🔽zhes bya ste /
translated: Like a calf desiring its mother’s milk.

original: ji ltar nu zho 'thung ba'i be'u 'o ma la sred pas 'gro ba dang / de ltar rtag tu rjes su 'brang ba de bzhin du sred pa'i 'dun pa yod na ni rga ba dang 'chi ba dang rjes su mthun par 'jug par 'gyur zhing rga ba dang 'chi ba nyid kyi rjes su 'gro'i /
analyzed: ji ltar nu zho 'thung ba'i be'u 'o ma la sred pas 'gro ba dang / de ltar rtag tu rjes su 'brang ba de bzhin du sred pa'i 'dun pa yod na ni rga ba dang 'chi ba dang rjes su mthun par 'jug par 'gyur zhing rga ba dang 'chi ba nyid kyi rjes su 'gro'i /
translated: Just as a calf follows its mother cow out of craving for milk, and in the same way always follows after it, so too, if there is a will to craving, one enters into conformity with old age and death, and follows after old age and death alone,

original: mya ngan las 'das par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par ni ma yin no //
translated: not nirvana.

original: sred pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pas de spangs pa la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: sred pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pas de spangs pa la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was stated in order to introduce the abandonment of craving by teaching its faults.

original: sred pa spangs pa las mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sred pa spangs pa las mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that nirvana is from the abandonment of craving, he said:

original: 'di ni sred pa de 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ni sred pa de 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “This is the kind of craving” and so on.

original: sred pa rnam pa gsum po de bkag cing gtan du spangs pa dang / de spangs pa'i phan yon rab tu bstan pa ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: sred pa rnam pa gsum po de bkag cing gtan du spangs pa dang / de spangs pa'i phan yon rab tu bstan pa ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The summary of the meaning is the refutation of the three kinds of craving, the complete abandonment of them, and the teaching of the benefits of their abandonment.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i bdag la sred pa'am 'dod pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i bdag la sred pa'am 'dod pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the craving for a self that was previously taught, or the craving for desire.

original: 'dra zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi don te /
analyzed: 'dra zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi don te /
translated: “Like” has the meaning of a distinction.

original: gang de la rjes su 'brang ba ni 'khor ba nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin la gang yang de spang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba yin no zhes khyad par du byed do//
analyzed: gang de la rjes su 'brang ba ni 'khor ba nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin la gang yang de spang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba yin no zhes khyad par du byed do//
translated: It makes a distinction in that one who follows that is one who follows cyclic existence, and one who abandons that is one who goes to the city of nirvana.

original: spong byed pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen pos de thob pa rgyud las bstsal pa'o //
analyzed: spong byed pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen pos de thob pa rgyud las bstsal pa'o //
translated: “Abandoning” means that by means of a concordant antidote, one removes that from the continuum and attains it.

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni bstan pa 'di la ste /
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni bstan pa 'di la ste /
translated: “Here” refers to this teaching,

original: gzhan dag tu ni de spong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni de spong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in other places there is no abandoning of that.

original: de spangs na ni de'i las med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de spangs na ni de'i las med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that when that is abandoned, its action does not exist, it is said:

original: srid dang srid min dag la sred bral zhing //🔽zhes @113a * //🔽bya ba smos te /
analyzed: srid dang srid min dag la sred bral zhing // zhes @113a * // bya ba smos te /
translated: Free from craving existence and nonexistence,

original: bral ba ni mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba ni mi ldan pa'o //
translated: “Free” means not possessing.

original: sred pa la mngon par dga' ba'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni de ste /
analyzed: sred pa la mngon par dga' ba'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni de ste /
translated: That which has the nature of delighting in craving is that.

original: gang la sred pa spangs par gyur pa la ni srid pa dang srid pa med pa la dmigs pa'i mngon par dga' ba med ces bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: gang la sred pa spangs par gyur pa la ni srid pa dang srid pa med pa la dmigs pa'i mngon par dga' ba med ces bya ba'i don to /
translated: That which has abandoned craving does not have the delight in the focus of existence and non-existence. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir gang gis sred pa spangs par byas pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir gang gis sred pa spangs par byas pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Here, in order to teach the benefit of abandoning craving, it is said:

original: sred pa zil gyis gnon byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sred pa zil gyis gnon byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That which overcomes craving and so on.

original: sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba thob par gtan du drungs phyung zhing bcad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba thob par gtan du drungs phyung zhing bcad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the fetter of craving is completely uprooted and severed.

original: bkag pa tsam gyis spang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bkag pa tsam gyis spang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not merely suppressed,

original: gtan du bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gtan du bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: but becomes completely separated.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Bhikṣu means because all afflictions are destroyed.

original: lhag ma med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Without remainder means

original: gang la grib ma yod pa ma yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la grib ma yod pa ma yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa ste /
translated: that which has no shadow is without remainder.

original: tshor ba po nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba po nyams pa yin no //
translated: The experiencer is destroyed.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i shing la grib ma lta bu ni tshor ba yin no zhes kun dga' bo'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i shing la grib ma lta bu ni tshor ba yin no zhes kun dga' bo'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
translated: Feeling is like the shade of the tree of consciousness.

original: des na gang gis sred pa phyogs gcig spangs pas ni de'i yan lag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa lhag ma dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: des na gang gis sred pa phyogs gcig spangs pas ni de'i yan lag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa lhag ma dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Thus, one who has abandoned one part of craving has attained nirvana with a remainder of support,

original: tshor ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i shing yongs su ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i shing yongs su ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the tree of consciousness with its feeling has not been cut down.

original: gang gis sred pa thams cad spangs pas ni yan lag thams cad kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis sred pa thams cad spangs pas ni yan lag thams cad kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: One who has abandoned all craving has attained nirvana without a remainder of support,

original: de ni lhag ma med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes brjod de tshor ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i shing nyid bkag cing gzhan yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lhag ma med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes brjod de tshor ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i shing nyid bkag cing gzhan yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the tree of consciousness with its feeling has been cut down and nothing else has arisen.

original: sred pa spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: sred pa spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This verse is stated to show the benefit of abandoning craving.

original: sred pa ma spangs pa dang sred pa spangs pa'i nyes dmigs dang phan yon go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sred pa ma spangs pa dang sred pa spangs pa'i nyes dmigs dang phan yon go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the disadvantages of not abandoning craving and the benefits of abandoning craving, he said:

original: gang zhig 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum smos so //
translated: The three verses beginning with “Whoever in the world” were spoken.

original: kha cig ni nye ser skya'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni nye ser skya'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say this was spoken with reference to Udraka.

original: gzhan dag na re bcom ldan 'das dgon pa na nyan thos kyi tshogs dang dbyar gyi dus su lhan cig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bcom ldan 'das dgon pa na nyan thos kyi tshogs dang dbyar gyi dus su lhan cig tu bzhugs so //
translated: Others say: The Blessed One, in the wilderness, dwelt together with the assembly of śrāvakas during the rainy season.

original: ji tsam na bi ran zhes bya ba'i rtsva'i rigs 'phel zhing rgyas pa gzigs te /
analyzed: ji tsam na bi ran zhes bya ba'i rtsva'i rigs 'phel zhing rgyas pa gzigs te /
translated: Then he saw a type of grass called virana spreading and growing.

original: dge slong sred pa shas che ba dag gi don du 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong sred pa shas che ba dag gi don du 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was spoken for the sake of the monks with excessive craving.

original: dge slong dag sred pa ni dra ba dang yul la sred pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag sred pa ni dra ba dang yul la sred pa yin te /
translated: Monks, craving is a net and craving for objects.

original: 'khor ba'i 'ching ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes @113b zer ro ;
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'ching ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes @113b zer ro ;
translated: It is the fetter of saṃsāra.

original: /'di la bsdus pa'i don yang 'dod pa'i sred pa'i skyon mthong ba'i chos 'di nyid la rnam pa bzhi yod de zhes bstan te /
analyzed: /'di la bsdus pa'i don yang 'dod pa'i sred pa'i skyon mthong ba'i chos 'di nyid la rnam pa bzhi yod de zhes bstan te /
translated: The concise meaning is as follows: The faults of craving for sensual pleasures are fourfold in this very life.

original: shin tu zil gyis gnon pa dang / dmigs pa dman pa dang / las la mngon par dga' ba dang / zil gyis gnon par dka' zhing mya ngan 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu zil gyis gnon pa dang / dmigs pa dman pa dang / las la mngon par dga' ba dang / zil gyis gnon par dka' zhing mya ngan 'phel ba'o //
translated: They are: being completely overwhelmed, having inferior objects, delighting in evil actions, and being difficult to overcome, with increasing suffering.

original: de'i phyir dang por 'dod pa'i sred pa la lhag par btang snyoms kyi sems su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por 'dod pa'i sred pa la lhag par btang snyoms kyi sems su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, first, there is a mind of indifference towards craving for sensual pleasures.

original: de nas dmigs pa dman pa dang sdig pa'i las la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dmigs pa dman pa dang sdig pa'i las la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, there is delight in inferior objects and evil actions.

original: de nas ngan par spyod pas srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas ngan par spyod pas srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, there is existence due to bad conduct.

original: de nas 'dod pa'i dngos po yongs su 'gyur bas mya ngan shas cher 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa'i dngos po yongs su 'gyur bas mya ngan shas cher 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, there is a great increase in suffering due to the transformation of sensual objects.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni sems can no //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni sems can no //
translated: One refers to sentient beings.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sred pas so //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sred pas so //
translated: By this refers to craving for sensual pleasures.

original: khol ba zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan pa'o //
analyzed: khol ba zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan pa'o //
translated: Boiling means being overwhelmed.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: smras pa / bud med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / bud med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that the term “woman” is used.🔽

original: dman pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / ngan par spyod pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang 'dod pa'i bde ba rjes su spyod pa ni dman pa nyid tha mal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: dman pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / ngan par spyod pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang 'dod pa'i bde ba rjes su spyod pa ni dman pa nyid tha mal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
translated: He said: “The so-called woman is a thing of low quality, because she is the object of a low quality mind, because she generates bad conduct, and because she is the object of enjoyment of the pleasure of sex.

original: sred pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba don du gnyer ba'i las bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba don du gnyer ba'i las bskyed pa'o //
translated: “ Craving” is the generation of the action of seeking out cyclic existence.

original: 'jig rten spang dka' zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa'i 'jig rten te /
analyzed: 'jig rten spang dka' zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa'i 'jig rten te /
translated: “ The world is hard to abandon” means the world of the tīrthikas.

original: 'di la dka' bas spang zhing dor bas yod pa de ni spang bar dka' ba'am /
analyzed: 'di la dka' bas spang zhing dor bas yod pa de ni spang bar dka' ba'am /
translated: It is hard to abandon and discard, so it is “hard to abandon.”

original: 'da' bar dka' ba'am /
analyzed: 'da' bar dka' ba'am /
translated: Or, it is hard to transcend,

original: dor bar dka' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dor bar dka' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or hard to discard. This is the meaning.

original: bdag med pa'i 'du shes de ni de'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i 'du shes de ni de'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: The perception of selflessness is its antidote,

original: phyi rol bas mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol bas mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not conceive of an external self.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la ni 'di spang bar dka' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la ni 'di spang bar dka' ba ma yin te /
translated: In the teaching of the Buddha, it is not hard to abandon.

original: phyin ci ma log pas de'i gnyen po dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pas de'i gnyen po dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is non-erroneous, it is the antidote to that.

original: / de yi mya ngan 'phel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: / de yi mya ngan 'phel bar 'gyur //
translated: His sorrow increases.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po gang la 'dod pa'i sred pas zil gyis gnon pa ni dngos po de med cing rnam par 'gyur ba las lhag par zhen pa'i skyes bu'i mya ngan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po gang la 'dod pa'i sred pas zil gyis gnon pa ni dngos po de med cing rnam par 'gyur ba las lhag par zhen pa'i skyes bu'i mya ngan te /
translated: Because of that, the sorrow of a person who is overcome by craving for an object, which is greater than the non-existence and transformation of that object,

original: yid kyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi gdung ba'o //
translated: is mental anguish.

original: 'phel bar 'gyur ba ni stsogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'phel bar 'gyur ba ni stsogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Increases” means “accumulates.”

original: ji srid du gang la sred pa'i dngos po yod pa de ni gang dag rnam par 'gyur ba de srid du mya ngan 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji srid du gang la sred pa'i dngos po yod pa de ni gang dag rnam par 'gyur ba de srid du mya ngan 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: As long as the object of craving exists, the sorrow of those who have it will increase as long as there is transformation.

original: 'dir dpe bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dir dpe bstan pa /
translated: Here, an example is taught:

original: rtsva la char pa bab pa bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtsva la char pa bab pa bzhin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Like rain on grass.

original: char bab pa ni brlan pa dang / chus blug pa'o //
analyzed: char bab pa ni brlan pa dang / chus blug pa'o //
translated: Rain is moisture and water.

original: 'dir rtsva ni bi ra na zhes bya ba'i rtsva'i rigs yod de /
analyzed: 'dir rtsva ni bi ra na zhes bya ba'i rtsva'i rigs yod de /
translated: Here, grass is a type of grass called virana,

original: gang gi rtsa ba @114a * //
analyzed: gang gi rtsa ba @114a * //
translated: whose root

original: au shir yin pa'o //
analyzed: au shir yin pa'o //
translated: is uśira.

original: dper na bi ra na zhes bya ba'i rtsva la ji ltar char bab cing brlan pa de lta de ltar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na bi ra na zhes bya ba'i rtsva la ji ltar char bab cing brlan pa de lta de ltar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, just as the grass called virana grows more and more when it is cut,

original: de bzhin du ji lta ji ltar rang gi sems kyi rgyud la brten pa'i mya ngan gyi sa bon sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar mya ngan 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji lta ji ltar rang gi sems kyi rgyud la brten pa'i mya ngan gyi sa bon sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar mya ngan 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: just so, the more the seed of sorrow in one's mental continuum, craving, grows, the more sorrow grows.

original: sred pa'i skyon bstan pas de spang ba la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: sred pa'i skyon bstan pas de spang ba la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was said in order to introduce the abandonment of craving by teaching its faults.

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the benefit of the bright side, he said:

original: gang zhig 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Whoever, having seen a woman...

original: gang gis yang yang sred pa 'dis 'khol ba de zil gyis mnan pa dang spangs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis yang yang sred pa 'dis 'khol ba de zil gyis mnan pa dang spangs pa ste /
translated: He who is repeatedly tormented by this craving is overcome and abandons it.

original: bud med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i don to ;
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i don to ;
translated: The meaning of the words woman and so on is as before.

original: / de yi mya ngan ldog 'gyur te //
analyzed: / de yi mya ngan ldog 'gyur te //
translated: His sorrow will be stopped.

original: zhes bya ba ni srid pa spangs pa'i gang zag de'i ste sems kyi gdung ba thams cad sel ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srid pa spangs pa'i gang zag de'i ste sems kyi gdung ba thams cad sel ba yin no //
translated: This is the person who has abandoned existence, and all the torments of his mind are removed.

original: gang la ji lta bu zhe na /🔽smras pa / pad ma la ni chu yi thigs pa bzhin //
analyzed: gang la ji lta bu zhe na / smras pa / pad ma la ni chu yi thigs pa bzhin //
translated: To whom, and what kind of person?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said:🔽Like a drop of water on a lotus leaf.

original: pad ma zhes bya ba ni pu ka ra ste /
analyzed: pad ma zhes bya ba ni pu ka ra ste /
translated: Lotus is puṇḍarīka.

original: ji ltar pad ma'i 'dab ma la chu'i thigs pa byung ba ni ldog cing de de'i nang du 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar pad ma'i 'dab ma la chu'i thigs pa byung ba ni ldog cing de de'i nang du 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a drop of water on a lotus leaf turns back and does not enter into it,

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i sred pa spangs pa yang sdug pa rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i mya ngan sems la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i sred pa spangs pa yang sdug pa rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i mya ngan sems la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, when craving for sensual pleasures is abandoned, grief arising from the transformation of the pleasant does not enter the mind.

original: 'dod pa'i sems spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sems spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is said to show the benefit of abandoning the mind of sensual desire.

original: gang gi phyir sred pa 'phel ba las ni phung khrol 'byung ba yin pas de spang pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sred pa 'phel ba las ni phung khrol 'byung ba yin pas de spang pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Because calamity arises from the increase of craving, this is said to show the benefit of abandoning it.

original: de phyir ji snyed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de phyir ji snyed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, as much as...

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis snod du gyur pa la bstan pa dang / phyogs su ma lhung bas bstan pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phan yon bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis snod du gyur pa la bstan pa dang / phyogs su ma lhung bas bstan pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phan yon bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here the Lord teaches the vessel, teaches the non-partisan, teaches the correct practice, and teaches the benefit of the correct practice.

original: de'i phyir khyed la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni snod du gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni snod du gyur pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, “to you” and so on teaches the vessel.

original: de'i phyir ji snyed ces bya ba la sogs pas de'i phyir phan pa'i bsam pas bstan pa'o //🔽au shir phyir ni zhes pa dang / sred pa rtsar bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji snyed ces bya ba la sogs pas de'i phyir phan pa'i bsam pas bstan pa'o // au shir phyir ni zhes pa dang / sred pa rtsar bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, “as many” and so on teaches the non-partisan.🔽“In order to” and “with the root of craving” and so on teaches the correct practice.

original: sred pa drungs nas phyung shig dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i phan yon bstan to zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: sred pa drungs nas phyung shig dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i phan yon bstan to zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: “Pull out craving by the root” and so on teaches the benefit of the correct practice. This is the condensed meaning.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bas na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bas na ste /
translated: “Therefore” means “for that reason.”

original: gang gi phyir sred pa la ni rjes su 'jug pa ni ma dag pa yin par snang la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sred pa la ni rjes su 'jug pa ni ma dag pa yin par snang la /
translated: Because the engagement with craving appears to be impure,

original: de spangs pa ni phan yon yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de spangs pa ni phan yon yod pa nyid de /
translated: Abandoning that is the benefit.

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis de spangs pa la 'bad par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis de spangs pa la 'bad par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, you should strive to abandon that.

original: brgya la de la @114b bdag cag skal ba dang mi ldan pa yin no zhe na /🔽smras pa / khyod la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brgya la de la @114b bdag cag skal ba dang mi ldan pa yin no zhe na / smras pa / khyod la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you say, “We are unfortunate in that regard,”🔽it is said:

original: khyed cag la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyed cag la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “I say to you” means “to you.”

original: smra yis zhes bya ba ni bshad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smra yis zhes bya ba ni bshad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “I say” means “I explain.”

original: ci zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ci zhe na smras pa /
translated: What? It is said:

original: khyed bde shog ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyed bde shog ces bya ba smos te /
translated: “May you be happy.”

original: khyed cag phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: khyed cag phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: May you be endowed with excellence.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: khyed cag snod du gyur pa yin pas des na ngas khyed la smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: khyed cag snod du gyur pa yin pas des na ngas khyed la smra bar bya ste /
translated: Since you are a vessel, I will speak to you.

original: 'di ni bde ba yin te tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag nye bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba yin te tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag nye bar gnas pa ste /
translated: This is happiness: you, the venerable ones, are present.

original: 'di lta ste ston pa yang mngon sum du gyur la khyed cag kyang sred pa gnyen pos spong nus pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ston pa yang mngon sum du gyur la khyed cag kyang sred pa gnyen pos spong nus pa yin pas so //
translated: This is because the Teacher is manifest and you are able to abandon craving through the antidote.

original: de lta bu gang yin zhe na /🔽smras pa / ji snyed bya ba ni tshad ji tsam pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu gang yin zhe na / smras pa / ji snyed bya ba ni tshad ji tsam pa ste /
translated: What is that?🔽It is said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang khyed cag nyid do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang khyed cag nyid do //
translated: The extent of what is to be done is the extent of the life of the one who does it.🔽Venerable ones, you are the ones who have come here.

original: 'dir lhags pa zhes bya ba ni khyed cag nye bar gnas shing gan du phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir lhags pa zhes bya ba ni khyed cag nye bar gnas shing gan du phyin pa ste /
translated: Those who have come here are those who are present and have approached you.

original: khyed cag thams cad do //
analyzed: khyed cag thams cad do //
translated: You are all of them.

original: gang yin zhe na /🔽smras pa / sred pa ste 'khor ba la 'dod chags pa'am /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na / smras pa / sred pa ste 'khor ba la 'dod chags pa'am /
translated: What are they?🔽It is said:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Craving is attachment to samsara or attachment to desire.

original: rtsar bcas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rtsar bcas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa ste /
translated: With its root is with its cause.

original: ma rig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: together with ignorance.

original: gang gi phyir sred pa'i rtsa ba ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sred pa'i rtsa ba ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: Because the root of craving is ignorance.

original: gzhan dag na re tshor ba yin te tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshor ba yin te tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
translated: Others say it is feeling, because of the words of the sutra: “Craving has feeling as its condition.”

original: rtsa ba dang lhan cig pa yin pas rtsar bcas so //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang lhan cig pa yin pas rtsar bcas so //
translated: Because it is together with the root, it has its root.

original: bi ra na'i rtsa ba ni au shi ra ste de las skyes pa'i rtsva'i rigs so //
analyzed: bi ra na'i rtsa ba ni au shi ra ste de las skyes pa'i rtsva'i rigs so //
translated: The root of vira is ushira, which is a type of grass that grows from that.

original: au shi ra don du gnyer ba ni au shi ra'i phyir te /
analyzed: au shi ra don du gnyer ba ni au shi ra'i phyir te /
translated: One who seeks the end of craving is one who seeks the end of craving.

original: de dgos pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dgos pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is necessary.

original: gang au shi ra 'dod pa de ni rtsva bi ra na rtsa ba dang bcas pa gzhor la sogs pas drungs nas 'byin pa de bzhin du ma rig pa dang bcas par sred pa drungs nas phyung na nya ser skya bzhin du nyams pa thob par mi 'gyur
analyzed: gang au shi ra 'dod pa de ni rtsva bi ra na rtsa ba dang bcas pa gzhor la sogs pas drungs nas 'byin pa de bzhin du ma rig pa dang bcas par sred pa drungs nas phyung na nya ser skya bzhin du nyams pa thob par mi 'gyur
translated: Just as one who seeks the end of craving digs up the roots of the virana plant along with the root-base and so on, in the same way, when craving is dug up along with ignorance, one does not fall away like a yellow fish.

original: ro // de bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phan yon smras pa /
analyzed: ro // de bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phan yon smras pa /
translated: Thus, the benefits of correct practice are stated:

original: sred pa drungs nas phyung shig dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sred pa drungs nas phyung shig dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Dig up craving!

original: phyung shig ces bya ba ni bton pa'o //
analyzed: phyung shig ces bya ba ni bton pa'o //
translated: Dig up means to pull out.

original: 'di rtsa ba nas bton pa gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba nas phyung ba'o //🔽de ltar rtsa ba nas byung bar gyur na mya ngan med cing zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di rtsa ba nas bton pa gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba nas phyung ba'o // de ltar rtsa ba nas byung bar gyur na mya ngan med cing zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: That which is pulled out by the root is pulled out by the root.🔽When it is pulled out in that way, there is no sorrow.

original: de ltar byung ba'i dus na yang yid gdung ba med cing sdug bsngal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba'i dus na yang yid gdung ba med cing sdug bsngal ba med do //
translated: Even when it arises in that way, there is no mental anguish or suffering.

original: 'jigs pa med ces bya bas ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus sdug bsngal yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med ces bya bas ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus sdug bsngal yang med pa nyid do //
translated: The line no fear indicates that there is no future suffering.

original: gang gi phyir sred pa dang bcas pa rnams la ni da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang mya ngan yod pa yin la ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal ba ste 'jigs pa yod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sred pa dang bcas pa rnams la ni da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang mya ngan yod pa yin la ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal ba ste 'jigs pa yod do //
translated: Because those who are attached have present suffering and sorrow, and in the future they have fear, i.e., suffering.

original: gzhan dag @115a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag @115a * //
translated: Others,

original: ni gdul bya nye bar gnas pa dag la tshig rkang drug gis yang dag par len pa dag ste /
analyzed: ni gdul bya nye bar gnas pa dag la tshig rkang drug gis yang dag par len pa dag ste /
translated: for those to be trained who are present, there are six lines that are the correct grasps.

original: rgan po dang bar ma dang gsar bu rnams la tshig rkang snga ma gnyis kyis ni yang dag par gzengs bstod cing yang dag par 'jug pa dag spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgan po dang bar ma dang gsar bu rnams la tshig rkang snga ma gnyis kyis ni yang dag par gzengs bstod cing yang dag par 'jug pa dag spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the old, the middle-aged, and the young, the first two lines are the correct encouragement and correct engagement, in order to generate enthusiasm.

original: tshig rkang phyi ma gnyis kyis ni yang dag par bsgrub pa dag la phyin ci ma log par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig rkang phyi ma gnyis kyis ni yang dag par bsgrub pa dag la phyin ci ma log par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The last two lines are the correct practice, in order to induce unmistaken grasping.

original: tshig rkang gsum pa gnyis kyis ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ni bsdus pa'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshig rkang gsum pa gnyis kyis ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ni bsdus pa'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The third and fourth lines show the benefit of right practice. This is the condensed meaning.

original: 'di ni sred pa spang ba la gzud pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni sred pa spang ba la gzud pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: This was spoken in order to introduce the abandonment of craving.

original: yang sred pa skye ba nyid ni skyon ma lus pa'i dra ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yang sred pa skye ba nyid ni skyon ma lus pa'i dra ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Moreover, the arising of craving itself is the net of all faults. In order to teach this, he says:

original: skyes bu sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “A person with craving” and so on.

original: 'di'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang gang zhig mi ldan par sems can rnams yun ring po'i dus su 'khyam zhing 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni ngas gcig kyang ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs nas
analyzed: 'di'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang gang zhig mi ldan par sems can rnams yun ring po'i dus su 'khyam zhing 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni ngas gcig kyang ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs nas
translated: The introduction to this is as follows: The Blessed One said, “I do not see even one thing that, when not abandoned, causes beings to wander for a long time in this world, going and coming, as it does when craving is not abandoned.”

original: / tshigs bcad gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: / tshigs bcad gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Then he spoke two verses.

original: kha cig ni dge slong dag 'jig rten ni sred pas 'khol cing thug pa med par 'gro ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni dge slong dag 'jig rten ni sred pas 'khol cing thug pa med par 'gro ste /
translated: Some say, “Monks, the world is boiled by craving and goes without limit.

original: de lhar skyes nas mir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lhar skyes nas mir 'gyur ro //
translated: Having been born as a god, he becomes a human.

original: mir skyes nas ji srid du dmyal ba'i bar du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mir skyes nas ji srid du dmyal ba'i bar du 'gyur te /
translated: Having been born as a human, he becomes a hell-being.

original: de lta bas na sred pa yongs su spongs shig dang / de nyid kyis khyod kyi sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na sred pa yongs su spongs shig dang / de nyid kyis khyod kyi sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, abandon craving, and by that alone your suffering will be exhausted.

original: gzhan dag ni lo drug cu'i bar du mngal du gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni lo drug cu'i bar du mngal du gnas te /
translated: Others say that the statement refers to those who remain in the womb for sixty years.

original: skra dkar dang gnyer ma byung zhing thig le nag pos lus nyams par byas pa'i rgan po zhig gi dbang du byas nas gsungs zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skra dkar dang gnyer ma byung zhing thig le nag pos lus nyams par byas pa'i rgan po zhig gi dbang du byas nas gsungs zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the statement refers to an old man whose hair has turned white, whose body is covered with wrinkles, and who is weakened by the black veins of old age.

original: de gnyis las re zhig dang po bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis las re zhig dang po bshad par bya ste /
translated: Of these two interpretations, we will explain the first one.🔽The verse states:

original: skyes bu sred pa dang 'grogs na //
analyzed: skyes bu sred pa dang 'grogs na //
translated: The person who is accompanied by craving🔽and who is bound by the fetters of grasping

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: enters the womb again and again.

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni sred pa dang 'grogs pa dang nye bar len pa gnyis kyis ni kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni sred pa dang 'grogs pa dang nye bar len pa gnyis kyis ni kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan to //
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows: The truth of origination is taught by “accompanied by craving” and “bound by the fetters of grasping.”

original: yang dang yang du mngal du 'jug / ces bya bas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang dang yang du mngal du 'jug / ces bya bas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan to //
translated: The truth of suffering is taught by “enters the womb again and again.”

original: sred pa'i gnyis pa gang ba'i skyes bu de ni sred pa'i gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i gnyis pa gang ba'i skyes bu de ni sred pa'i gnyis pa ste /
translated: The person who is filled with the second craving is the second craving.

original: sred pa'i grogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sred pa'i grogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is a companion of craving.

original: sred pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dang / sems can gyi rgyud de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //🔽skyes bu zhes bya ba ni rtsub pa la sogs pa'i las kyis gang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dang / sems can gyi rgyud de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro // skyes bu zhes bya ba ni rtsub pa la sogs pa'i las kyis gang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Because he follows craving and because he follows the stream of sentient beings.🔽The meaning of the term person is one who is filled with the karma of harshness, etc.

original: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ordinary man is one who is filled with the karma of harshness, etc.

original: yun @115b ring zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa ste /
analyzed: yun @115b ring zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa ste /
translated: Long means beginningless.

original: ji skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong dag skye ba'i 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag skye ba'i 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Monks, the cycle of birth is without beginning or end.”

original: dus zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dag tu zad pa ste /
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dag tu zad pa ste /
translated: Time means the exhaustion of saṃsāra.

original: mi rtag pas nyams par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pas nyams par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is destroyed by impermanence.

original: 'khyam 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: 'khyam 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: Wandering means saṃsāra.

original: 'gro ba'i 'gro ba dag tu las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i 'gro ba dag tu las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is action that goes to the destinations of beings in accordance with action.

original: ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhe na /🔽smras pa / yang dang yang du nyer len cing //
analyzed: ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhe na / smras pa / yang dang yang du nyer len cing //
translated: What does it do?🔽It is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It repeatedly appropriates.

original: rtag tu nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi nye bar len te /
analyzed: rtag tu nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi nye bar len te /
translated: It always appropriates the four kinds of appropriation.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dus pas ne bar len pa'i rkyen ni las yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so ;
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dus pas ne bar len pa'i rkyen ni las yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so ;
translated: The condition for appropriation is action, as stated in the verse.
